loans.name: El

texts.en:
El S., 53, is a widow who lives with four children in the outskirts of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 1993, she has been growing rice, corn, and beans to earn a living and is able to make around US$3 each day. She also gets support from three of her children who are garment factory workers.

Mrs. El S. says that every month she needs to spend around US$30 on food, US$5 on utilities, US$10 on her child's education, and US$5 on occasional transportation. She is asking for a loan of US$400 to purchase crops seeds for the next season.

loans.use: To purchase seeds.

loans.name: Mrs. Hum Yort's Group

texts.en:
The group loan consists of four people located in Chumteav Sok Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Hum Y., 35 years old and the mother of four children, is the group leader. Three of her children are attending the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Thoeurn Thorn, is a pig breeder who raises four pigs. Mrs. Hum Y. has a plot of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. On her plantation, she now faces a small problem because her rice field is infertile, thus badly affecting her crops. To solve this problem, Mrs. Hum Y. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to improve her field conditions and improve her crop growth.

All the members in the group have end-of-term loans and they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Him S., 44, is a mother of five children who lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 2004, she has been making a kind of Khmer cake for sale at the market and is able to earn around US$3.50 a day. Her husband, Sudh Soeun, 46, is a rice farmer and he also grows corn and beans. He says that to be a farmer is hard and requires a lot of labor to work in the rice field. On average, he makes US$2.50 each day. Mrs. Him S. would like to take out a loan of US$900 to purchase crop seeds and insecticide and to raise pigs.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and raise pigs.

loans.name: Mr. Net Sopheak's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Net S. is the group leader of five loan members who live in Chres Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a fisherman and his wife, Mrs. Bork La, is a farmer who cultivates vegetable. They are married without any children. Although they work in different businesses, they still experience poor living conditions. Mr. Net S. is asking for a loan to buy two pigs to start a pig breeding business. He hopes this business will help improve his family's living conditions.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy two pigs to start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Mrs. Morn Kungmonech's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn K. is the group leader of four loan members who live in Klaeng Poar Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Morn K. is 28 years old and the mother of two children who are both attending a local school. She is a laborer who earns a small income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Pov Sam Arn, is a construction worker. Even though Mrs. Morn K. and her husband work in different businesses, they still cannot support their family sufficiently. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Morn K. is asking for a loan to buy four piglets to start a pig breeding business.

One among four in this group has end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy four piglets to start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Hai Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hải 50 tuổi tham gia Qũy năm 2003. Kinh tế gia đình được cải thiên hơn so với lúc chưa tham gia vào Quỹ . Các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ đều được gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà, ngan. Với thuận lợi gia đình chị có ao nên việc đầu tư vào nuôi thả cá cũng là lựa chọn của gia đình chị. Hiện tại gia đình chị đang nuôi 20 con lợn thịt, 2000 cá rô phi và 200 gà và ngan. Chị có 3 con, 2 người con đã trưởng thành,1 con đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000 đầu tư vào mua giống lợn, gà, cá.
Thu nhập bình quân 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hai Thi N. is a 50 year old woman. Since she joined the TYM fund in 2003, her family’s financial situation has been much improved. She cleverly invested loans in pigs and poultries such as chickens and ducks. Besides, in her pond, she also raised fish. At the moment, the family is taking care of 20 pigs, 20 fish, and 200 poultries. She has 3 children, 2 of whom has grown up. The third is going to school. She plans to make the next loan of 15,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy more pigs, fish and chickens. The family’s income is 6,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Mien Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Miền 49 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2004, chị có 2 con hiện tại các con chị đang còn đi học. Chồng chị mất sớm nên mọi công việc trong gia đình từ nhỏ đến lớn chị đều phải là người lo liệu. Tham gia vào Qũy chị vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Hiện tại chị còn làm thêm nghề nấu rượu phục vụ cho bà con quanh địa phương, bã rượu được chị tận dụng làm thức ăn cho lợn. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 9.000.000 đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn.
Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mien Thi N. is a 49 year old woman. She has 2 children who are going to school. Since her husband passed away early, she takes care of the family. In 2004, she joined the TYM fund, and borrowed money to invest in pigs and chickens. She also learned to make wine and sold it in the local market. The production waste was used to feed pigs. She plans to make the next loan of 9,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to raise more pigs. The family’s income is 4,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Linh Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Linh 49 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2002. Các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, trồng trọt và kinh doanh cửa hàng văn phòng phẩm, đồ dùng gia dụng. Công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị ngày một phát triển, kinh tế gia đình ổn định hơn, chồng chị là cán bộ xã nghỉ hưu lương tháng ổn định, con trai đi làm thu nhập hàng tháng ổn định 1.500.000đ, 1 con còng nhỏ đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 20.000.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng kinh doanh văn phòng phẩm.
Thu nhập bình quân: 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Linh Thi P., a 49-year-old woman, joined the TYM fund in 2002. She made loans to invest in farming and to open a grocery store. Her business gradually flourishes, and her family’s financial situation has improved. Her husband is a retiree and has monthly pension. One of her sons has income of 1,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month; the other is still going to school. She plans to make the next loan of 20,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to invest more in the store. The family’s income is 5,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in grocery store

loans.name: Mrs. Sim Ry Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim R. is a group leader of six who all live in Trapang Rang Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a groceR. store in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it and she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceR. inventoR.. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Kheiv Thorn, helps her in the store. Mrs. Sim R. is 53 years old and the mother of three childR., one of whom is employed in a garment factoR. while the others are construction workers. 

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the veR. end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy grocery store inventory.

loans.name: Tojikul

texts.en: Tojikul F. is a responsible father of four children who has always watched over his family’s financial security. He accomplishes this by means of caring for his animals on a daily basis. He clearly remembers the time when he decided to become independent, with a small number of animals and a small patch of land. When he got married, he only owned a few number of cattle. Now, thanks to his efforts and dedication, he owns four cows to fatten and sell at the local market. He holds high hopes for the present season. He wants to provide a secure environment for his family and save the money needed for the marriage of his adult sons. For this purpose, Tojikul requests a loan of 2000 Somoni (S600 USD) for the term of 12 months in order to purchase more cattle. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Mrs. Oem Sarad's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This group of nine people is located in Trapang Rang Village in Kampong Chhnang Province and the members will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Oem S. was selected as the group leader; she is currently in the business of selling clothes. In her business, she sells all kinds of clothes, especially those for the young generation. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it and has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more fashion clothes to re-sell. Her husband, Mr. Hoeng Sok, helps her in the business. Mrs. Oem S. is 46 years old and the mother of seven children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one is a construction worker. The remaining five children attend the local school. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Seven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more fashion clothes to re-sell.

loans.name: Goib

texts.en:
Goib M. is 45 years old. He is married and has three children. Goib is a hard-working man who, while continuing to work another job, started his own business as a source of additional income and savings in case of unemployment. He knew many people who purchased cattle, and this motivated him to start his own business 20 years ago. With time, he has increased his sales and now he needs assistance investing in his business, which has been going well and which he would like to continue to grow. 

Goib is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) to buy cattle; he will reinvest the capital to grow his business as he has been doing. He is offering to repay the loan in 12 months. With the profit from this loan, he wants to support his children with their education. His elder son is studying in a military college and his daughter is studying foreign languages at the University. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in continuing this business and helping them give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: N. Dilorom is 45 years old. She is married and has two children who go to school. Dilorom is a market vendor. She has been selling men's underwear and socks in the local market of Istaravshan town. With a business like this, Dilorom has been feeding her children and husband, who is an invalid, for 10 years. Dilorom started this business seven years ago. Little by little, thanks to her passion for making sales and her personality, she has been increasing her number of clients and making her business grow. At this moment, Dilorom is requesting a loan that she will invest in purchasing more merchandise to meet the demands of her clients. She promises to repay this loan in 12 months. She is planning to spend the profit on the treatment of her dearest husband. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: Purchasing of the underwear and socks for men in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Zafarjon

texts.en: N. Zafarjon is a young livestock farmer who sells meat in the local market. This work is his only source of income for supporting his wife and their four children. He is 31 years old and carries an immense responsibility on his shoulders. He knows that he cannot give himself the luxury of rest because each moment counts toward increasing his productivity. In spite of leading a young family with lots of enthusiasm, he understands that to grow his business he needs additional money for investment capital. For this reason he is asking your help for a loan of 2200 Somoni ($650 USD). He will invest this money in his farm and purchase small animals so that, over time, he will increase his capital and improve the quality of life for his family. He promises to repay the loan within 12 months. If you are able to help Zafarjon please do so. He needs people like you to help him.

loans.use: Purchase farm animals

loans.name: Ulfatmo

texts.en: Ulfatmo R. is a woman with a great drive to better herself, and this positive outlook on life has led her to make progress little by little. She is married and the loving mother of four children. For the past year, she has been continuously devoted to selling animals. This business has given her great satisfaction because it allows her to earn a considerable amount of the income. She exerts herself daily so that all of her children can have access to an adequate education and grow up to become good men. Now Ulfatmo is planning to expand her business and to buy more sheep. It is for this reason that she’s requesting a loan of 2200 Somoni ($650 USD) for the term of 12 months. She kindly thanks for your generosity.

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Jobir

texts.en: T. Jobir is 34 years old. He is married and he has 4 children. He works in agriculture and has always been efficient in his labors. The role of father, which he has carried out for 10 years, has helped him to understand the sacrifice and hard labor of the women of the house. He has grown potatoes and apples for six years. He dreams that all of his children will be well educated, to ensure them a bright future, That’s why he works from early morning until late at night. He is requesting a loan so he can buy potato bags. He will also use part of the loan to hire workers and pay for transportation. When the season comes, he wants to sell potatoes in bags for a higher price. This request is in support of making his dream come true, and he is asking for help from your generous heart.

loans.use: Purchasing bags for potatoes and apples.

loans.name: Munavar

texts.en: V. Munavar is a very diligent 46-year-old woman. She is married and she has four children. Her husband is a doctor. Thanks to her parents' seeding skills she is very familiar with agriculture work. Her mother gave her farming fields ten years ago and she has been working them ever since. This activity has helped to pay the expenses of her family and to give an education to her four children. She wishes to improve the quality of her products and is requesting this loan so she can acquire seeds and mineral fertilizers in order to obtain excellent products for this harvesting season.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anvarali

texts.en: A. Anvarali is 47 years old. He lives in Isfara town. He is married and has three children. Anvarali is processing and selling dried apricots in the central local market. He is experienced in the business of making dried apricots. Anvarali is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults thanks to his example. He purchases dried fruits in the market and processes them together with his wife and his younger son. Because he buys dried apricot wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. All this allows Anvarali to make his business quite successful and it brings in a stable income for the family. Today he is requesting a loan to purchase more dried apricots to process and sell. He expresses his gratitude to everyone who supports him.

loans.use: Increasing inventory

loans.name: Kayi Amewoene

texts.fr: A. Kayi Amewoene est âgé de 28 ans et pharmacienne de profession. Elle est  mariée et mère de deux enfants. Mme A. tient un dépôt de pharmacie et de produits esthétiques à  Lomé la capitale Togolaise. Madame est une commerçante honnête qui veut gagner la confiance de ses clients, de ses fournisseurs et de ses créanciers.  Elle prend toujours son affaire au sérieux et désire par cette chance de Kiva et ce premier crédit de FECECAV faire des approvisionnements en produits pharmaceutiques et tirer rapidement un bénéfice de cet investissement; ce faisant ainsi elle pourra gagner la confiance de soi et prendre en partie les charges du ménage.
texts.en:
A. Kayi Amewoene, age 28, is a pharmacist by profession. She is married and the mother of two children. Ms. A. has a pharmacy and beauty products warehouse in Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is an honest merchant who want to win the trust of her customers, suppliers, and lenders. She always takes her business seriously and wishes to use this Kiva opportunity and initial FECECAV loan to stock up on pharmaceutical products and to derive quickly a profit from this investment. And thus, she can gain self-confidence and take care of a portion of household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical and beauty products for reslale

loans.name: Beatrice James's Jumuiya Kiluvya Group

texts.en:
Beatrice J., age 42, is single with two children (ages 25 and 18). She has a business of selling vouchers which she started 3 years ago. She works from 7.30am to 7pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $60.

In the past, Beatrice has taken out three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to start selling sodas. She paid back her loans successfully. She hopes for a new loan to increase her stock of sodas and vouchers. Beatrice will share this loan with her group, Jumuiya Kuluvya, which totals 16 members. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Beatrice is second from right in a white blouse.

loans.use: To increase on stock of vouchers and sodas

loans.name: Teu

texts.en: Teu P., 37, is married and lives with three children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 2004, she has been growing lotus for sale. On average, she is able to make around US$3 each day. Her husband, Nuon Neng, 39, catches fish from the river and sells his catch to the market to earn approximately US$3 each day as well. This couple also receives support from one of their children, who is a garment factory worker. Mrs. Teo P. is asking a loan of US$400 to purchase a wooden boat, its motor, and fishing nets for her husband to catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase a wooden boat, its motor, and fishing nets.

loans.name: Kholdor

texts.en: M. Kholdor is 38 years old. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is a housekeeper and she is taking care of their children. He has a minivan and he provides transportation services for passengers within the city of Isfara. By doing this business for 3 years, he has gained a rich experience. Initially, he rented the car, but eventually after saving up for it, he bought his own minivan. The business is stable and generates the family's primary source of income, which allows them to improve their living conditions. Now, Kholdor is planning to fix his car in order to provide services of higher quality. He needs to purchase spare parts and to pay for the repair of the minivan. That is why he is requesting this loan. He thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: Minivan repair

loans.name: Ven

texts.en:
Ven N., 51, is married and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 2003, she has worked collecting rice from house to house for sale. On average, she is able to make around US$4 each day. She says that currently it is difficult to purchase rice because most of the farmers have had a poor harvest. Her husband, Ong Oun, 54, is a rice farmer and normally he makes US$3 each day.

Ven N. would like to take out a loan of US$1,000 to increase her rice stock and to raise pigs for additional profit. In the future, she plans to purchase a mill with which to provide a grinding service as well.

loans.use: To add increase rice inventory and raise pigs.

loans.name: Srou

texts.en:
Srou E., 44, is a silk weaver in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. The silk dress is a kind of Khmer traditional uniform, worn during the P'chum Ben ceremony and Khmer New Year. Normally hand-woven silk is more expensive than machine-woven, but people themselves prefer the hand-woven material. Srou has been weaving since 2003 and on average she makes around US$2.50 profit each day. To make one silk dress takes about 7-10 days.

Her husband, Tean Tith, 46, is one of the rice farmers in the village. He also grows vegetables such as corn, cucumbers, and so on. He sells his produce in the market and is able to make around US$2.50 in profit each day, too. This couple has five children, two of whom are students and three of whom are garment factory workers. Srou E. says that she spends monthly around US$40 for food, US$5 on utilities, and US$10 on her children's education. Mrs. Srou has requested a loan of US$800 to raise pigs and purchase crop seeds and insecticide for her husband.

loans.use: To raise pigs and purchase seeds and insecticide

loans.name: Pheun

texts.en:
Pheun T., 48, is married and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 1999, she has worked as a weaver to earn a living and is able to make around US$2 each day. The silk dress is a kind of Khmer traditional uniform and people wear it during Khmer New Year or the P'chum Ben ceremony. It is expensive and it takes a long time to complete each dress. Pheun T.'s husband, Deu Ny, 47, sells Khmer cake at the open air market and usually earns around US$3.50 per day. This coupl has four children, three of whom are students and one that is employed.

Pheun is seeking a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a generator and musical instruments to provide music whenever the villagers have a party or a wedding. This might increase the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a generator and musical instruments.

loans.name: Ngn

texts.en: Ngn A., 40, is a widow who lives with two of her children. Living in Phnom Penh, she is able to make around US$4 from selling groceries. She has been doing that since 2007 but she is faced with competition from a few other vendors who operate the same type of business. She said that to gain more customers first she needs to diversify her inventory. Currently, she has requested a loan of US$600 to add to her grocery's inventory. In the future, she plans to set up another business selling rice and porridge. She wants all of her children to get a Bachelor degree.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Om

texts.en:
Om P. is a 51-year-old weaver of silk dresses and she also operates a recycling business. With the two businesses she is able to make around US$2 each day and she has been doing so since 2002. She says that mostly she spends time at home weaving because it requires less labor than recycling. She learned how to weave from her mother and began weaving before she was married. She makes the kind of dress that people wear during Khmer New Year or the P'chum Ben ceremony. It is expensive and takes 7-10 days to complete each dress.

Om P.'s husband, Mao Nuon, 70, is a rice farmer and makes around US$2.50 each day. He grows two times each year, as do most of Cambodia's farmers. In the dry season, it takes around 3-4 months of work to get to harvest and 6-7 months in the rainy season. Rice that grows in the rainy season is much more expensive than that of the dry season, and people prefer the rice of the rainy season. Mao Nuon says that the farmer's life is difficult, working very hard for little profit and sometimes facing crop damage because of drought.

Om P. is requesting a loan of US$700 to raise pigs and to increase her recycling business.

loans.use: To raise pigs and increase a recycling business

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru: Пак Татьяна жительница района Джиликуль. Возраст 26 лет.Образование средне-техническое.По специальности парикмахер.Клиентка имеет салон по прокату  свадебных платьев. Занимается этим бизнесом 2 года.На кредит хочет купить свадебные платья.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Tatyana P. is 26 and lives in Jilikul district. Ms. P. finished cosmetology school, where she was trained as a hairstylist. She owns a shop where she rents wedding dresses to brides. Tatyana has been in business for two years. She is applying for credit to purchase more wedding dresses and plans to repay the loan within a year.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase wedding dresses

loans.name: Om

texts.en: Om Y., 45, is a widow who lives in the Phnom Penh with five children. She makes about US$3 daily by selling groceries, while two of her children make US$5.50 as a technician and garment factory worker. Om Y. is asking for a loan in the amount of US$800 to purchase more grocery inventory to expand her current shop. She is also hoping to purchase a pig to raise and sell with the money from the loan. She sees this loan as a great opportunity to expand her business and is confident that she will see her income increase as a result.

loans.use: Grocery stuff and raise pigs.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.ru: Хаитов Хамза  житель района Джиликуль.Возраст 51 год,женат, имеет 7 детей.Клиент занимается садоводством. У него есть небольшой фруктовый сад.Каждый год ,собрав урожай,клиент делает запасы на зиму,а  лишнее реализует на рынке по выгодной ему цене.В данный момент многие деревья в его саду  не плодоносят.Поэтому клиент хочет купить на кредит новые саженцы и минеральные удобрения.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hamza H., 51, lives in Jilikul district. Mr. H. is married with seven children. He has a small orchard where he grows fruits for a living. Each year, Mr. H. sets aside a portion of the harvest for his own family to use over the winter and sells the rest for good prices at the market. Currently, many trees in Mr. H.'s orchard are not bearing fruit. He is applying for a loan to purchase new transplant stock and fertilizer. He plans to repay the loan within a year.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong S., 54, is married with four children living at home in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She weaves silk dresses, typically making US$2 each day and her husband is a rice farmer. Her husband, Liv Nhan, 61, typically makes about US$2.50 each day. Two of their children also weave silk dresses. Hong S. would like a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike and also to purchase rice seed and fertilizers for her husband. This loan would allow their family to increase their profits.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike, rice seed, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina I. was born in 1952. She is married and a mother of seven children. Due to poverty and the untimely death of her parents she was unable to satisfy her educational ambitions. She has now promised to do everything within her power to see that her children attend and satisfy their educational desires. With these ambitions she decided to get help from GHAPE.

	She became a member of GHAPE in 2002 and has successfully borrowed and repaid loans amounting to $400. Christina invested these loans in rearing fowls, rearing goats, and farming crops like cassava, yams, and beans. She also invested part of the loan in a garden, building a house, and buying and selling palm oil. The profit of these loans helped her in providing and education for her children.

	With this loan she plans to continue buying and reselling palm oil. She is convinced that her business is going to be successful because she has been in this business from the day she took her first loans, she has a lot of experience in this business. Also, there is high demand for palm oil in her local community, as palm oil is one of the basic needs of each household. Christina says the profit of this loan will be use to further the education of her children.

loans.use: To increase her palm oil inventory

loans.name: Davlathudo

texts.ru: Хосиятов Давлатхудо житель района Джиликуль .Возраст  45 года,женат,имеет 4 детей. Образование высшее,по специальности преподаватель.Работает в средней школе  района.Но так как заработная плата очень маленькая, клиент занимается куплей продажей фруктов.Он скупает у местных крестьян фрукты и реализует их на рынке.На доход от  торговли он содержит свою большую семью. На полученный кредит Давлатхудо хочет увеличить  денежный оборот.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев
texts.en:
Davlathudo H. lives in the Jilikul region. He is 45 years old, is married and has 4 children. Davlathudo has a college education and is a teacher by profession. He works at the regional high school. Because his salary is very small, the client also purchases and sells fruits. He purchases fruits from local farmers and sells them at the market. Davlathudo uses the profits from this business to support his large family. He will use his loan to increase his working capital. Davlathudo plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Sin S., 43, is married and lives with four of her children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a garment factory worker who typically makes about US$2.50 each day and is further supported by three of her children who also work in the garment factory. Her husband, Chhen Oeun, is a rice farmer and he makes around US$2 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Sin S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase fertilizer and land for her husband to grow more rice. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family. (Sin S. was not available so one of her daughters is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and land to grow more rice.

loans.name: Bich

texts.en: Mr. Bich C. is a villager in Preek Ta Ong Ti Pie Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. He and his wife, Mrs. Phlong Sam Oun, are fruit sellers in the local market. Since their business is going well, they want to expand it. Mr. Bich C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit to re-sell to their customers. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this new loan.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fruit to re-sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.ru: Резвонова Шарифа  жительница района Джиликуль.Возраст 44года,женат,имеет 2 детей.Образование средне-техническое.По специальности продавец.Клиентка имеет на местном рынке  торговую точку.Торгует посудой и бытовой техникой. Имеет опыт в бизнесе 4 года.Торговля является единственным источником дохода ее семьи.На полученный кредит Шарифа хочет увеличить ассортимент торговой точки.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sharifa R. lives in the Jilikul region. She is 44 years old, is married and has 2 children. She has a high school-technical education and is a salesperson by profession. The client has a sales location at the local market. She sells dishes and household appliances. Sharifa has 4 years of experience in this business. Her business is the sole source of income for her family. Sharifa plans to use her loan to increase the product assortment at her sales location. She plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao S., 27, is married and lives with her husband and one little child in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a garment factory worker and makes US$2.50 each day. Her husband works growing rice, corn, and beans, making US$3 each day. Sao S. is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase a water pump, fertilizers, and rice seeds for her husband. She sees this purchase as a good investment to expand her husband's business, and she is confident it will increase the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, fertilizers, and rice seeds.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina S., 29, is a widow with two sons (ages 13 and 18). She has a food vendor business which she started in 2007 and a restaurant she started this year. She works from 6am to 6pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of around $181.

She has taken out three previous loans from Tujijene Tanzania, which she has paid back successfully. She hopes for a new loan to buy rice, sugar, flour, and oil for the restaurant. She belongs to the group Manyara, whose members guarantee the repayment of loans for one another.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar , flour, and oil

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng S. lives in Boeng Krum Leu Village in Kandal Province. She is a breeder who raises 14 pigs. Because her pigs now are bigger and bigger, she cannot afford to buy pig food; so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more pig food to feed her pigs. Her husband, Mr. Soeng Ravoeurn, helps her in the current business. Mrs. Seng S. is 29 years old and the mother of two children. One child is attending the local school, and the younger one is four years old and thus too young to work or study. Mrs. Seng S.’s husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more pig food to feed her pigs

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Adjowa A.  est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est boulangère et habite à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Madame fabrique et revend des pains  depuis plus de 5 ans. La particularité de ce travail consiste à avoir assez de stock de farine de blé et de bois de chauffage .Elle tient son activité au serieux et ne fait pas de doute avec ce second crédit de FECECAV. Ce crédit lui permettra d'augmenter la capacité de son activité qui lui assurera une bonne marge à la revente et tirer rapidement un bénéfice de cet investissement et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Adjowa A. is 38 years old, married and the mother of three children. She is a baker and lives in Lomé, the Togolese capital. She has made and sold bread for five years. In her line, it is important to have enough wheat flour and firewood on hand. Adjowa takes her business seriously and has not any doubts about a second loan with FECECAV. This loan would permit her to expand her business, assuring her of a substantial sales margin to make a quick profit from this investment to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of wheat flour and firewood

loans.name: Mork

texts.en:
Mrs. Mork S. E. is a farmer in BoE. Krum Kraom Village in Kandal Province. On her plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile, which has a bad affect on her crop. In order to solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizers to enrich her field and make her crop more productive. With the remaining money, she would buy fuel for her pump to water her crop.

Mrs. Mork S. E. is a 49-year-old widow with six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while another one is a driver. The remaining children are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to enrich her field and make her crop more productive

loans.name: Ilhomuddin

texts.ru: Зарипов Илхомуддин житель района Джиликуль.Возраст  35 лет,женат,имеет 5 детей.Образование средне-техническое ,по специальности  шофер.Клиент занимается животноводством.Имеет опыт  6 лет.Помогает ему его жена. Она реализует на рынке  молоко и кисло-молочную продукцию.В данный момент вырос спрос на ее продукцию.Поэтому Илхомуддин решил купить еще одну дойную корову.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ilhomuddin Z. lives in the Djilikul region. He is 35 years old, married and has five children. He has secondary technical education and is a driver by profession. He also does animal husbandry and has six years of experience. His wife is also helping him. She sells milk and other milk products on the market. At this time the demand for her products has increased. This is why Ilhomuddin has decided to buy another milk cow. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en: Chheang S. L., 37, is a widow and has a business selling rice at the market. Living in Phnom Penh, she typically makes US$4 everyday and is aided by two nephews who work as mechanics. It has been a difficult year economically in much of Cambodia. As a rice vendor, Chheang S. L. is taking a lot of the brunt of the economic downturn. That is why she has approached CREDIT [Kiva’s Field Partner] with a request for a loan. Chheang S. L. is asking for a loan of US$1200 to set up another business selling groceries and to buy more mechanic tools for her nephews, a purchase that she sees as a good opportunity to increase her income.

loans.use: To set up another business selling groceries and to buy mechanic tools.

loans.name: Nao

texts.en: Mrs. Nao O. is a villager in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. She owns a small store where she sells dried fish. Because this business is going well, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more dried fish to meet her customers' demand. Her husband, Mr. Sieng Koem Yean, is a constructiO. worker who can make less income to support his family. Mrs. Nao O. is 56 years old and the mother of five children – four of whom are employed in different businesses, while the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband is O. the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Mrs. Suon T. owns a small store where she can sell drinks in Preak Thom village in Kandal province. Because this business is going well, she wants to expand it; so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more drinks to re-sell to her customers. She hopes she can increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is a 38-year-old widow with three children – two of whom are construction workers, while the other is four years old and thus too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to re-sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rahmonali

texts.ru: Курбоналиев Рахмонали житель района Джиликуль .Возраст 26 лет, женат.Образование  средне-техническое.По специальности продавец.Клиент занимается животноводством.Имеет опыт в этой сфере более 6 лет. Рахманали покупает на местном рынке молодых бычков,откармливает их и реализует на местном рынке.Бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи.На полученный кредит клиент хочет купить 2-х бычков.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rahmonali K. lives in the Djilikul region. He is 26 years old and married. He has secondary technical education. His specialty is a salesperson. His business is animal husbandry and he has more than six years experience in this field. Rahmanali buys young calves on the local market, feeds them and then resells on the same market. This business is the only source of income for this family. Rahmonali wants to use the loan to buy two more calves. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mrs. Meas S. is a villager in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. She is a housewife who cooks very delicious food for her household. Her husband, Mr. Meas Saroeurn, is a construction worker who can make little income to support his family. Mrs. Meas S. is 50 years old and the mother of three children – one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another one is a laborer. The youngest one is attending the local school. Since the third child's school is far from home, Mrs. Meas S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for that child to travel to school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child to travel to school.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch L., 48, is a widow living in the Phnom Penh with her four children. Since 2001, she has been operating a grocery store to earn a living and is able to make around US$5 each day. She is aided by her children, who are employed as garment factory workers. Currently, she is still looking after her elderly mother. Touch L. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to add to the grocery store's inventory. She believes this opportunity will be able to raise her standard of living. (Touch L., wearing a red shirt, was pictured with her mother at their home.)

loans.use: To add to her grocery's inventory.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Mrs. Tep M., her husband, Mr. Toem Oeurn (shown at the left in the photo), and their four children live in Chroy Ambel Village in Kandal Province. He is a teacher and makes $30 per month. Three of their children are employed in different businesses while the youngest one is attending the local school.

Mrs. Tep M. owns a grocery store business with a lot of customers and demand. Since her business is going well, she would like to buy more grocery products to add to her inventory. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for her inventory

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Зоиров Джамшед житель района Вахш.Возраст  26 лет, женат, имеет 2 детей.Клиент занимается куплей продажей женских и мужских носков. Торгует на рынке города Курган-Тюбе.Осенью на его  товар большой спрос.Поэтому клиент решил закупить больше товара.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Jamshed Z. lives in the Vakhsh region. He is 26 years old, is married and has 2 children. The client purchases and sells women’s and men’s socks. He sells his products at the market in Kurgan-Tube. Jamshed’s products are in high demand in the fall and he has decided to purchase additional products for sale. He plans to pay back his loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for sale

loans.name: Oung

texts.en: Oung S., 56, is a widow and lives with three children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been planting many kinds of vegetables and selling them to the market, making around US $3.00 each day. She also gets support for her family from one of her children who works selling porridge. Oung S. is asking for a loan of US $900 to purchase more land to grow vegetables and to buy good seeds as well.

loans.use: To purchase more land and seeds to grow vegetables

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Mr. Sen S. H., 41, and his wife, Mrs. Pov Chantha, live in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. His wife is on the right in the photo. He is a farmer and his wife is a garment factory worker. They have three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one attends the local school.

Because his field is far from the water source, he uses a pump to get water to his crop. He needs hoses for his pump and is asking for a loan to buy hoses for irrigation.

loans.use: To buy hoses to get water to his crop.

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Кодиров Исмоил житель города Курган-Тюбе.Возраст 31 года,женат,имеет 1 ребенка.Образование среднее.Клиент имеет торговую точку на рынке.Торгует женской и мужской парфюмерией.Занимается торговлей  более 3 лет. На доход от торговли клиент содержит семью.В данный момент Исмоил  хочет увеличить ассортимент торговой точки.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ismoil K. is a resident of Qurgan-Tube. He is 31 years old, is married and has 1 child. Ismoil has a high school education. He has a sales location at the market. He sells women’s and men’s perfume. He has been in this business for 3 years. Ismoil uses the profits from his business to support his family. At the moment, Ismoil would like to increase the product assortment at his sales location. He plans to pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Soam

texts.en:
Soam B., 27, of Phnom Penh is an expert in using beads and other materials to make flower decorations on womens dresses. She has been working at it since 2005 and typically makes US $2.50 each day. Such decorated dresses are a kind of Khmer traditional dress that people wear during the Water Festival, P'chum Ben or Khmer New Year. Each dress is expensive because it takes around 7-10 days to complete one, but most people prefer the handmade over those made by machines. She learned how to decorate from her mother and she has been doing that business since she is not married yet.

Soam B. would like to set up another business selling groceries in order to increase her daily income. This loan of US $400 would allow her to set up a grocery business.

loans.use: To set up a business selling groceries

loans.name: Athuman Magesa"s Manyara Group

texts.en:
Athuman M., 40, is married and has four children (ages 16, 12, 8, and 3). He has a charcoal business which he started in 1998. He works from 7am to 6pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of around $172.

Athuman has taken out three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he paid back successfully. He is now selling both wholesale and retail. He now hopes for a new loan to increase his stock. Athuman will share this loan with his Manyara subgroup members, who have businesses selling clothes or as food venders. Members of Manyara guarantee the repayment of loans for each other.

In the picture, Athuman is in the white shirt on the right.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Ramazon

texts.ru: Назаров Рамазон  житель  города Курган –Тюбе.Возраст 57 лет,женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее.Клиент занимается куплей продажей мужской одежды.Занимается этим бизнесом более 2 лет.Бизнес помогает емй содержать свою семью.Так как работает в семье только он.Жена занимается ведением домашнего хозяйство.На полученный кредит хочет увеличить ассортимент торговой точки.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ramazon N. is a resident of Qurgan-Tube. He is 57 years old, is married and has 4 children. Ramazon has a high school education. He buys and sells men’s clothing. Ramazon has been in this business for 2 years. The business helps him to support his family as he is the only one working; his wife is a homemaker. Ramazon plans to use the loan to increase his product assortment. He plans to pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Mrs. Lon S., 44, lives in Preak Thom village in Kandal province with her husband, Mr. Khieng Sovannara, and their two children. She is a vegetable seller in the local market and her husband is a construction worker who makes a small income to support the family. Their youngest child is one year old and the older child is employed in a garment factory.

Since her first child's work place is far from home, Mrs. Lon S. spends a lot of money on transportation. In order to save money on transportation, Mrs. Lon S. has been saving to buy a motorbike for her child to go to work. She is requesting a loan to add to her savings.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child to go to work.

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Chhem R., 33, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh. She works as a rice farmer and sells the rice in the market, making about US $3.00 each day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver who makes around US $2.50 each day.

The weather conditions have not been favorable for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices, especially rice, to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Chhem R. included. In light of the struggling economy, she sees an opportunity to increase her income and is asking for a loan in the amount of US $1200 to purchase good rice seed, insecticide, and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.use: To purchase good rice seed, insecticide, and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mrs. San R., 26, is a widow with a child who is attending the local school in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who now faces an obstacle because her field is infertile. To solve this problem, Mrs. San R. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to improve her field to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve her field and make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.ru: Шомахмадова Мархамат жительница города Курган-Тюбе.Возраст 35 лет,замужем,имеет 3 детей.Образование средне-техническое.По специальности  учительница. Клиентка имеет небольшую торговую точку на местном рынке. На котором торгует  женской обувью.Этот вид деятельности позволяет ей содержать свою семью.Так как муж клиентки временно не работает. Мархамат на полученный кредит планирует закупить товар.Погасит кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Marhamat S. is a resident of Qurgan-Tube. She is 35 years old, is married and has 3 children. She has a high school – technical education and is a teacher by profession. Marhamat has a small sales location at the local market where she sells women’s shoes. This business allows her to support her family as her husband is temporarily not working. Marhamat will use her loan to purchase products for sale. She will pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for sale

loans.name: Nie

texts.en:
Nie Y., 49, is married with one child and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works out of her home as a medicine seller, making around US $3.50 each day. Her husband is a farmer who grows rice and corn and is able to generate US $2.50 each day as well.

Nie Y. is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase more medicine to help her generate more income. She would also like to purchase a water pump. She believes that this loan can raise her standard of living and provide valuable resources for her family.

loans.use: To purchase medicine to sell and a water pump.

loans.name: Yean

texts.en:
Mrs. Yean S., 29, is married and the mother of a young child. They live in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. She owns a pool table which she makes a profit from. Her husband, Mr. Hon Socheat, is a motorbike taxi driver.

He is unable to earn much income because his motorbike is too old and he must spend a lot of money on gas for it. In order to earn enough money to support his family, he wants to replace his motorbike and his wife is requesting a loan to add to her savings in order to buy a motorbike for her husband's business.

loans.use: To add to her savings in order to buy a motorbike for her husband's business.

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
Nuon S., 36, is a widow living in Phnom Penh with her two children. She decorates handicrafts and typically makes US $3.00 a day. Her son helps her and works as mechanic for a Honda company. She learned how to decorate clothes using beads and other materials from her mother and has been doing that business since before she was married. Most housewives are in the same business and they learn from one another. It takes about 5-8 days to complete one dress and it is also expensive. People wear these decorated dresses during the P'chum Ben ceremony, Water Festival, Khmer New Year, or for weddings.

Because now the rate of inflation is out of control, this work alone is not enough to support her family. Nuon S. is asking a loan of US $1000 to set up a stand out of her home selling vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: To set up a stand out of her home selling vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Mahmadsharif

texts.ru: Камчинов Махмадшариф  житель района А.Джоми.Возраст 48 лет, женат, имеет 5 детей . Образование высшее, по специальности инженер.Клиент работает по специальности, но заработная плата маленькая.Поэтому клиент и его семья занимаются  сельским хозяйством.Махмадшариф сеет кукурузу и пшеницу. Собрав урожай ,он делает запасы на год,а лишнее реализует на рынке.В данный моменнт клиент хочет закупить качественные семена и минеральные удобрения.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahmadsharif K. lives in the A. Djomi region. He is 48 years old, married and has five children. He has highest education in engineering. He works by his profession, but his salary is very small. This is why he and his family are in the agriculture business. Mahmadsharif sows corn and wheat. When he gathers the harvest he stocks up for the year ahead and then sells the rest on the market. At this time, he wants to buy quality seeds and mineral fertilizer. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizer and GSM

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run T., 24, is married with two young children and lives in Phnom Penh. (Her husband is shown in the picture at their home.) They also support an elderly parent at home.

Run T. grows many kinds of vegetables at her home and makes around US $2.00 each day. Her husband sells sand and makes about US $3.00 each day. Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also played a factor in making the price of rice and crops very high. Run T. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase a water pump for irrigating her crops. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.ru: Султонкулов Азамджон.Житель района Дж.Руми.Возраст 29 лет,женат, имеет 3 детей. Образвоание среднее.Клиент занимается куплей продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Имеет опыт в этой деятельности 6 лет. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. На кредит Азамджон хочет увеличить денежный оборот.Планирует погасить кредит в течении12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Azamjon S. lives in the Jalaluddini Rumi district. He is 29 years old, married, has three children, and has a secondary education. This entrepreneur buys and sells cattle. His experience in this area stretches back six years. The business is his family's primary source of income. Azamjon wants to use a loan to increase cash flow. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase cash flow

loans.name: Muth

texts.en:
Muth S., 38, is married and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, with five of her children. She raises ducks for eggs and makes approximately US $1.50 each day. Her husband makes US $1.50 working as a teacher in the school village. (He is pictured in the duck field.) They are also supported by two of their children who are employed as garment factory workers.

Inflation has made prices soar lately in Cambodia, and Muth S. wants to expand her business to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase duck food and raise more ducks. She sees this loan as a great economic opportunity and believes that she can raise her standard of living through her careful investment.

loans.use: To raise more ducks and purchase duck food.

loans.name: Hadija Fadhili's Maisha Zhakem Group

texts.en:
Hadija F., age 46, is married with four children (ages 20, 17, 15 and 11). She has been sewing for 20 years and has also been selling food in Mbagala for almost a year. She works from 6am to 3pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $212.

In the past, Hadija has taken out one previous loan with Tujijenge Tanzania and to start her food business. She hopes for a new loan to buy an embroidery machine. Hadija will share this loan with her subgroup members selling food, charcoal, clothes and bananas. The subgroup Maisha Zakhem hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Hadija is first on the right in the front row.

loans.use: To buy embroidery machine

loans.name: Samrith

texts.en:
Samrith Y., 55, is married and lives with three of her children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She and her husband work as farmers and they typically make US $1.00 every day. They are also supported by their children who work in the garment factories.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also forced food prices to skyrocket. In light of these times of economic difficulties, Samrith Y. is asking CREDIT for a loan of US $200 to buy her son a motorbike to operate a taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to operate a taxi business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort Kraasibea is 49 years old, divorced and a mother with two children. Her children are grown and currently working. Comfort sells frozen foods in the local market to support her business growth. With her six years' experience, she says demand for fish is high but she does not meet the capital requirement to meet such demands. She wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of frozen foods to enable her raised enough income to expand her business operation as she is recognized as the number one cold store operator in her community. She is a member of the group called "Biako Ye". Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Her picture was captured at her business premises.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, etc

loans.name: Muhae

texts.ru: Болтабаева Мухае  жительница района Дж.Руми. Возраст 30 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Клиентка занимается куплей продажей мелко-рогатого скота. Мухае покупает на рынке  небольшую отару барашкев  и отправляет их на пастбище. Затем продает их на рынке по более выгодной ей цене. Бизнес является основным источником дохода их семьи. На кредит клиентка хочет закупить мелкий рогатый скот.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muhae B. lives in the J. Rumi region. She is 30 years old, married and has three children. She has secondary education. She is in the business of buying and selling cattle. Muhae buys a small batch of sheep on the market and sends them off to a pasture. Afterwards she resells them at a more profitable price. This business is the main source of income for her family. She wants to use the loan to buy more cattle. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Thai S., 25, is married and lives in Phnom Penh with her little child. She raises ducks for eggs, making around US $7.00 each day, while her husband typically makes less than one dollar every day as a rice farmer. Inflation has driven up prices all across Cambodia and many Cambodians face economic struggles.

Thai S. has approached CREDIT for a loan of US $1200 to invest in her existing business so she can raise more ducks for eggs. She feels that the investment can increase her income and raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To raise more ducks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy furniture

texts.ru: Зоиров Эмомали житель района А.Джоми.Возраст 44 года ,женат ,имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее.Эмомали  занимается куплей продажей строительных материалов. Он покупает  на оптовом рынке товар и реализует его в розницу .На доход  от  торговли  он содержит семью.Так как дети клиента еще учатся в  средней школе. На полученный кредит Эмомали  планирует  закупить товар.Погасит кредит в течении 18 месяцев
texts.en:
Зоиров Эмомали житель района А.Джоми.Возраст 44 года ,женат ,имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее.Эмомали занимается куплей продажей строительных материалов. Он покупает на оптовом рынке товар и реализует его в розницу .На доход от торговли он содержит семью.Так как дети клиента еще учатся в средней школе. На полученный кредит Эмомали планирует закупить товар.Погасит кредит в течении 18 месяцев

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: закупка товара

loans.name: Emomali

texts.ru: Зоиров Эмомали житель района А.Джоми.Возраст 44 года ,женат ,имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее.Эмомали  занимается куплей продажей строительных материалов. Он покупает  на оптовом рынке товар и реализует его в розницу .На доход  от  торговли  он содержит семью.Так как дети клиента еще учатся в  средней школе. На полученный кредит Эмомали  планирует  закупить товар.Погасит кредит в течении 18 месяцев.
texts.en:
Emomali Z. lives in the A. Jomi region. He is 44 years old, married and has five children. He has secondary education. Emomali is in the business of buying and selling of construction materials. He buys wholesale on the market and then sells it retail. He uses the profits to support his family because his children are still going to school. Emomali plans to use the loan to buy more materials. He plans to pay off the loan within 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Mrs. NA. A., 57, and her husband, Mr. Thorn Sok, 60, who live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1970 and have three children, one son and two daughters. Two of their children have full time employment and their youngest daughter studies in the local school.

Mrs. NA. has sold groceries for four years and has been selling cotton scarves since 2000. She buys them from a market in Phnom Penh for resale A. her home. Her husband grows papayas, tomatoes, corn, and other food crops on their farmland. 

Mrs. NA. is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine and a computer for her daughters, and to buy grocery items for her stock.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine, a computer, and grocery items for her stock.

loans.name: Abdul Karim

texts.en:
A. Karim is married. He has worked for a private company as a security guard for two years. He lives in a rental house, and two months ago he bought some land where he could build a house. He started working on the house, but he has faced some economical problems, so he has applied for an individual loan. When we asked Karim how he would repay the loan, he said “After building my house with this loan, I will charge house rent and pay back the loan.”

Now he is happy with this loan process. He wants you to know that this loan can make big changes in the life of a worker in his country. He wants to thank all lenders around the world for thinking of others in these poor countries.

loans.use: To build his house

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr:
Dame A. Alimatou est née le 14 mars 1963 à Lomé la capitale togolaise. Elle s’est mariée à un instituteur et est mère d’un enfant. Depuis l’année 2000, elle exerce le commerce de pagne et de bijoux dans le quartier Agoè à Lomé.
Le premier crédit qu’elle a bénéficié lui a permis de faire un étalage à côté d’une station d’essence afin de pouvoir recevoir la visite de plusieurs clients.
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de faire l’achat de 15 pièces de pagne et 15 bijoux.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alimatou A. was born March 14, 1963 in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is married to a school teacher and the mother of one child. Since 2000 she has been working in the sale of pagnes (clothing fabrics) and jewelry in the neighborhood of Agoè in Lomé. Her first loan allowed her to set-up a display booth next to a gas station in order to attract more clients. This second loan that she is requesting will allow her to purchase 15 pieces of fabric and 15 pieces of jewelry.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics and jewelry

loans.name: Micheal Mhenga's Maisha Zakhem B Group

texts.en:
Michael M., age 42, is married with two children (ages 18 and 14). He has a bar in Mbagala which he started in 1999. He works from 8am to 11pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $560.

In the past, Michael has taken out four previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase capital and repair the bar building. He hopes for a new loan to increase on stock, buy chairs and do some painting. Michael will share this loan with his subgroup members who vegetables, fruits, coconuts, clothes, charcoal and have shops. The subgroup, Maisha Zakhem, hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Michael is first on the right.

loans.use: to increase stock, paint the bar buiding and buy more chairs

loans.name: Bony

texts.en:
Mrs. Bony S., 52, and her husband, Mr. It Un, 53, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1975 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. Two of their sons are married and live outside the family home. One son is a monk and the youngest son studies at the local school. Their daughter is assisting her mother in the grocery business. 

Mrs. Bony has been a rice farmer since she was young and started her grocery business two years ago. She buys them from the market across from her village for resale at her home, while Mr. It is a rice farmer.

Mrs. Bony is requesting a loan to purchase grocery items for resale and buy rice seed and fertilizer for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Khoeun N., 54, and her husband, Mr. Sitha Phan, 55, who live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1978 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of their children are married, one of whom lives in the family home.

Mrs. Khoeun has been selling fish since 1983 and has been selling rice for five years. She buys rice from Por Sat province for resale. Mr. Sitha has been a fisherman for fifteen years.

Mrs. Khoeun is requesting a loan to purchase rice for resale.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mr. Sophat Y., 35, and his wife, Mrs. Sophoin Un, 26, who live on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1998 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Their daughter studies in the local school.

Mr. Sophat has been a silk weaver since 1992, a skill he learned from his mother. He sells his finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Beside weaving silk, he also raises cows and farms. Mrs. Sophoin is a garment factory worker and a weaver. 

Mr. Sophat is requesting a loan to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Mrs. Pich S., 48, is a widow with three children. One of her children is married and lives outside the family home. Her other two children are garment factory workers. The family live in a small village off of National Road number Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Pich is in the business of cutting grass to sell for cows' feed. Now, she is creating a new business of selling fruit. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase fruit for resale.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for resale.

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Mr. Khom C., 45, and his wife, Mrs. Phal Sok, 44, who live in a small village off of National Road number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, were married in 1983 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of their children has full time employment and the other children study in the local school.

Mr. Khom C. has been growing rice and vegetables since he was married, while his wife is a garment factory worker. Currently, Khom wants to create another job of driving a motor taxi to earn extra income for his family, but lacks the money to buy a motorcycle. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike for driving a motor taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for driving a motor taxi.

loans.name: Gwanyalla

texts.en:
E. was born on October 15, 1962, and is now married to Yuh Blasius Ngam; she has five children. Due to difficulties in her marital home in providing for her family, she decided to join GHAPE to help her family. She has taken and successfully repaid a $340 loan. With the help of that loan she was able to join hands with her husband to care for her children, including paying school fees, hospital bills, food and clothing. E.'s husband is a subsistence farmer and brings no income to the house.

E.'s business is to buy and sell food items like garri, corn and onion in one of the popular food markets in Bamenda. With the help of her previous loan she was able to make her business expand. She is confident that her business will succeed because her items are daily necessities for the members of her community and she has been in this business for a long time.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of corn and garri

loans.name: M'tenda

texts.fr:
Née le 30 mai 1968 à Dapaong dans la préfecture de Tône au nord du Togo, dame N. M’tenda est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Son mari qui vit actuellement en France ne lui apporte pas de l’aide régulièrement donc elle est obligée de se battre beaucoup pour pouvoir payer les frais de scolarité de ses deux enfants.
Elle a pour activité la vente du haricot et du maïs dans le marché d’Agoè à Lomé. Elle a commencé par exercer ce commerce de céréales depuis 1993 et est très expérimentée.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 15 sacs de maïs, 3 sacs de mil et 2 sacs de sorgho. Ainsi avec ce nouveau stock, elle pourra mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Born on May 30, 1968 in Dapaong, in Tône Prefecture in the north of Togo, Ms. M'tenda N. is married and the mother of two. Her husband, who currently lives in France, doesn't send assistance on a regular basis, so she must struggle a great deal to be able to pay the school fees for her two children. Her business involves selling beans and corn in the Agoè marketplace in Lomé. She began trading in grains in 1993 and is highly experienced. This initial loan that she is requesting will enable her to buy 15 sacks of corn, 3 sacks of millet, and 2 sacks of sorghum. With this new stock, she will thus be able to satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain (corn, sorghum, millet)

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Mrs. Soy Y., 55, is a widow with four sons. One of her sons is married and lives outside the family home. One son is employed  full time, and the other two sons study in the local school. The family lives about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Soy has sold groceries for 12 years. She buys groceries from the market for resale at her home. Now, she is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more groceries.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Miss Sokha S., 29, is single and lives with her widowed mother (who is shown in the picture with her). She has three brothers, one of whom is married and lives outside the family home, and the other one is a construction worker. The family lives along national road number one, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Miss Sokha has been a garment factory worker for twelve years. She also sells clothes in her factory as well when she is free from her work. Now, she is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to resell both at her factory and through her mother at home.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ngwe

texts.en:
A., popularly call Mami Fish, is a single mother with three children. She was not able to go to school because her parents were not able to pay her fees, so she had to drop out; her parents were not able to provide the family with food, clothing or other basics.

However, her friends encouraged her to join GHAPE in 2006. She used her first loan of $40 to start buying and selling palm wine, a locally made wine from Palm trees and commonly consumed by many people in the north-west province. She had some profits from these sales and was able to take a second loan in 2007, when she decided to expand to buying and selling food items such as Egusi, fish and onions.

With this loan she hopes to continue her business, buying and selling dried fish, onion and fresh tomatoes.

loans.use: To increase her food inventory, including fish, onions and fresh tomatoes

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty L. is 25 years old. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, toffees, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits, etc. in her neighborhood. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, toffees, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her child in school.

Gifty L. belongs to the Trust group called "Biako Ye" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to for the loan and support one another to repay the loan. Her picture was taken when she was visited at her shop.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water and boxes of biscuits, toffees etc.

loans.name: Mansa

texts.fr:
Née le 31 décembre 1968 à Todomé dans la région des plateaux, dame N. Mansa est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a pour activité commerciale la vente des articles de quincaillerie dans son quartier à Lomé. Elle a choisit faire ce commerce car elle a constaté que Agoè est un grand quartier en construction et que les articles de plomberie sont très vite achetés. Effectivement elle vend bien mais seulement sont stock est limité.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 9 robinets et lavabos ainsi que 4 super tank afin de satisfaire la demande sans cesse croissante des clients et de tirer de revenu.
texts.en:
Born on December 31, 1968, in Todomé in the Plateaux Region, Mrs. Mansa N. is married and the mother of 3 children. Her business consists in selling hardware items in her neighborhood in Lomé. She chose this business after noticing that the Agoé neighborhood is in construction, so that plumbery items sell very fast. Indeed, she sells very well but she has a limited stock. She's seeking this first loan to buy 9 taps and sinks, as well as 4 tanks, to meet ever-increasing customer demands and turn a profit.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell plumbery items

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George A. is 65 years old, married and a father with five children. Currently all his children are working. George A. has owned and operated a hotel for the past three years. Because of the friendly attitudes his staff shows towards customers and its serene atmosphere of the hotel, a lot of people patronize the the facilities there. George says during weekends there are lot of people who booked the place but could not get in because of the limited rooms available and the damage to some of the facilities there. He said he wants to use the loan to buy additional air conditioners, furniture and other things to add to the existing ones. With the loan he also believes he can build more rooms to accommodate travelers and other people who want to have a perfect place to lodge. George says this will also help him maximize profit.

George belongs to the Trust group called "Biako Ye" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to for the loan and support one another to repay the loan. His picture was taken when he was visited at his meeting place.

loans.use: To purchase air conditioners, furniture and do other maintenance.

loans.name: Forti

texts.en:
Evelyn is married with three children. She faced her worst nightmare when her child became ill and Evelyn was unable to buy drugs, not to mention food for the rest of the family. Evelyn almost went mad with the difficulties. Her husband was unable to support her, and just sat and watched her work.

With all this, Evelyn decided to join GHAPE to get the money to continue her food sales business, which was not moving. With her first loan of $80 she bought corn and garri from far-off villages in bulk and re-sold it in the local town market. She made a lot of profit from this business.

With this loan she plans to expand her business by buying more corn and garri. She is determined that the business will succeed as she is having more people who buy from her and resell to others. She also hopes that with this loan she will be able to make more of a profit to help her provide for the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of corn and garri

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
