Matilda A. is 30 years old. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. in her neighborhood. With the loan, she wants to purchase more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school.

Matilda belongs to the community group called "Biako Ye" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to the loan and support one another to repay the loan. Her picture was taken after her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac T. is a 36-year-old business man. He is married with one kid and very dedicated to his work. He owns and operates a grocery shop and sells bulk and retail items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits, etc. in the local market of Suhum in Koforidua of the Eastern region. Isaac supports his family with proceeds from his business. He wants to use the loan to buy bulk supply of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders, etc. to expand his business. Isaac hopes to save more towards his kid's education.

He belongs to the community group called 'Biako Ye Trust Group'. The group members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans on time. His picture was taken after his group meeting.

loans.use: To more bags of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders, cartons of sardines, carton of canned beef etc.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella S. is 39 years old. She is a divorced woman and mother of one kid. Currently the child is in junior high school. Stella enjoys selling, with much experience in customer care. She has been selling bananas for five years to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of bananas from the farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at a higher price. She wants to use the loan to buy bananas in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers who travel from far and near to buy from her. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kid in school.

Stella is a member of a community group called "Nyame mma" Trust Group". In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans. Her picture was taken after her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of banana.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr:
Revendeuse de charbon de bois et de tubercules d’ignames, dame A. Adzo est née le 31 décembre 1970 à Agoè. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a commencé la vente du charbon de bois il y a 23 ans. Elle désire profiter de cette saison d’igname pour faire l’approvisionnement.
A cet effet, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 130 tubercules d’igname, 4 sacs de maïs et 12 sacs de charbon de bois. Elle compte réaliser un bon chiffre d’affaire avec ce nouveau stock.
texts.en:
A retailer of charcoal and yam tubers, Ms. Adzo A. was born on December 31, 1970 in Agoè. She is married and the mother of three. She started selling charcoal 23 years ago. Wanting to take advantage of this yam season to stock up, she is requesting this first loan to buy 130 yam tubers, four sacks of corn, and twelve sacks of charcoal. She intends to have good sales figures with this new stock.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yams and charcoal

loans.name: Chearasmey

texts.en:
Mr. Chearasmey L., 41, and his wife, Mrs. Savy Chab, 46, who live along national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1982 and have six children: four daughters and two sons. Three of their daughters are garment factory workers and the other three children study in the local school.

Mr. Chearasmey and his wife have been selling mangoes since 2004. They buy them from farmers in his village and the nearby village for resale at Dem Kor market in Phnom Penh City. 

Mr. Chearasmey is requesting a loan to purchase mangoes on contract before harvest season, for resale.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes on contract for selling.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mr. Thorn C., 56, and his second wife, Mrs. Saroun Kun, 37, who live along national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1998 and have two daughters. Thorn also has other four children with his first wife. All of them have full time employment.
 
Mr. Thorn and his wife have been selling vegetables for five years. They buy them from Dem Kor market in Phnom Penh City to later sell at Kor Ky market near their village. 

Mr. Thorn is requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike and a trailer for carrying the vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a trailer for carrying the vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Danga

texts.fr:
Née le 31 décembre 1963 à Tchitchao dans la région de la Kara, dame E. Danga est mariée  et mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés. Elle a pour activité la vente du bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois dans le quartier d’Agoè  à Lomé. Elle est une femme battante et n’aime jamais que ses enfants soient renvoyés à l’école faute du paiement d’écolage. 
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit au près de WAGES pour acheter 28 sacs de charbon de bois et 2 fagots de bois de chauffe afin de pouvoir bien vendre et aider son mari dans le paiement des frais scolaires de ses enfants
texts.en:
Born on December 31, 1963 in Tchitchao in the Kara region, Mrs. Danga E. is married and mother to five children who all attend school. She has a business selling firewood and charcoal in the Agoè district of Lomé. Mrs. E. is a woman who fights for what she needs, and she never likes to see her children sent home from school because the fees have not been paid.

She is requesting this first loan through Kiva Field Partner, WAGES, to buy 28 sacks of charcoal and two bundles of firewood in order to sell them and thus help her husband with the payment of their children’s school fees.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Ali Batéma

texts.fr:
Avec trois enfants en charge, veuve K. Ali Batéma est née le 25 juillet 1973 à Sokodé. Elle a pour activité la couture et la vente de pagne. Elle a ouvert son atelier depuis 1996 à Lomé et a quatre apprentis. Depuis qu’elle a perdu son mari, toutes les charges de la famille reposent sur elle seule. Ce qui veut dire qu’elle est obligée de redoubler d’effort pour pouvoir satisfaire les besoins de la famille. C’est avec le revenu son activité qu’elle paient les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter des tissus pour confectionner des boubous et vendre.
texts.en:
Widow Ali Batéma K. was born on July 25, 1973 in Sokodé and she has three children to look after. She runs a dressmaking business and sells ‘pagnes’ (decorated woven cloth used for traditional tunics). She opened her salon in 1996 in Lomé and she has four apprentices. Since losing her husband, she has held sole responsibility for meeting all the family expenses. This means that she has had to redouble her efforts in order to meet the needs of her family. She pays her children’s school fees with the income from her business.

She is requesting this first loan to buy fabric to make and sell ‘boubous’ (long, colorful, loose-fitting garments).

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric to make boubous

loans.name: Gnima

texts.fr: Gnima C., 62 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants et 02 petits fils en charge est membre du banc villageois de Yamatogne depuis 5 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter des  boubous en tissu teinté à Dakar et revendre à Ziguinchor. Elle veut renforcer son commerce. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Gnima C., age 62, is married with five children and two grandchildren in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Yamatogne for five and a half years. Her work consists of buying dyed boubous (long, flowing traditional garments) in Dakar and reselling them in Ziguinchor. She wants to bolster her business. The loan that she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell clothing

loans.name: Mawussé Amavi

texts.fr:
Madame K. Mawusse Amavi est née le 17 mai 1975 à Kpalimé, l’une des villes montagneuses du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle est couturière et revendeuse de pagne. Elle a associé ces deux commerce dans le but de réduire les frais de déplacement de ses clients. Elle a une clientèle agrandi puisse qu’elle réside dans ce quartier depuis plus de 8 ans.
Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé. 
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 30 pièces de pagne afin de refaire son stock et de mieux servir ses clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mawusse Amavi K. was born on May 17, 1975, in Kpalimé, one of the mountain town in Togo. She's married and the mother of two children. She's a seamstress and a pagnes (colorful African cloth) reseller. She decided to jointly undertake both businesses in order to enable her customers to save on travel expenses. She now has a large clientele since she's been in this neighborhood for more than 8 years. She already obtained a loan, that she repaid without problem. The second loan she's now seeking will enable her to buy 30 pagnes to replenish her stock and to better serve her clients.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 30 pagnes for resale

loans.name: Jennet

texts.en:
Jennet is married to Mr. P. God Fred. They are blessed with nine children, six of whom are below the age of 15. Jennet was unable to further her education because her father could not pay her school fees. Later on, she became blind. Worst of all, a thief recently broke into her home, shot her 10-year-old son, who almost died, and stole money from her house. In addition to this, her children are unable to study freely because of the fees, and they are also unable to have three square meals a day.

Jennet was motivated by her situation to become a member of GHAPE in 2006. Since then she has successfully borrowed and repaid two loans that totaled 120.000 FRS. The profit from these loans helped her pay her children's school fees and provide some basic needs, such as food for the family.

With this loan, Jennet plans to buy piglets, pig feed, soya beans, koki beans, and palm oil to continue her business. She is convinced that her business is going to be successful because she has a lot of experience in both pig farming and her restaurant business, and she has many customers. She says the profit from this loan will be used to send her children to school and to do maintenance on her house.

Jennet plans to pay her loan in 18 months, with the first installment being repaid four months from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase piglets, feed, soya beans, and koki beans

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.ru: Гурезов Музафар житель района А.Джоми.Возраст 39 лет.,женат, имеет 5 детей.Образование средне-техническое,по специальности бухгалтер. Работает в крестьянском хозяйстве бухгалтером.Так же занимается посевом пшеницы и картофеля.Собрав урожай он обеспечивает свою семью самыми необходимыми продуктами питания.На кредит Музафар хочет закупить качественные семена пшеницы и картофеля.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muzafar G. lives in the A. Jomi region. He is 39 years old, married and has five children. He has secondary technical education and is an account by profession. He works as an accountant in the village. He also sows wheat and potatoes. The harvest allows him to support his family with the necessary food. Muzafar wants to use the loan to buy quality wheat and potato seeds. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat and potato seeds

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Dame P. Adjo est née le 1er mai 1958 à Atakpamé le chef-lieu de la région des plateaux au Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. Elle a pour activité, la fabrication et la vente du jus de fruit dans le marché d’Agoè. Elle achète les fruits de citron, d’ananas, d’orange à kpalimé à un prix inférieur par rapport aux prix de vente à Lomé.
Cette activité qu’elle a commencée depuis 1993 lui rapporte toujours de bénéfice sauf que ces derniers temps le phénomène de la vie chère fait qu’elle ne dispose pas d’éléments pour continuer son activité.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 5 sacs de sucre en poudre et 20 sacs de gingembre.
texts.en:
Adjo P. was born May 1, 1958 in Atakpame the largest town in Togo’s plateau region. She is married and the mother of six children. By way of employment, Adjo makes and sells fruit juice in the market in Agoe. She purchases lemons, pineapple, and oranges in Kpalime at a lower price than available in Lome. Since she went into business in 1993, she has always made a profit, but of late with the high cost of living she has not the means to buy ingredients to continue her business. This loan she is requesting, her first, would permit her to purchase five sacks of granulated sugar and twenty sacks of ginger.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of granulated sugar and ginger

loans.name: Islomuddin

texts.ru: Шералиев Исломуддин житель района А.Джоми.Возраст 56 лет, женат,имеет 4 детей. Образование высшее,по специальности учитель.Но специальности не работает.Клиент  занимается куплей продажей сладостей,соков . Имеет опыт в бизнесе 14 лет. На доход от торговли содержит свою семью.На кредит Исломуддин хочет закупить больше товара,увеличить ассортимент точки.Планирует погасить кредит в тчении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Islomuddin S. lives in the A. Jomi region. He is 56 years old, married and has four children. He has high education, his profession is a teacher, but he does not work by his profession. He is in the business of selling sweets and juices. He has around fourteen years of experience in this business. He uses the profits to support his family. Islomuddin wants to use the loan to buy more merchandise and increase the variety of his offered goods. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr: Hawa B., 53 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants et 03 neveux en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Yamatogne depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter des tissus, faire la teinture et confectionner des ensembles et des draps et vendre. Elle vend aussi de l’encens, des jus et crèmes qu’elle prépare elle-même. Hawa veut renforcer son commerce pour mieux assurer la prise en charge de sa famille. Son mari retraité est malade et se fait soigner à Dakar. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Hawa B., age 53, is married and has three children plus three nephews in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Yamatogne for four and a half years. She wants a loan to buy fabrics, dye them, and make outfits and sheets to sell. She also sells incense, juices, and ice cream that she makes herself. Hawa wants to bolster her business to ensure she can care for her family better. Her retired husband is ill and is seeing to his own care in Dakar. The loan that she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Making and selling dyed cloth and selling incense, ice cream, and juices

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Сулеймонова Зарина жительница района ДЖ.Руми.Возраст 21 год,образование средне-техническое.По специальности учительница.Заработная плата очень маленькая , поэтому Зарина занимается животноводствои и производством кисло-молочной продукцией.Клиентка живет  с престарелыми родителями-пенсионерами.Содержит семью сама. Клиентка  реализует   сметану, ряженку на рынке. В данный моменнт Зарина хочет увеличить производство молока и кисло-молочной продукции,купив 2 коровы.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zarina S. lives in the Jalaluddin Rumi district. She is 21 years old and has a secondary vocational education in teaching. Her salary is very small, so Zarina also raises animals and produces fermented milk products. She lives with her elderly parents, who are retired. She alone supports the family. She sells sour cream and a fermented and boiled milk product called ryazhenka at the market. Now Zarina wants to expand her production of milk and fermented milk products by buying two cows. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two cows

loans.name: Kokouda

texts.fr:
Né à Kini Kondji le 27 septembre 1961 dans la préfecture de Yoto, monsieur B. Kokouda est marié et père de six enfants tous scolarisés. Il est revendeur de porte et de tôle dans la ville de Lomé. Il dispose de deux lieux de vente. Le premier est le marché local d’akodessewa et le second c’est à la devanture de sa maison.
Il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 100 tôles et 20 portes afin de satisfaire les commandes qu’il a reçu depuis plus d’une semaine.
texts.en:
Born on September 27, 1961 in Kini Kondji (Yoto Prefecture), Kokouda B. is married and the father of six children, who are all in school. He is a retailer of gates and sheet metal in the city of Lomé. He has two sales outlets. The first is in the local market of Akodessewa, and the second is in the front display of his house. He is requesting this initial loan to buy 100 pieces of sheet metal and 20 doors or gates in order to satisfy the orders he received over a week ago.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gates and sheet metal

loans.name: Barnogul

texts.ru: Усманова Барногул жительница района Дж.Руми.Возраст 38 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Клиентка на рынке района  Дж.Руми имеет торговую точку.Барногул торгует детской одеждой.Она закупает у оптовиков товар и реализует в розницу.Так как на свой товар ставит небольшую наценку  постоянных клиентов у нее много.В данный момент Барногул хочет расширить свой бизнес,пополнив ассортимент торговой точки.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Barnogul U. lives in the J. Rumi region of Tajikistan. She is 38 years old and is married with two children. Barnogul is a high-school graduate who makes a living selling children's clothes at the local market. She buys clothes wholesale and sells them retail. Since her prices are reasonable, she has many regular customers. At present Barnogul would like to expand her business. She is applying for a loan that she plans to pay off within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to expand the offer

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama S., 48 ans est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Yamatogne depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de  tissus de pagnes, de bijoux et de chaussures. Ses revenus lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de certains besoins de la famille. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Mariama S., age 48, is married and the mother of 3 children. She's been a member of the Yamatogne village bank for 3 and half years. She wants to bolster her business selling pagne fabrics (colorful African cloth), jewelry and shoes. Her revenues enable her to help her husband with some of the family needs.

She's seeking a loan that will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell pagne fabric, jewelry and shoes

loans.name: Naka

texts.fr:
Née en 1966 dans la préfecture de la Koza, dame A. Naka est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Son mari qui est un militaire a un revenu un peu limité ce qui ne permet pas à la famille de bien vivre. Dame A. Naka a pour activité la vente du maïs et du charbon de bois dans le marché d’Agoè Assiyéyé. Elle aide toujours son mari depuis qu’elle a commencé cette activité en 2001. 
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 15 sacs de maïs et 12 sacs du charbon de bois afin d’augmenter son stock et de bien vendre.
texts.en:
Mrs. Naka A. was born in 1966 in the Koza prefecture and is married with five children. Her husband is in the military and has a limited income which means that their family is not too well off. Mrs. Naka A. sells corn and charcoal at the Agoè Assiyéyé market. She has been helping her husband out since she started her business in 2001.

She is requesting this loan so she can buy 15 sacks of corn and 12 sacks of charcoal to increase her stock, and thus, her sales.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and charcoal

loans.name: Nazrmo

texts.ru: Кодирова Назрмо жительница района Дж.Руми.Возраст 53 года, замужем , имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Назрмо занимается производством хлебо-булочных изделий. Реализует продукцию на местном рынке района. Производство является основным источником дохода ее большой семьи.На данный кредит клиентка хочет приобрести муку.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nazrmo K. lives in the J.Rumi region of Tajikistan. She is 53 years old and is married with 4 children. She is a high-school graduate who makes a living by baking bread and selling it at the local market. This is the main source of income for her big family. Nazrmo would like to receive a lon for purchasing flour. She plans to pay off the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Padonhiwa

texts.fr:
Née à Badou en 1969, dame P. Padonhiwa est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle réside avec son mari dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Depuis l’année 2000, elle prépare et vend de la boisson locale fabriquée à base du mil. Cette boisson tant appréciée par les natifs du nord du Togo nécessite une technique de préparation. Etant donné qu’elle avait vécu au nord avant de revenir à Lomé en 2000 elle maîtrise bien cette préparation.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 3 sacs de mil et 7 fagots de bois pouvant lui permettre de poursuivre son activité et aider la famille.
texts.en:
Born in Badou in 1968, Mrs. Padonhiwa P. is married and the mother of four children. She lives with her husband in the Agoé neighborhood in Lomé. Since the year 2000, she's been preparing and selling a local beverage made out of millet. This beverage is much appreciated by natives of Togo and requires a specific technique to be prepared. Since Mrs. P. lived in the north prior to coming back to Lomé in 2000, she masters this preparation very well. She's seeking this first loan to buy 3 sacks of millet and 7 bundles of firewood to enable her to pursue his business and help her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy millet and firewood

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.ru: Тоджибоев Толибджон житель района  А.Джоми. Возраст 37 лет, женат, имеет   3 детей. Образование среднее. Клиент занимается  производством  сундуков. В данный момент  сезон свадебных мероприятий.Сундуки являются необходимым атрибутом молодоженов. Этот вид деятельности является основным источником дохода его семьи.На кредит Толибджон хочет закупить строительные материалы для производства.Планирует погасить кредит в  течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Tolibjon T. lives in the A. Jomi region of Tajikistan. He is 37 years old and is married with children. He is a high-school graduate and makes his living by producing storage boxes. This is his family's main source of income. Now is the wedding season in Tajikistan, and boxes are an essential part of wedding celebrations. Tolibjon would like to receive a loan for purchasing the necessary materials. He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase materials

loans.name: Kumri

texts.ru: Курбонова Кумри  жительница района А.Джоми.Возраст 57 года,вдова,имеет 4 детей.Образование средне-специальное,по специальности  медсестра. Кумри занимается куплей продажей мебели.Она имеет  небольшой магазин на рынке района. Муж клиентки умер,поэтому семью содержит она сама.На кредит хочет закупить  товар для продажи.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Kumri K. lives in the A. Jomi region of Tajikistan. She is 57 years old an is widowed. Kumri has 4 children. She is a nurse by training but she makes a living by buying and selling furniture. She has a small store at the city market. Kumri's husband died, and she is the only breadwinner in her family. She would like to use the loan for purchasing goods for retail and plans to pay off the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase goods

loans.name: Cristo Vive Group

texts.en: "Cristo Vive" is a large group of 35 people, 20 of which are hoping to take out a loan. For many of them this is their second loan, and a loan they hope to use to increase their business. The business range from clothing sales to salons. Miline is the chosen group representative due to her hard work and dedication. Miline is a hardworking mother of 5 very young children, the oldest being only 10 years old. She took her first loan and started a small business of selling chicken and other types of food. With this next loan she feels like she can increase her business greatly and start making money to support her family. Her dream is to have her own store someday, and be able to provide her family with comfortable life. On behalf of Miline, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: Food Vendor

loans.name: Mujeres Activos Group

texts.en:
"Mujeres Activos," as the name suggests, is a group of 10 proactive women, each trying to take a step to better their lives. Ramona, the chosen group leader, is a hardworking mother of one child and is requesting a loan to start a small business selling food. Ramona is ready to start changing her life, and feels like this loan could be the start of something great! The whole group realizes this as well, and is excited about this new opportunity and has great hopes for the future!

On Behalf of Ramona, the group, and Esperanza International------- Thank you for your support!!

loans.use: Food Vendor

loans.name: Maranatha Group

texts.en:
"Maranatha" is a large group of 35 people. Right now, 20 of its members are seeking loans, all excited about the chance to improve their situation and life, and hoping this loan will be the start of that change. Maribel, the chosen leader of this group, is a hardworking mother of four young children, all under the age of 10. She realized some time ago that she needed to do something to help her young children have a good life, and this loan will present her with the opportunity to start a small business selling food.  Mirabel dreams of having a thriving business that will support both her and her children. 

The whole group is ready for this loan and ready to make a major change in their lives. On behalf of Maribel, the group, and Esperanza International---- Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: To become a food vendor

loans.name: El Hato Group

texts.es:
hola nosotras somos el Grupo el HATO, yo Griselda Argentina P. de 45 años de edad soy la coordinadora del grupo y tengo un gimnasio en la colonia el Hato el cual me genera recursos para poder asumir los compromisos de mi hogar y otros compromisos que tengo, junto a mi negocio esta la Sra. Maria A. de 49 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de pasteles los cuales ella elabora en su casa de habitacion y los vende de forma ambulante. 
La. Sra. Ingrid B. de 30 años de edad cuenta con un negocio de venta de tortillas las cuales las vende en la colonia villanueva, junto a ella esta la Sra. Eduarda Concepcion F. de 47 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de helados y paletas en un local de la colonia el Hato y la Sra Sonia P. de 45 años de edad cuenta con  una cafeteria ubicada en las instalaciones de la Anafut en la colonia tepeyac, cabe mencionar que cn el esfuerzo que realizamos todas hemos logrado darle a nuestras familias el sustento de alimentacion, salud y educacion, nosotros tenemos mas de 10 años luchando como comerciantes y mas de 5 años como vecinos de nuestra comunidad.
texts.en:
We are the group El Hato. I am Griselda Argentina P., 45 years old. I am the coordinator of the group and have a gym in the colony El Hato which generates income that allows me to attend to the needs of my home and my other obligations. With me is Mrs. Maria A. who is 49 years old. She sells cakes which she makes in her home and sells as a street vendor. Mrs. Ingrid B. is 30 years old and has a business selling tortillas in the Villanueva colony. Next to her is Mrs. Eduarda Concepcion F., 47 years old, who sells ice crean and fruit popcicles in a the El Hato colony. Mrs. Sonia P., 45 years old, has a coffe shop located in in the locales of Anafut in the Tepeyac colony. It is worth mentioning, that with the efforts that we all put forth, we have been able to provide for our families the necessary support for food, health and education. We have more than 10 years of experience struggling as business people and more than 5 years as neighbors in our community.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for various businesses

loans.name: Sunflowers 2 Group

texts.es:
hola nuestro grupo se llama GIRASOLES 2 estamos integrado por tres personas que nos dedicamos al comercio en las siguientes actividades: venta de tortillas (dos integrantes) y en venta y raparacion de zapatos.
yo (Mayra V.) soy la coordinadora del grupo tengo 43 años de edad, me dedico a la venta y produccion de tortillas, las cuales las vendo en la zona del mercado San Miguel, junto a mi esta mi compañera Felix Cantalicia G. que tambien se dedica a la venta de tortillas en el mismo mercado y nuestro otro compañero de grupo el Sr. Jose G. de 63 años de edad se dedica a la reparacion y venta de zapatos, a todos nosotros nuestros negocios nos proporcionan ingresos para el sustento de nuestras familias (aliemntacion, educacion y salud). en estos momentos estamos solicitando credito para poder salir adelante con nuestros negocios. nosotros tenemos mas de 5 años de conocernos y hemos creado un ambiente como de familia entre nosotros, somos bien unidos y nos ayudamos el uno con el otro.
texts.en:
Hello, our group is called Sunflowers 2. We have three members, and we do business in the following activities: sales of tortillas, and shoe sales and reparation. I (Mayra V.) am the group coordinator. I am 43 years old, and I make and sell tortillas, which I sell in the market of San Miguel. Next to me in the picture is Felix Cantalicia Galea, who also sells tortillas in the same market. Mr. Jose G. is 63 years old and he is the third member of our group. He repairs and sells shoes. All of our businesses provide for our families (food, health and education). At the moment we are asking for a loan so that we can get ahead. We have known each other more than 5 years, we are like a family and we help each other when needed.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cereceda, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and raw materials to make tortillas

loans.name: Boris

texts.en:
Boris is married and lives in Beregovo, Western Ukraine. Boris sells retail items in the central town market. His vending location is characterized by nice selection of products and favorable location of the kiosk itself. Boris has been involved in this business for over 4 years. His nice assortment of inventory helps him get good sale rates despite the season.

Boris always puts much emphasis on growth of his business. He has learned some of the tricks that stimulate promotion of his enterprise and knows how to manage his time and finances well to add to success of the trade. Boris's business is the only source of income for his family. His venture provided him with much needed finances after the earthquake that had happened in his area. The insurance company refused to cover the expenses and Boris was forced to repair everything using his own money. He is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to re-stock his merchandise.

Note: this is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: Increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Romana

texts.es:
hola mi nombre es Romana M., me dedico a la venta de Desayunos, vivo en la colonia Los Pinos, tengo 49 años de edad, estoy casada, en mi negocio hago burritas de frijoles con chirizo y huevo, tambien hago baleadas y vendo tazas de cafe y refrescos naturales, mi producto lo vendo en una maquila que esta ubicada en la Colonia Honduras, tengo varios años de dedicarme a esta actividad, en estos momentos necesito un credito para poder sacar adelante mi negocio.
con los ingresos que obtengo de mi negocio logro en un gran porcentaje ayudar a mi familia lo cual me ha ayudado a salir adelante, por tal razon necesito el credito para poder seguir manteniendo mi familia.
texts.en:
Hello. My name is Romana M. and I sell breakfasts. I live in the Los Pinos neighborhood, am 49 years old, married, and in my business I make bean burritos with chorizo and egg. I also make “baleadas” (bean and tortilla) and sell cups of coffee and natural juices. I have sold my products at a factory located in the Honduras neighborhood for many years. Today I need a loan to be able to grow my business. With the income that I receive from my business I will use a large percentage to help my family which has helped me be successful, so I need the loan to be able to continue supporting my family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans, eggs, cheese, butter, margerine, shortening, tortillas, sausage, fruit, sugar, oil, coffee

loans.name: Khadidiatou

texts.fr: Khadidiatou Traoré, 59 ans, mariée avec 05 petits enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Yamatogne depuis 6 ans. Elle veut acheter du pain de singe au marché hebdomadaire de Yarang, du sucre et des ingrédients pour faire des crèmes glacées et des jus et vendre au niveau de l’école. Avec ses bénéfices elle participe aux dépenses familiales et aux besoins de ses petits enfants. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>.
texts.en:
Khadidiatou Traoré, age 59, is married and has five young children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Yamatogne for six years. She wants to go to the Yarang weekly market to buy "monkey bread" (the fruit of the baobab tree), some sugar, and ingredients to make ice cream and juice to sell at schools. With her profits, she helps cover family expenses and the needs of her children. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell ice cream and juice

loans.name: Salimatou

texts.fr: Salimatou Mané, 70 ans, mariée avec 09 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Saré Demba  Alette à Bourcounda depuis 3 ans. Elle veut renforcer ses activités de commerce et d’élevage en achetant du riz, du sucre, des bœufs et autres provisions. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Salimatou Mané, age 70, is married and has nine children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Saré Demba Alette in Bourcounda for three years. She wants to bolster her work in commerce and in raising livestock by buying buffaloes and some rice, sugar, and other provisions. Her income enables her to improve her living conditions. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Small-scale commerce and raising livestock

loans.name: Coumba Woury

texts.fr: Coumba Woury D., 39 ans, mariée avec 09 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Saré Demba  Alette à Bourcounda depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut acheter du riz, du sucre, de l’huile, du thé, des biscuits et autres pour renforcer son petit commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie. <b>Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Coumba Woury D. is 39 years old, married, and has 9 children in her care. She has been a member of the Saré Demba Alette village bank in Bourcounda for a year and a half. She wants to buy rice, sugar, oil, tea, cookies and other items to strengthen her small business. Her revenues allow her to improve her living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid in a single payment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Small business selling rice, sugar, oil, tea, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Marcia Fajardo

texts.es:
Inició su negocio como una mini pulpería vendiendo cosas pequeñas de alimentos, con créditos que ADIM le ha otorgado ella empezó a vender de todo tipo de productos alimenticios, en un crédito de mayor monto invirtió en ropa menor, tarjetas de teléfono, gas butano para uso domiciliar, etc. Actualmente está consolidando su negocio y quiere ampliarlo con una pequeña soda ubicada en el parque de la misma localidad. 

Ella vive con su esposo y sus hijos pero quienes le apoyan directamente en el negocio son sus dos hijas que estudian y trabajan en el negocio. Ella expresa que con su negocio ella se siente como una pequeña empresaria capaz de realizar el proyecto que tiene en mente y que necesita el financiamiento de ADIM para cumplir sus sueños
texts.en:
She began her business as a small grocery store, selling small items of food. With loans that Adim has granted her, she began selling all kinds of food products. In one loan of a greater amount, she invested in smaller clothes, telephone cards, butane gar for household use, etc. At present, she is consolidating her business and wants to expand it with a small soda stand located in the park at the same location.

She lives with her husband and her children, but those who she supports directly in her business are her two daughters, who are studying and working in the business. She says that with her business, she feels like a small businesswoman capable of achieving the project that she has in mind and that she needs the financing of Adim to reach her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es: Comenzó como operaria de un taller de costura ya que su mama le había enseñado a bordar, luego con un dinero que le proporciono su esposo compro materia prima y empezó a trabajar su propia mercadería, no teniendo maquina, ya que la alquilaba, se siente agradecida de  adim, ya que hace 3 años se le financio para la compra de una maquina de coser, que es la que utiliza para la elaboración de trajes típicos, los cuales los vende en el mercado municipal de masaya. Vive con su esposo y 2 hijos los que asisten a clases y su esposo atiende los quehaceres de la agricultura, ella sueña con tener un taller grande con 3 maquinas y tener su personal, ya que su producto tiene demanda.
texts.en:
She began as a worker in a sewing workshop since her mother had taught her to embroider. Later, with the money that her husband gave her, she bought raw materials and started working on her own goods. She didn’t have a sewing machine, so she was renting one. She was thankful for ADIM, because for 3 years she had been saving for a sewing machine. She uses the sewing machine to make traditional suits, which she sells in the municipal market of Masaya. She lives with her husband and two children, who are in school. Her husband is involved in agriculture. She dreams of having a large workshop with three machines and having a staff, because her product is in demand.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Martha Salvadora

texts.es: Desde pequeña ayudaba a su mama en la elaboración de las tortillas, cuando se caso su esposo le ayudo a comenzar con este negocio comenzó haciendo 3 medios de maíz diarios,  y trabajaba solo por la mañana  hasta el medio día, cuando recibió el primer crédito con adim, cambio su horario y trabajando todo el día ahora hace 6 medio de maíz diario, de las ganancias ha mejorado su casa y el nivel de vida, puesto que sus hijos asisten a la escuela y su esposo se dedica  a labores del campo.
texts.en:
Since she was young, Martha helped her mother make tortillas. When she married her husband, he helped her started this business. She began making tortillas from an average of 3 ears of corn daily, and she worked alone from the morning to the afternoon. With she received her first loan with ADIM, she changed her schedule, and was working all day. She now makes tortillas from an average of 6 ears of corn daily. From the earnings, she has improved her home and her level in life, since her children go to school and her husband is a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: Cliente con mucha experiencia en lo que respecta al negocio de molinos, tiene 20 años en este negocio, cuando adim le entrego su primer crédito, lo invirtió en la compra de  canela, clavo de olor, pimientas etc., esto con el objetivo de aperturar otro negocio dentro del mismo, ya que estos productos los oferta a sus mismos cliente que llegan a solicitar el servicio de molino, este servicio cuenta con mucha demanda ya que en la comunidad es el único, tiene su casa propia y vive con su hijo menor, a pesar de que sus hijos mayores trabajan y tienen negocios propios a ella no le gusta que le estén dando y se empeña en manejar bien su negocio, ya que siente que ha crecido como persona, como empresaria y como mujer.
texts.en:
This is a client with a lot of experience with respect to the business of mills. She has been in this business for 20 years. When ADIM gave Maria her first loan, she invested it into the purchase of cinnamon, cloves, peppers, etc. She did this with the goal of opening another business within the one she already had, since she offers these products to the same clients who come for the service of the mill. This service has a lot of demand because it is the only mill in the community. She has her own home and lives with her younger son. Even though her older children work and have their own businesses, she doesn’t like when they give her anything, and she strives to manage her business well, because she feels that she has grown as a person, as a businesswoman, and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products

loans.name: Rosa De Saron Group

texts.en:
"Rosa De Saron" is a group of 15 women ready to change their lives. Each is looking to take out a small loan to start her very own business and begin generating income. Annelouse, the chosen representative of this group, is a very hardworking lady ready to be responsible for this group’s success. The mother of four very young children all under the age of 12 years old, she has always been a good cook and wants to start a small business selling food. She knows that her children’s futures are dependent on this opportunity, and she is ready to act now. The rest of the group feels the same way, and is ready to take the next step!

On behalf of Annelouse, the rest of the group, and Esperanza International----- We thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: To become a food vendor

loans.name: Maria Sebastián

texts.es: Doña Patricia es propietaria de una tortillería en la ciudad de Nindiri trabaja desde las 6: a.m. hasta el medio día, con el préstamo ella compró materia prima (maíz y leña) piensa que con más créditos de Adim ella trabaje hasta la tarde y  logre abastecer a su barrio con este producto, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, los cuales van a escuela de secundaria de su municipio, son sus aliados en la elaboración del producto de las ganancias ella mantiene el hogar puesto que es jefa de familia , en un futuro piensa  mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio y contratar ayudantes para la elaboración de tortillas,
texts.en:
Mrs. Patricia is the owner of a tortilla store in the city of Nindiri. She works from 6:00 in the morning until the midday. With a previous loan, she bought raw ingredients (corn and firewood). She thinks that with more loans from Adim, she will work until the afternoon and will succeed in supplying her neighborhood with her product. She is a single mother of 4 children, who attend high school in their town. They are her allies in the production of the tortillas. From the earnings, she maintains the home because she is the head of the family. In the future, she wants to improve the facilities of her business and to hire assistants to help her make tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell tortillas and butcher pigs

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan C. vive en la calle Santa Ana  de la zona Eliodoro Camacho  en la ciudad de El Alto. Juan es  soltero y el domicilio es de su propiedad.

Juan trabaja como albañil en diferentes sectores de la urbe alteña, los trabajos en los que se desempeña son variados (algunas veces hace carpintería, otras prepara cemento, coloca ladrillos, etc), su experiencia le ha permitido aprender de todo un poco, por eso es contratado regularmente.

El crédito lo destinará  para adquirir material de construccion (ladrillo, cemento, arena, etc) para ampliar una habitación en su domicilio. 
 
Este es su  segundo  crédito con Impro, los antecedentes del crédito anterior permiten un respaldo total a Juan
texts.en:
Juan C. lives on Santa Ana street in the Eliodoro Camacho zone in the city of El Alto. Juan is single and he owns his home.

Juan works as a mason in different sectors of the city. The jobs that he performs are various (sometimes carpentry, other times cement, bricklaying, etc.) His experience has allowed him to learn a little about a lot and, as a result, he is contracted regularly. The loan is intended to acquire construction materials (bricks, cement, sand, etc.) in order to expand a room in his home.

This is the second loan with Impro. The previous loans provided complete backing to Juan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Alberto Jose

texts.es: El señor Alberto M., tiene 43 años de edad, es casado le tiene dos niños, de 12 años y 9 años respectivamente, actualmente estudian la primaria , su esposa es comerciante de ropa, cosmeticos en conjunto con el señor Alberto, su proposito es poder seguir trabajando en esta actividad la cual es la venta de ropa, y cosmeticos, además de tener estos ingresos tiene una pequeña discomovil con la cual trabaja los fines de semana, su meta es poder permancer en el mercado a fin de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y sacar adelante a su familia, Don alberto tiene 18 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, comercializando de forma ambulante por encargo en los mercados, la cual desde muy joven la ejerce porque considera que  es una manera de crear su propio empleo ya que nunca le ha gustado trabajar para empresas, en la actualidad uno de su mayores sueños es poder ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios, mas adelante pretende mejorar su pequeña discomovil que es su segunda fuente de ingresos, sin dejar de dedicarse a su actividad principal que es la venta de ropa  por docena y al detalle y cosmeticos, comprando su mercaderia en managua y cuando puede en honduras.
texts.en:
Mr. Alberto M. is 43 years old, married, with two children ages 12 and 9 who are in primary school. He and his wife sell clothing and cosmetics. His intention is to continue working in their clothing and cosmetic business, and in addition to this income he has a small mobile disc jockey service he operates on the weekends. His goal is to be able to have a permanent presence in the market with the end result of improving his living conditions and help his family be successful. Alberto has been in business for 18 years, selling by traveling through he markets, which he has done since he was a young man as he considers it a way he can create his own work or employment as he has never like to work for formal businesses. Today one of his dreams is to improve his small mobile disc jockey business which is his second source of income, without leaving his primary source of income which is selling clothing by the dozen and by the piece as well as cosmetics, buying his merchandise in Managua and when he can in Honduras.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for his business

loans.name: Concepcion Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora  Concepcion M., tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos cuyas edades son de 10, 9, 6 y 3 años respectivamente, todos estudian la primaria en colegio publico, su esposo trabaja por cuenta propia en la venta de productos plasticos, aportando de esta manera al hogar. Su proposito es poder seguir trabajando en su pequeña pulperia, su deseo es mejorar sus condiciones de vida al mimso tiempo ver que su negocio esta creciendo, su sueño es poder ver realizados a sus hijos como profesionales, su mayor deseo es poder darles condiciones de via a sus hijos, ya que la infraestructura actual de su casa es mala, La actividad eocnomica de Doña Concepcion es una puleria donde ofrece productos de uso y consumo para el hogar, teneindo su negocito en su casa de habitacion, vendiendo tambien productos plasticos, en su negocio tiene 10 años de tenerlo dando inicio como una alternativa al desempleo y una manera de aportar a los gastos del hogar, con el credito pretende invertor mas su pulperia a fin de poder tener un regular inventario y satisfacer su demanda,
texts.en:
Concepción M. is 34 years old, married, and has four children who are 10, 9, 6 and 3 years old respectively. All are in primary grades in public school, and her husband is self-employed selling plastic products to support the household. Her goal is to continue working in her small general store, and her wish is to improve their standard of living while at the same time seeing growth in her business. Her dream is to see her children become successful professionals, and her greatest desire is to give them a better living environment given that the infrastructure of her home is in bad shape. Concepción’s business is a small general store where she offers household products, having installed the business in her own home. She also sells plastic products, and has been in business for ten years having started as an alternative to being unemployed and as a way to help support the family. With the loan, she intends to invest more into her store with the goal of attaining a stable inventory and satisfy her customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Nueva Generación Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Nueva Generación esta ubicado en la comunidad D. Yauli, provincia D. Huancavelica. Esta comunidad es una zona rural muy hermosa, cuna D. chanchos y willcas, zona D. papa y mujeres chopccas con vestimenta multicolor. Su principal actividad es la agricultura, ganadería y el comercio.

MatilD. M., es casada, tiene 5 hijos, su negocio es la venta D. chupetes, MatilD. tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, antes realizaba transporte D. Yauli a Huancavelica, pero se vio paralizado por un accidente. Con los prestamos ha mejorado las ventas que realiza, ahora desea comprar mercadería para su tienda y materia prima para elaborar sus chupetes. Su sueño es tener una bodega granD..

Isabel R., es conviviente, tiene un hijo D. 6 años D. edad, su negocio es la venta D. salchipapas, empezó muy joven, con las ganancia fue implementando su negocio compro una licuadora para vender jugos. Invertirá su préstamo en la compra D. papa para la venta en su negocio. Su sueño es tener una casa D. material noble y tener mas adelante una bodega granD..
texts.en:
The Nueva Generacion communal bank is located in the community of Yauli, Huancavelica province. This community is in a beautiful rural area, land of wild boars and willcas (indigenous culture), of potato growers and of choppca women wearing their multicolor traditional dresses. The community's main economic activities are agriculture, cattle raising, and traD..

MatilD. M. is married, has 5 children and sells chupetes (a kind of popsicles). MatilD. has a small grocery store. She used to proviD. transportation from Yauli to Huancavelica, but an accident stopped that activity. Her store sales have improved with the loans she has received. Now she would like to purchase merchandise to restock the store and raw ingredients to make chupetes. Her dream is to have a large store.

Isabela R., is a common-law wife, has a 6-year-old son. Her business is the sale of salchipapas (a fast food dish, maD. of french fries and sausages). She began her business since she was very young. As the business grew, she was able to buy a blender to sell juice. With the loan that she is requesting she will buy potatoes for making salchipapas. Isabel dreams of having a house maD. out of noble materials and later on a larger warehouse.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nueva Generacion Communal Bank needs 11,900 soles for 14 members to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Creciendo Por La Union Group

texts.en:
"Creciendo Por La Union" is a group of 10 people hoping to start their own businesses. This group is looking to receive loans to either start a small business or to try and increase their business. Everyone in this group is living in extreme poverty, and they see this as a chance to improve their lives and the lives of their families. 

"Dalina" is the group representative and was chosen because she is a very hardworking women. She is a young mother of two children, and she realized that she wanted a better life for her and her family. She is hoping to start a small business of selling clothes to people in her barrio. She hopes to someday have a thriving business and be able to provide for her family. On behalf of Dalina, the rest of the group, and Esperanza International: Thank you for you support!!!

loans.use: Clothing Vendor

loans.name: Trabajando Juntas Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal trabajando juntas pertenece a L. comunidad D. Yauli ubicado en el Departamento D. Huancavelica. Esta comunidad tiene 2 zonas turísticas D. Incañan y también es zona comercial.

Norma S., es casada tiene 7 hijos, se dedica a tejer en telares, teje día y noche a pedidos. A pesar D. que esta enferma y L. van a operar Norma continúa con sus tejidos. Con los préstamos que recibe elL. compra materiales como lanas e insumos para su negocio. Su sueño es tener una empresa textil y exportar sus productos, tambien comprarse una maquina remalladora.

Norma L., es casada y tiene 2 hijos, le gusta tejer mantas, gorros, hilo D. lana D. alpaca, ovino, que luego venD. en las ferias D. Paucará – Yauli, algunas veces los lleva a Lima con el apoyo D. su esposo. Su préstamo lo utilizará en comprar materia prima para su negocio. Su sueño es tener una empresa granD. y abrir una tiendita para solventar el estudio D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Trabajando Juntas Communal Bank is located in the community of Yauli, Huancavelica province. This community's economic activities are tourism (in Incañan) and traD..

Norma S., is married and has 7 children. She is a loom weaver, and weaves day and night to fulfill customers' orders. She has not stopped weaving in spite of being ill, and expecting to undergo surgery. Norma has used her loans to buy raw materials for her business. Her dream is to have a textile factory and export her products. She would also like to buy a weaving machine.

Norma L., is married and has two children. She likes to weave covers, hats, alpaca and lamb wool, which she sells at the fairs in Paucara and Yauli. Sometimes she takes her items to sell in Lima, with the help of her husband. She will use her loan to purchase raw materials for her business. Her dream is to have a large textile company, and to open a small grocery store to give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The Trabajando Juntas Communal Bank needs 6,200 nuevo soles for 10 members to invest in their business

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es: Roberta es una agradable mujer dedicada a la crianza de animales, los cuales compra cuando están pequeños para que luego de un tiempo de alimentarlos vende su carne en las ferias de los mercados más concurridos de las poblaciones cercanas.Esta actividad le está ayudando a poder instalar su tienda en su casa, con el fin de tener un ingreso adicional en su hogar para sus diversos gastos.  Ahora Roberta ha pensado comprar gran cantidad de animales, y abastecer la demanda de carne que existe en los mercados. De esta forma podrá consolidar su tan ansiada bodega, por la cual desde ya, siente una gran emoción de implementar.Con este fin, se presenta ante usted para solicitar este préstamo, con el que comprará cerdos, que pueda criar y vender dentro de un tiempo. Esperamos que usted contribuya con la necesidad de Roberta.
texts.en:
Roberta is a very pleasant woman, who works raising animals. She buys them when they are young, feeds them, and later she sells their meat in the most popular markets of nearby towns. This activity is helping her open a small store in her house, and have an additional income for her household expenses. Now Roberta is thinking of buying a larger number of animals, and supply the growing demand at the markets. This would allow her to fulfill her dream of having a larger store. She asks your help to obtain a loan that she will use to buy pigs, which she will fatten and sell later. We hope that you support Roberta's dream.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing pigs to increase meat sales

loans.name: Nidia Andrea

texts.es: Doña Nidia es comerciante, tiene una pequeña librería en su casa de habitación, donde también ofrece servicios de fotocopias y vende artículos de uso personal. Habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, es soltera y tiene dos hijos. Nidia tiene 6 años de tener el negocio, el cual inició con fondos propios y con mucho esfuerzo, el crédito solicitado es para inversión del mismo, desea comprar útiles escolares, para reforzar el inventario, ya que actualmente cuenta con pocas existencias del mismo y debido a la cercanía que su casa tiene con un colegio, los productos los está moviendo con mucha frecuencia
texts.en:
Nidia has a small store in her home. She sells school supplies and personal care items, and provides photocopying services. Nidia lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood, and is a single mother of two children. Nidia started her business 6 years ago with her own savings and much effort. She is requesting a loan to restock her inventory, as her home is close to a school and there is high demand for the supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing school supplies to restock store

loans.name: Eliécer Francisco

texts.es: El joven Eliécer C. tiene la edad de 25 años habita en la ciudad de Managua, actualmente vive  con su mamá, es soltero. Se desempeña como cocinero en el Hotel Campo Real desde hace tres años y medio, éste joven estudia los domingos para salir adelante, y también sacar adelante a su mamá y hermanos, por situaciones difíciles no ha podido terminar un cuarto que con mucho esfuerzo empezó a construir, y así tener un poco de independencia, el sueño de este joven es llegar a ser un profesional y así darle una vida mejor a su familia. Este joven solicita el crédito para poder terminar de comprar los materiales de construcción  y terminar de construir su habitación
texts.en:
Eliécer C. is a young man who is 25 years of age and lives in the city of Managua. Currently, he lives with his mother and is single. He works as a cook at the Campo Real Hotel where he has been for three years, and he studies on Sundays in order to get ahead. He wants to help his mother and siblings get ahead also and, due to some difficulties, he has not been able to finish a room that he started to build with much effort so he could have a little independence. This youngster’s dream is to get to become a professional and to provide a better life for his family. This young man requests a loan so that he can finish buying construction materals and finish building his room.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to finish building a bedroom.

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es: La Sra. Luisa Amanda tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, de 17, 23 y 26 años de edad, el negocio de doña Luisa es la venta de productos plásticos, su esposos le ayuda a ofertar el negocio y trabajan juntos para salir adelante, llevan quince años en las ventas e iniciaron con préstamos, y a través del tiempo el negocio lo han hecho más sólido. Con la solicitud de crédito es para invertir en material de construcción para reparar el techo de un cuarto de su hija que esta en mal estado. A futuro es comprar productos de mayor variedad, y así poder cumplir con los pedidos de los encargos de sus clientes. Poder dar estudios a su hijo menor para que sea un hombre de buena educación.
texts.en:
Luisa Amanda, 50, is married and lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood. She has three childres, ages 17, 23 and 26. Luisa's business is the sale of plastic wares. Her husband and she work together and have seen their business grow since they started with the help of loans 15 years ago. Luisa is requesting a loan to purchase constructions materials to repair the roof in the her daughter's room. In the future, her goal is to purchase a wider variety of products to satisfy her customers' demands. Her dream is to provide a good education for her youngest son.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing roof in home's room.

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es: El joven Jose N., es una persona joven de 32 años de edad, es soltero no depende nadie de él, habita en casa de su señora madre quien por falta de recursos economicos no le pudo dar  estudios, pero como todo microempresario tiene la vision de salir adelante crecer economicamente, tener su propia casa. Actualemnte se esta dedicando a la venta de ropa variada, y comesticos los que compra  en managua, dependiendo de su demanda, comercializando de forma ambulante, mas adelante pretende instalar una tienda donde ofertar su mercaderia de manera fija. El credito sera invertido para capital exclusivamente de trabajo ya que se avecinan los meses buenos y su demanda se ve incrementada.
texts.en:
Young Jose N. is a young person of 32 years of age. He is single and has no dependents. He lives in a house with his mother who, lacking economic resources, was not able to give him an education. However, like many small business entrepreneurs, he has a vision of getting ahead and growing financially and having his own home. Currently, he is dedicated to selling a variety of clothing and cosmetics that he buys in Managua. Depending on demand, he sells them on foot. Later, he aims to establish a store where he can offer his merchandise from a fixed location. This loan will be invested solely in working capital since the good months are approaching and demand will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es: Doña Elsa tiene 54 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada como técnico de planta, tiene un hijo de 26 años de edad, quien trabaja como contador en una empresa de teléfonos. Doña Elsa tiene una pulpería ubicada en el barrio Augusto Cesar Sandino de la ciudad de Managua, ella inició el negocio hace 8 años y empezó con capital propio producto de ahorros realizados durante parte de su vida y en éstos años ha podido formar su pequeño capital, aunque no es suficiente para poder surtir toda la pulpería, el préstamo lo requiere para complementar y así poder surtir la pulpería y poder ofrecer a sus clientes la variedad de productos que siempre la ha caracterizado. A largo plazo es obtener mejores ganancias, captar más clientes y tener una mejor vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Elsa is 54 years old. Her husband works as a technician in a privately-owned plant. Her 26-year-old son works as an accountant in a telephone company. Elsa runs a convenience store located in the Augusto Cesar Sandino neighborhood in Managua. She started her business 8 years ago with her own savings, and although she has been able to accumulate a small capital, it is not enough to restock her store. She is requesting this loan to supplement her own funds to stock the store with the variety of products that she usually carries and offers to her customers. Her long term goals are to increase her profits, increase the number of customers and have a better life with her familiy.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise to restock convenience store

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso Group

texts.en:
Nuevo Progreso is a community bank located in the Andean Mountains in the community of Viracochan, located 2,600 meters above sea level. This area is principally known for the breeding of animals such as cows and small animals including guinea pigs. In addition, corn, onion and wheat are grown here.

Julia A. D. C., a member of the Nuevo Progreso community bank in Ayacucho, Perú, lives with her husband and her three children aged 15, 12 and 9. She runs a grocery store in the area, sells meat, and operates a small restaurant patronized by many professionals and teachers visiting the area. When Julia first opened her store she did not have many patrons because she was still unknown, but since then the customers have increased. Since joining FINCA Perú she has been participating in training programs that help her improve her business. With the loan she is requesting, Julia will invest in her business by purchasing more products for her store and for her restaurant. She is saving for her dream of owning a car and helping her children continue their studies and becoming professionals.

Aida R. R., also a member of the community bank, lives in Ayacucho with her husband and two children aged 10 and 7. She runs her own grocery store where there is a kiosk available to buy refreshments. When Aida opened her store, there was political unrest which caused some problems, but since then the area has become more tranquil. FINCA Perú, which Aida recently joined, has helped her improve her business. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy more products for her store. FINCA Perú emphasizes savings, and with her savings Aida dreams of her children continuing their education and being financially independent.

loans.use: The 19 members need different amounts of money, ranging from $35 to $200, totaling $2300.

loans.name: Rosa Carmela

texts.es: Rosa  tiene 50 años de edad, ella empezó su negocio hace 15 años.  Su negocio es la fabricación y venta de pan, lo vende ella por las mañanas y por las tardes el encargado es su esposo, empezó a vender en su casa  luego se propuso a alquilar una casa, su esposo también trabaja con ella.  Tiene 4 hijos, y uno de ellos ya tiene su propia panadería, gracias a su ejemplo como empresaria y apoyo como madre.  Una de sus hijas es maestra de educación primaria, y la otra trabaja con ella en la panadería, ya que tiene mucha demanda de pedidos de pan.   Rosa quiere un préstamo  para poder comprar una maquina de amasijo de masa, lo cual el ayudaría a trabajar mejor y sin tanto esfuerzo.  También quiere con esta inversión de maquinaria, aprovechar las ventas de fin de año, las cuales gracias a Dios se incrementan.
texts.en:
Rosa is 50 years old. She started her business 15 years ago. Her business is the production and sale of bread, which she sells in the mornings and her husband is in charge of in the afternoons. She began selling in her house, then proposed to rent a house. Her husband also works with her. She has 4 children, one of which already has her own bakery thanks to Rosa's example as a businesswoman and support as a mother. One of her daughters is a primary school teacher, and another works with her in the bakery, as they have a high demand for bread orders.

Rosa wants a loan to be able to buy a dough mixing machine, which will help her to work better and without so much effort. Also, with this machinery investment, she wants to take advantage of the end-of-year sales, which, thank God, increase.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a machine for her bakery

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.en:
Clarissa M. F. is a member of community bank, Virgen de Cocharcas, at FINCA Perú. She has her own stand outside Acosvinchos, a school in Ayacucho. She sells cookies, refreshments and other snacks to the school children and has been providing this service for one year. 

She has requested a loan, which she will invest in her business to purchase crackers, candies, Inka Cola (a local refreshment), water, Coca Cola and various flavors of Fanta. With her savings she has been able to purchase clothes for her child. With the profit from her business, she dreams of having her own house, of being the sole administrator for her business and ensuring that her child remains in school.

loans.use: To invest in her business to purchase crackers, candies, Inka Cola (a local refreshment), water, Coca Cola and various flavors of Fanta

loans.name: Merci Seigneur Group

texts.en:
"Merci Seigneur" is a group of very excited people, all feeling that things are about to change in their lives. The members of this group live in extreme poverty and are hoping to receive a loan to try to better their lives. Marie P., a very dedicated mother of one child, is the representative of this group, chosen for her personality and hard work. Her plan is to use her loan to start a small business selling flowers, hoping to someday expand it into a flourishing business. Her dream is to have a nice clean house for her family and maybe even a car.

On behalf of Marie, the group, and Esperanza International---- Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: To become a flower vendor

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: La señora Sofía S. vive en la aldea Suacité  ella tiene una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, necesita el crédito para ampliar su tienda y surtirla con fideos, jabón, papel higiénico, golosinas, aguas, todo lo que se necesita para la gente  más demanda, ya que donde ella vive no hay muchas tiendas porque es una aldea, ella trabaja duro  ya que  enviudo hace 8 años y tiene que mantener 6 hijos, quiere sacarlos adelante y darles lo que necesitan.  También se dedica a criar marranos y luego venderlos. Logro conseguir una caseta para poder poner su tienda en la calle principal anteriormente la tenia el su casa que esta en un sector mas retirado, su sueño hacer crecer su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos que ayuden a su familia para poder seguir enviándolos a la escuela.
texts.en:
Ms. Sofia S. lives in the small village of Suacite. She has a store where she sells basic daily consumption items. She needs a loan to expand her store and stock it with noodles, soap, toilet paper, candy, and drinks. She needs all of this to meet her customers' demands, as there are not many stores where she lives because it is a small village. She works hard, since she was widowed 8 years ago and has had to care for her 6 children. She wants to see them move forward and give them what they need. She also raises pigs and later sells them. She was able to get a stall to be able to put her store on the main street. Previously, she had it in her house, which is in a more remote area. Her dream is to expand her business and increase her income to help her family and to be able to continue sending her children to school.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital investment in buying basic daily consumption items

loans.name: Maria Coralia

texts.es:
La  Señora  Coralia Sunjù  empezó su negocio de la tienda hace 18 años,  que poco a poco ha ido agrandando, ella desea obtener el crédito ya que quiere aprovechar que viene una buena temporada, quiere surtir con mas productos su tienda, como azúcar,  arroz, fideos, etc. y también comprar regalos para diferente ocasiones que los mismos clientes le piden, ella quiere tener disponible mercadería y esto le ayudará en gran manera a incrementar su negocio y que la gente la busque porque tiene lo que ellos necesitan.   Ella tiene 3 hijos dos de ellas trabajan y le ayudan,
Siempre ha trabajado duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos tiene un pequeño negocio vendiendo chuchitos y café en el parque local de San Raymundo, donde ella vive.
texts.en:
Ms. Coralia S. started her store business 18 years ago and, little by little, has expanded it. She would like to obtain a loan, since she wants to take advantage of the good season ahead. She wants to stock her store with more products, such as sugar, rice, noodles, etc. and also to buy gifts for different occasions, which her clients ask for. She wants to have the products available and this will help her in a big way to grow her business and people will seek her out because she has what they need. She has three children, two of which work and help her. She has always worked hard to get her children ahead. She has a small business selling chuchitos (a local tamale-like snack) and coffee in the local park in San Raymundo where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her store

loans.name: Maria Asuncion

texts.es: La señora Asuncion J. es una señora de 42 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos el mayor cursa el cuarto año de secundaria tiene 18 años de edad, su otra hija es una jovencita de 14 años de edad y cursa el segundo años de secundaria y su ultimo hijo tiene  8 años y cursa el tercer grado de primaria, el padre de sus hijos tambien es comerciante no tiene un ingreso fijo, Uno de sus propositos de Doña suncion es poder mejorar su casa de habitacion, comprar una terreno y construir por consiguiente darle un techo digno a sus hijos, sacarlos adelante en sus estudios es decir ayudarle en lo mas que se pueda. La actividad economica de la señora es la comercializacion de ropa en general, calzado nacional masaya, y cosmeticos, la señora compra en managua y comercializa de forma ambulante ya que no tiene un lugar establecido, teniendo mas de 19 años de dedicarse a este negocio y es con lo cual ha sacado adelante a su familia, esperando contar con el apoyo de nuestra institucion a  traves de los prestamos que son invertidos en capital de trabajo exclusivamente
texts.en:
Ms. Asuncion J. is a woman of 42 years old. She is a single mother with three children. The oldest is in his fourth year of high school and is 18 years old. Her daughter is a young lady of 14 years and is in the second year of high school. Her youngest son is 8 years old and is in the third grade. The father of her children is a merchant who does not have a fixed income. One of Asuncion's goals is to be able to make improvements to her house, to buy land, and build to then give a decent roof to her children. She wants to see her children advance in their studies, that is to say, to help them in as much as she can.

Asuncion's economic activity is selling clothing, local footwear, and cosmetics. She buys them in Managua and sells them through traveling sales, since she does not have an established place. She has spent over 19 years working in this business and it is what she has used to get her family ahead. She hopes to count on the support from our institution through loans, which are invested exclusively in working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital for her business

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: El señor Manuel S. de 60 años de edad, trabaja como guarda de seguridad desde hace 2 años en el Residencial Bosques de Juigalpán, con un hijo de 13 años el que trabaja para ayudar a la familia, su compañera también trabaja. El señor S. está solicitando su segundo crédito el que utilizará para remodelar su vivienda, cambiará el techo de su casa que está en pésimas condiciones, como también comprará madera para realizar cambios ya que su casa es forrada de tablas y están en mal estado por lo que requiere hacer algunos cambios. El señor S. es una persona muy responsable, honesta, cumplida con su trabajo y con sus créditos, plantea que una vez que cancele este crédito, solicitará otro para continuar mejorando su casita.
texts.en:
Mr. Manuel S. is 60-years old and works as a security guard for the past 2 years for the Residential Bosque de Juigalpan. His 13-year old son and his companion also work to help the family. Mr. S. requests a loan to remodel his house, in order to change the roof which is in very poor condition. He also wants to purchase wood to make changes to the lining of the house as it too is in poor condition. Mr. S. is very responsible, honest and hardworking and once he repays this loan, he will request another loan to continue making improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix his roof and make other home improvements

loans.name: Maribel Del Rosario

texts.es: La profesora Maribel del Rosario, casada, de 35 años de edad, profesora de la Escuela San Pablo, desde hace 15 años labora en el turno matutino de 7:00am a 12:00pm tiene 2 hijas de 14 años (gemelas) estudiando el 3er. Año de secundaria. La profesora tiene un pequeño negocio de fritanga desde hace 3 años, este primer crédito lo utilizará para comprar en efectivo la leña y todos los productos que utilizará para la elaboración de comidas, ella vende enchiladas, refrescos, tajadas con carne de res, pollo, cerdo y queso, este trabajo lo realiza por la tarde de las 2:00p.m hasta 10:00pm. Su esposo es técnico en refrigeración, con su taller propio, también trabaja a domicilio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maribel del Rosario is a school teacher at the San Pablo School where she has taught for the past 15-years during the morning shift from 7 AM to 12 PM. She is married with two twin girls (age 14) who are studying in their 3rd year of secondary school.
