Lawrence has been a motorcycle mechanic in Kisoga for 7 years, and he has been a member of his lending group, Magezi buggaga, since its inception two years ago. He started getting loans in order to improve his business, and the loans taught him to save. He was able to buy a motorcycle of his own, which he uses a boda-boda (a bicycle or motorcycle taxi) to bring in extra income every day. He also started up a stall where his wife sells fresh produce and greens; this also helps to supply part of their household needs.

Lawrence is seeking for a loan to buy more materials for his workshop, including a tire pumping machine, screwdrivers, and many other tools.

loans.use: To buy a tire pumping machine, screwdrivers, and other tools for his motorcycle shop

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma baji is a wife of H. A.. She lives in a small area named Yadgar in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. She is the mother of three children: two daughters and one son. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.

Salma baji's husband is an employee in the post office. Salma baji has a business making decoratively embroidered dresses. She has been in this profession for the last 12 years.

She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more material such as clothes, colored thread and sketches so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy material to expand her business

loans.name: Suraiya

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is a widow of A. G.. She lives in a small area named Yadgar in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this area for the last 40 years.

She is the mother of two sons. Both sons are involved in a scrap metal business. They buy iron from different factories and sell those pieces to other people. Suraiya baji works in a school as a maid. She is applying for a loan to buy iron for her sons' scrap metal business.

loans.use: To buy more iron to resell

loans.name: Nadira

texts.en:
Nadira Ajkunić was born in 1961. She is married and lives together with her husband in Kalo ević, a village near Te anj. Nadira`s husband works outside of Bosnia and Nadira sells clothes and other textiles at the marketplace.

Nadira has been a good client of WWI for a long time, and this will be her fourth loan through WWI to develop her textile business. She wants to be ready for the coming winter season and she needs a loan in amount of 1500 KM to buy clothes for re-selling. Nadira hopes to extend her business just little more.

loans.use: To buy clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Ling

texts.en: Ling U., is 65, married, and lives in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. They have five children. Ling and her husband are rice farmers and make about $5 each day by selling their crops at a market. Their oldest daughter owns a grocery product stand and makes about $3 to $4 a day in revenue. She helps contribute to the household savings. The grocery business has been doing very well and there has been an increase in customers. Ling  and her family will need more capital to satisfy the growth in customer demands. They have applied for a $1000 loan amount from KIVA via CREDIT MFI to purchase more products to expand their inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Koessan

texts.fr: A. Koessan est un homme dynamique  âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il exploite un magasin de lavage à sec et boutique de prêt à porter dans un  quartier très commercial de Lomé la capitale Togolaise. Il veut contribuer à la prospérité de son affaire en gagnant la confiance de ses clients  et désire par ce troisième crédit renforcer son  fond de roulement . Avec cette chance de Kiva, il pourrait désormais faire face à une clientèle exigeante en tissus de marque, gagner plus d’argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koessan A. is an energetic man, 32 years old, married, and the father of two. He runs a dry-cleaning store and a shop of ready-to-wear clothing in a highly commercial district in Lomé, the Togolese capital. He wants to add to the prosperity of his business by winning the trust of his customers and wishes to use this third loan to bolster his working capital. With this Kiva opportunity, he would then be able to address his customers who demand name-brand fabrics, to earn more money, and to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a washing machine

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im C., 40, is married, and is a mother of four children. She has been working with her husband since 1998, as fishermen at the Tunle Mekong River, in Cambodia. They make around $5 a day from selling fish at a river dock market. They use a boat, fishing nets, and other fishing tools to help improve the output of their business. 
Eventually they will like to build their own pond to breed fish, which will bring in more money and will help improve their current living conditions. Im C. and her husband are applying for a loan to purchase larger fishing nets, in order to catch more fish. It will help increase their family's income.

loans.use: To buy more fishing nets for a business.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia baji is a wife of A. D. and lives in a small area named Yadgar in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 10 years. She is the mother of one son, who is 2 years old.

Shazia baji's husband makes sharp wire - barbed wire - which is used to cover fencing around gardens and the tops of houses. The purpose of using sharp wires is to protect the building from robbers or animals.

Shazia baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. Shazia baji is applying for a loan so her husband can buy iron to make more sharp wires.

loans.use: To buy iron

loans.name: Ream

texts.en:
Ream L., 30, is married and lives with her husband in Kork Russey, in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She  started a business in 2002 selling various grocery products, making an average of $15/day in income. Her husband is a rice farmer and and the output he gathers only feeds his family. Ream L. is really happy with her increase in sales and is happy to see her business improving.
Inflation rate in Cambodia is still a big concern especially with the high price of goods on the rise. Ream L. uses a taxi to in order to purchase large quantities of grocery products from wholesalers to resell. The majority of the products have doubled, as well as the cost of taking a taxi back and forth.
In order to deduct her business transportation expenses and to help accelerate her business output, Ream L. is asking for a loan from KIVA to purchase a motor-bike so she can purchase more goods.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike to use for her business transportation.

loans.name: Twezimbe Women's Group

texts.en:
K. Jane is a married woman with 3 children because she cares for 2 orphaned children. All the children are in school. Jane is also the chairperson of Twezimbe women's group in Kigunga, Mukono. This is a new group that has just formed to get a loan from Pearl Microfinance; without the loan, the members do not have the capital they need to improve their businesses.

Jane's business is tailoring: she makes school uniforms and ladies' wear. She also owns a gift shop in the same trading centre. She has struggled to pay the rent for her businesses. Many girls approach Jane, wanting to learn the tailoring trade, but Jane has only one sewing machine, which she needs to use to supply her customers' needs, so she is unable to teach them. This is one of the reasons why she joined her group: she dreams of owning as many sewing machines as possible so she can help as many young girls as possible. Jane is positive about this dream.

With this loan, Jane plans to buy more material for her tailoring business and more gifts for her gift shop.

loans.use: To buy more material for her tailoring business and more gifts for her gift shop.

loans.name: Farheen

texts.en: Farheen baji, the wife of B. A., has lived in an area of Lahore, Pakistan named Yadgar for the last 22 years. She is the mother of two preschool-aged daughters. Farheen baji's husband, who has made lath machines for the last nine years, sells them in various Pakistani cities.  Farheen is applying for a loan to buy spare parts to make another lath machine in order to earn a good profit.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to make a lath machine.

loans.name: Mrs. Yue Sakhorn's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village loan is taken by thirteen people who live in Svay Mean Leak Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. 

Mrs. Yue S. was selected by the members to be the village president. She owns a small store in the local village where she sells desserts. Mrs. Yue S. is 57 years old and the mother of a 14-year-old child who attends the local school. 

Her husband, Mr. Tech Banheng, has 1/2 hectare (1.25 acres), on which he cultivates rice to earn a living. He now faces an obstacle because his field is infertile. To solve this problem, his wife is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and make the crops more productive. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term (EoT) loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly-payment loans. Members with end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows the borrower to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Although they are not required to, most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Hem Bora's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people I. Pou Doh Village I. Kanal Province are sharing a village bank loan. 

Mrs. Hem B., the village bank president, is a farmer. She now faces an obstacle because her field is infertile. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Hem B. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to improve her crops.

Her husband, Mr. Nu B., is a tuk-tuk driver who does not earn enough income to support his family. Mrs. Hem B. is 42 years old and the mother of seV. children, three of whom are employed I. a garment factory; other three attend the local school. The youngest one, age 4, is too young to work or study

Mr. Nem Nat did not come to the loan meeting, so his wife, who attended the meeting, appears I. the photograph. Mr. Thon Savuth, who is the group guarantor, is shown I. the picture, too. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly-payment loans. Members with end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's maI. product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani baji is a wife of M. and lives in an area named Yadgar in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 50 years. She is the mother of two sons. Both of her sons are involved in a scrap metal business. Rani baji's husband works in the same business as his sons.

Her husband and her sons started this business 3 years ago. They earn a good profit from this business. Rani baji is a housewife who takes care of her family. She also works as a midwife.

She is applying for a loan to buy more scrap metal to expand her family business.

loans.use: To buy more scrap metal

loans.name: Khayal

texts.en:
Khayal M. is 22 years old, recently married, and has one child. Khayal is a young market vendor. He has four years experience selling women clothes in the local market. His wife is a housekeeper, thus his business is the only source of income for his family. For this reason, he works hard to bring sustenance back to his home. Khayal wants his current child and future children to get a good education to have a better chance to succeed in the future. This is what makes his sacrifice worthwhile.

To grow his business, Khayal is requesting a loan of $1000 USD. He will use the loan to purchase merchandise so he can offer a wider selection to his customers and increase his income. The well being of Khayal's family and his business are in your hands. Khayal and his family are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz H.  is 55 years old. She is married and has three children. Gulnaz sells drugs at a drug store. She has an education in pharmacy, and now she is one of the leading pharmacists in her region. She rents a place in the center of town. She has been running her small business for more that 15 years. Gulnaz works very hard to give her children a good education and to make them happy. 

In order to cover the higher education expenses of her oldest child at the university, Gulnaz wants to increase her range of goods. For this reason she applied for a loan of $1200 USD. She thanks you for your support and promises to repay the loan on time. She is counting on your help. Be an important part of the growth of Gulnaz's business.

loans.use: To increase increase her range of goods

loans.name: Mrs. Chhay Kemheng's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank consists of twenty-one members who are located in Kandal Leu Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. 

Mrs. Chhay K. has been selected by the members to be the village bank president. She owns a small store where she sells dinnerware (plates, glasses, chopsticks…etc).  Her business is going well and she wants to expand it, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more dinnerware to resell to her customers. 

Her husband, Mr. Chum Routha, has a small business in which he uses electricity to charge customers' batteries. 

Mrs. Chhay K. is 34 years old and the mother of three children, a 3-year-old, and two children who attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy more dinnerware to resell

loans.name: Stella Valimba's Tuinuane Group

texts.en:
Stella V., age 60, is married with 5 children. She has a chicken business which she started more than ten years ago. She works all day long from her house and is able to make a monthly profit of about $86.

Stella has taken out one previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business by buying more chickens and chicken feed. She hopes for a new loan to use for the same purpose as the last one. Stella will share this loan with her group, Tuinuane, which totals 21 members. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture Stella is 1st on the left 3rd row, in a blue blouse.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en: Tarana I. is a dynamic 36-year-old mother of two sons. Her husband is unemployed and sometimes helps in her clothing sales business. This is the family’s only source of income. Faced with the need to feed her children, Tarana began to sell different types of clothing eight years ago. Step-by-step, thanks to her passion for making sales and her personality, she has increased her number of clients and her business has grown. During these eight years, she has found that selling women’s clothing is the most profitable, so now all clothes she sells are for women.  At this moment, Tarana needs a loan of $1000 USD that she will use to buy more merchandise to meet the needs of her clients for the winter season. Help Tarana improve her family's quality of life by contributing to the growth of her business. She thanks you sincerely.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the winter season

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin A. is a 46-year-old married man with three adorable daughters. Yasin is a hard-working man who started his own business as a source of income and savings in case of unemployment. He knew many people who purchased cattle, and this motivated him to start his own business 20 years ago. Over time, he has increased his cattle sales, and he is proud to say that the business has been running well, but he now needs additional capital to expand his business. 

Therefore, Yasin requests a loan of $1200 USD to purchase four calves. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in helping to expand his business and helping them give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Elshen

texts.en: Elshen A. is 37 years old. He's married and has three children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in his life pushed him to recognize the value of work from a very young age. For about 15 years, he and his wife have been purchasing calves in the local market, fattening them, and selling them. Elshen is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and to educate his children. Elshen wakes up early every morning to feed his calves with the goal of fattening them and selling them at the best price in the local market. Now he applied for a loan of $1200 USD to buy four calves to expand his business. Your generosity can change his life.

loans.use: To buy four calves

loans.name: Mr. Kreus Moeun's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan will be shared by twelve people who live in Preak Reusei Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. Each members of the loan group plans to use the loan for a different purpose. 

Mr. Eng M. has been selected by the members to be the village bank president. He and his wife, Mrs. San K., are farmers. They face a small problem because their field is infertile. To solve this problem, Mr. Eng M. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field and to make his crop more productive. He is 54 years old and the father of two children who attend the local school. 

Mr. Kreus C. did not come to the loan meeting, but his wife attended, so she appears in the photograph.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly-payment loans. Members with end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support his field and make his crop more productive.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Дарьеева Шоира живет в городе Нурек. Не замужем . Живет с родителями и сестрой. Занимается торговлей моющих средств. Бизнесом занялась четыре года назад. Он приносит неплохой доход , поэтому она планирует получить кредит и увеличить ассортимент товара. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев
texts.en:
Shoira D. lives in the city of Nurek. She is single and lives with her parents and sister. Shoira sells detergents. She started her business four years ago. The business is quite profitable. Therefore Shoira would like to obtain a loan to increase turnover. She plans to pay off the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase turnover

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru A. is 38 years old. He is married and has two adorable children. 

Nuru has been breeding cattle since 2004. He is a purposeful person. He likes animals and enjoys looking after them. He is quite experienced in choosing the animals, and he knows how to breed them and look after them.  He gets up every morning at 5 A.M. to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and generate a stable income for his large family. 

Nuru is planning to add to his livestock by purchasing one cow and two calves. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of $1200 USD. Nuru thanks you for trusting and supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Alimata

texts.fr:
Madame Alimata T. est âgée de 49 ans et vit avec ses 8(huit) enfants et son époux dans une famille monogame au quartier Somono de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Issue d’une famille de commerçants, elle n’a jamais fréquenté l’école et commença très tôt les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère qui vendait les poissons au marché journalier de Ségou. Très expérimentée dans le domaine du commerce, elle opta pour l’achat vente des bazins teintés et des pagnes wax (de différentes qualités) depuis maintenant 15 ans. Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante et exigeante, elle décida de rejoindre le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elle est en relation depuis 4 ans. Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel après 4 prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) tous correctement remboursés.
Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter, 5 pièces de pagnes wax, 3 pièces de tissus Bazin (qui seront teints avant la vente) et  2 jeux de couvres lits au grand marché de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali.) auprès des commerçants grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant en détail et à crédit payable mensuellement au niveau des entreprises, chez elle à domicile et en ambulant dans les quartiers de la ville de Ségou. Ce cycle de production (achat teinture et vente) dure environ un mois.
Madame Alimata Thiero espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA.qui lui permettra d’augmenter la taille de ses affaires et aider son mari à supporter les charges de la famille (nourritures, frais scolaires etc.).
texts.en:
Mrs. Alimata Thiero is 49 years old and lives with her eight (8) children and husband as a monogamous family in the Somono neighborhood of Ségou ( the fourth administrative district of the Republic of Mali).

She was born into a family of business people but was never able to attend school. She started generating income through business activities very early on, learning from her mother, who sold fish in the markets of Ségou. She is very innovative in her business activities and has opted to buy and sell hand dyed bazin (colored fabric) and wax dyed pagne (decorative cloth), of different qualities, for the last 15 years. This is her second personal loan and she has also made four (4) group loans that were duly repaid.

With this loan she plans to buy five (5) pieces of wax dyed "pagne", three (3) pieces of "bazin" fabric (which must be dyed before selling) and two (2) sets of bed sheets from commercial wholesalers at the central market in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). She sells items at retail for cash, and to businesses for credit, payable in monthly installments. She sells these items from her home and through traveling sales throughout the neighborhoods of Ségou. Her production cycle ( buy, dye, and sell) takes about one month.

Mrs. Alimata Thiero hopes to realize a monthly income of 50,000 francs CFA which would allow her to expand her business and assist her husband with meeting family expenses. (food,school expenses etc.)

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wax dyed "pagne" (decorative cloth), "bazin" (colored fabric) and bed sheets

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Elizabeth from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has two children, ages 14 and 19. She also supports another dependant because his parents cannot take care of him. Elizabeth runs a genge or a grocery business. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, where general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice, and dried fish are sold. It is the kind of place that local people send their children to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don't have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient. Elizabeth's business is doing good. She works at the business 13 hours day, 7 days week, and she has two employees to assist her. Elizabeth currently earns about $350 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $425 USD so she can purchase additional stock. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Elizabeth thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Musa Gwichara Tijikomboe Kichemchem Group

texts.en:
Musa G., age 31, is married with two sons (ages 5 and 3). He has a general store which he started 4 years ago. He works from 6am to 9pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $78.

In the past, Musa has taken out five loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase the stock of his general store. He now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. Musa will share this loan with his group, Tujikomboe Kichemchem, which has 15 members. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture Musa is the only man, standing second from the right in the back row.

loans.use: To increase stock of general store.

loans.name: Aqil

texts.en:
Aqil H. is only 20 but he already owns of a small business. His primary activity and only source of income is selling foodstuff like pastries, cookies, candies, condensed milk, tea, caned meat, mayonnaise, soft drinks, and other items in a store that he rents. Aqil started his business in the beginning of 2008 and now his business going very well. Because of his personality and easy-going character, he has gained the respect of a wide variety of clients. He is very polite and his store is very popular with local residents, whose patronage allows him to earn a good income for his family. Aqil covers the needs of his old parents who are on a pension and his brothers and sisters, who are students. 

Aqil has applied for a loan of $1000 USD and will use the loan to buy more items to sell. This will allow him to earn more and meet the needs of his family.  Aqil thanks you for your support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Holikul

texts.ru: Достов Холикул проживает в городе Яван. Работает учителем в средней школе. Кроме того занимается разведением и торговлей крупно рогатого скота. Занимается этим делом уже 13 лет. Обратился к нам за кредитом для того , чтобы купить пару молодых бычков. Откормив их он сможет их выгодно продать. Это даст возможность расширить свой бизнес. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 15 месяцев.Холикул женат и имеет шестерых детей.
texts.en:
Holikul D. lives in the town of Yavan. He works as a teacher in secondary school. Besides his job he also has a business of breeding and selling cattle. He has been in this business for the past thirteen years. He came to us for a loan so that he can buy a couple of young calves. By feeding them for a while he can later make a good profit. It will also let him expand his business. He plans to pay off the loan within 15 months. Holikul is also married and has six children.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Amadou D. est âgé de 31 ans, célibataire et père   d’un (1) enfant. Il vit dans le quartier Darsalam de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali), dans une famille traditionnelle avec son enfant, ses frères et soeurs, son père, sa mère et les autres parents.
Après plusieurs activités économiques sans succès(bricolage de  telephones portables , de téléviseurs, de radios, etc pendant son séjour en république de Gambie). Ensuite, il rentre au pays natal pour se spécialiser dans la vente d’accessoires de téléphones portables (batteries, façades, chargeurs, cables USB  etc) depuis  maintenant  5 ans.
Située en face de la nouvelle gare routière de Ségou, sa boutique est au bord de  l’une des artères principales les plus frequentée de la ville. Dans le souci d’agrandir la taille de son activité afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus exigeante, il décide d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 167 façades, 63 batteries, 55 chargeurs, 100 microphones pour téléphones portables. Il  s’approvisionne généralement  à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et quelques fois en république du Togo (en Afrique de l’Ouest)  et  vend ses articles au comptant en détail ou  à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes de tous les âges.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA.qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt, le loyer du magasin et investir le reste dans les affaires.. Dans l’avenir, il compte devenir un commerçant import-export entre la république du Mali et le Royaume d’Arabie Saoudite.
texts.en:
Monsieur Amadou D. is 31 years old, single, and father of one child. He lives in the Darsalam district of a town called Ségou (in Administrative Region IV of the Republic of Mali), in a traditional family environment with his child, his brothers and sisters, his parents and other relatives.

He had several failed attempts at business (repairing mobile phones, televisions, radios etc.) during his stay in the Republic of The Gambia. Then, five years ago, he returned to his native country to specialize in selling mobile phone accessories (batteries, covers, chargers, USB cables etc.).

His shop, located opposite the new bus station in Ségou, is on one of the town’s busiest main roads. With a desire to grow his business in order to satisfy his ever more demanding clientele, he has decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program, with whom he is now applying for his first personal loan.

He intends to use this loan to buy 167 covers, 63 batteries, 55 chargers and 100 microphones for mobile telephones. He usually stocks up in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali) or sometimes in the Togolese Republic (in West Africa) and sells the products for cash or credit to a clientele consisting of men and women of all ages.

He hopes to make a monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA ($115 USD), which he will use to pay off the loan interest and the rent for the shop. He will invest the remainder in his business. In the future, he hopes to become an import-export trader between the Republic of Mali and the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy covers, batteries and chargers for mobile phones

loans.name: Stumai

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Stumai M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with five children between the ages of 20 years and 30 years old. Stumai has been running a charcoal business since 2003. Charcoal is the primary fuel used for cooking food in Tanzania. Woods are burned in a low-air environment to produce charcoal. Stumai normally buys charcoal from those who produce it wholesale, and she then sells it to customers around her area. Her business is doing very well. She works at the business for nine hours per day, seven days per week; she is assisted by one employee. Stumai currently earns about 500 USD from this business. She is requesting a loan of 850 USD in order to purchase additional stock of charcoal. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Stumai thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Mahman

texts.fr:
Madame Mahman Sangaré est âgée de 44 ans et vit avec ses 7 enfants et son époux dans une famille traditionnelle élargie (beau père, belles mères, beaux frères et belles sœurs...) au quartier Pelengana Sébénikoro de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après plusieurs tentatives sans succès au diplôme d’études fondamentales, elle s’essaya à beaucoup d’activités génératrices de revenus mais finit par faire le commerce d’habits pour enfants et des pagnes wax (des tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’Ouest). En plus elle fait de l’achat et de la vente des chaussures et des bijoux (bracelets, boucles d’oreilles et chaînes généralement appelés garantis au Mali).
Dans le souci de maintenir sa clientèle de plus en plus importante, elle décida de rejoindre le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elle est en relation depuis 3 ans. Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel après 4 prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire avec une association de son quartier) tous remboursés sans difficultés.
Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter, 34 complets pour enfants, 10 pièces de pagne wax et 10 paires de chaussures sur place à Ségou et au grand marché de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès de commerçants grossistes. Avec une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes, elle effectue ses ventes au comptant en détail et à crédit payable mensuellement au niveau des entreprises, dans les quartiers et chez elle à domicile. 
Madame Mahman Sangaré compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA.qui lui permettra d’augmenter la taille de ses affaires et épauler son conjoint pour supporter les charges de la famille élargie.  Son ambition est d’avoir un terrain à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Ms. Mahman Sangaré is 44 years old and lives with her seven children and husband in a traditional extended family (in-laws: father, mothers, brothers, and sisters) in the Pelengana Sébénikoro district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After several unsuccessful attempts at a diploma of basic studies, she tried many income-generating activities but ended up doing commerce in children's clothing and in Wax pagnes (highly valued cloth in West Africa). In addition, she trades in shoes and jewelry (bracelets, earrings, and chains generally called guaranteed in Mali). Concerned about maintaining her large and growing customer base, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, with which she has had an association for three years. She is on her second individual loan following four group loans (solidarity loans with an association in her district), which were all repaid without difficulty. With this loan, she intends to buy: 34 children's outfits, 10 pieces of Wax pagnes, and 10 pairs of shoes locally in Ségou and at the grand marketplace of Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). This stock will be gotten from wholesale merchants. With a customer base essentially composed of women, she makes her sales in cash at the retail level and also on credit, payable monthly for enterprises, from district to district and out of her home. Ms. Mahman Sangaré intends to realize a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA, which will enable her to increase the size of her business and to cover the expenses of her extended family. Her ambition is to acquire a plot of land for building a house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's clothing, Wax pagnes, and shoes

loans.name: Nasima

texts.ru: Исмоилова Насима жительница Явана. Домохозяйка . Замужем , имеет четверых детей. Имеет одного теленка и давно планировала купить еще одного бычка. Для этог она решила обратиться к нам за получением кредита. Благодоря ему она сможет увеличить хозяйство . Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев. Насима замужем и имеет четверых детей.
texts.en:
Nasima I. lives in the town of Yavan. She is a housewife. She is married and has four children. She has one calf and was planning to buy another one for a long time. She has decided to come to us and ask for a loan for this purpose. It will let her increase her business. She will be able to pay off the loan within 10 months. Nasima is also married and has four children.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.ru: Исмоилова Хосият живет со своей семьей в одном из кишлаков Явана. Занимается разведением крупно рогатого скота. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже три года. Разводит телят  и кроме того торгует молоком , скупая его у соседей. Для того , чтобы увеличить доход от продаваемого молока , она решила купить свою корову. Кроме того она может дать потомство. Это даст возможность увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hosiyat I. lives with her family in one of the Kishlakvs of Yavan. She is involved in the breeding of cattle. She has been involved in this type of business for 3 years. She breeds calves and trades milk, buying it from her neighbors. Therefore to increase revenue from the milk business she has decided to buy her own cow. Other than milk, the cow will be able to provide future calves. This will give the opportunity to increase the herd. She plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Arkin

texts.ru: Кахоров Эркин житель города Яван. Но живет он очень далеко от центра. Имеет продуктовый магазин рядом с домом . Это единственный магазин в их селении , кроме того магазин является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Эркин женат и имеет двоих детей. Планирует сделать ремонт в магазине , на что и запрашивает кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.Это поможет улучшить условия работы и хранения продуктов. На кредит закупит стройматериалы.
texts.en:
Arkin K. is a citizen of the city of Yavan. He lives very far from the center of the city. He owns a grocery store and a house. This is the only store in the surrounding region, and it is also the only source of income for his family. Arkin is married and has 2 children. He plans to renovate the store and he wants to take out a loan, which he plans to repay in 10 months. This will allow for better working conditions and the preservation of goods. With the loan he will buy building materials.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovation of Building

loans.name: Msiba

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 58-year-old Msiba S. from Dar es Salaam. She is a widowed woman with four children between the ages of 19 and 27 years old; additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because his parents do not take care of him. Msiba has been running a café business since 1993. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all-local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces. Msiba's business is doing well. She works at the business for four hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Msiba currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 350 USD in order to renovate her café and to purchase additional cooking oil, wheat flour and maize flour. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Msiba thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To renovate her cafe and to purchase supplies in bulk

loans.name: Zubayda.

texts.ru: Лачинова Зубайда живет в городе Яван. Работает в городе Нурек.Арендует прилавок  в магазине , где торгует продуктами питания. Занимается данным бизнесом уже четыре года. Хочет увеличить товарооборот . Для этого ей необходимо получить кредит. Это поможет ей увеличить доходы, в который так нуждаются ее дети. Зубайда разведена и имеет двоих детей. Поэтому ей просто необходимо увеличить зарабатываемые ею деньги.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zubayda L. lives in the city of Yavan. She works in the town of Hyrek. She rents a booth in a store, where she trades food products. She has been involved in this type of business for 4 years. She wants to increase commodity circulation. However to do this she needs to receive a loan, this will help her increase revenue which her kids are in desperate need of. Zubayda is divorced and has 2 children. Therefore it is imperative for her to increase her profits. She plans to return the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of commodity circulation

loans.name: Assomiddin

texts.ru: Назиров Ассомидин житель города Яван. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Единственным источником заработка в его семье является его дело. Он работает таксистом . Зарабатывает не плохо , но он  улучшить качество обслуживания путем ремонта своего автомобиля. Для этого он планирует получить кредит и сделать запланированное. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 3 месяцев.
texts.en:
Assomidden N. is a citizen of the city of Yavan. He is married and has 4 children. The only source of income for his family is from his business being a taxi driver. His income is not poor, but her will increase the quality of his service if he repairs his automobile. For this to occur he plans on receiving a loan to do the planned repairs. He plans to repay the loan within 3 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovation of Automobile

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly M. (pictured here with her son who studies at a University), 55, is a widow with six children. Three of her children are married and live outside the family home. The family lives about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.
Ly has been a rice farmer since 1979. She also grows and sells sapodilla. 
Ly is requesting a loan of $1000 to help pay school fees for her son and also to purchase more fertilizer and pesticide so she can grow more rice.

loans.use: To pay school fee for her son and purchase fertilizer and pesticide for growing rice.

loans.name: Bunavsha.

texts.ru: Пиракова  Бунавша живет в городе Нурек. Замужем и имеет двоих детей. Ей 33 года и уже 4 года она занимается торговлей. Арендует магазин . Торгует продуктами питания. Хочет получить кредит и использовать его на приобретение новых прилавков.Сделав, небольшой ремонт Бунавша создаст для клиентов хорошие условия и тем самым сможет привлечь новых клиентов. Это даст возможность получить дополнительную прибыль. Погасит кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Bunavsha P. lives in the city of Hyrek. She is married and has 2 children. She is 33 years old and for 4 years she has been involved with trade. She rents a store and trades groceries. She wants to receive a loan and use it to obtain new booths. This accomplished, she plans to have some small renovations and this will improve the quality of the store to her clients, and attract new client. This will allow for more revenue, she plans to repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new booths

loans.name: Malai

texts.en:
Malai M. (shown in the picture with her mother), 26, is single and lives with her parents. She has one brother and three sisters. Her brother is a driver, two of her sisters are in school, and one sister is a garment factory worker. The family lives along national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.
Malai has been a garment factory worker for four years. She has been selling clothes that she creates for two years now. She is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mr. Saroeun N., 54, and his wife, Mrs. Sara Pun, 51, who live along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1979 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home while one daughter is a garment factory worker and the other two children study in local school.

Saroeun and his wife have been farming since 1979, growing rice both for sale and for personal consumption. He is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for the plowing of his rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for plowing of his rice farm.

loans.name: Azam

texts.ru:
Узбеков Азам житель города Яван. В центре города имеет магазин , где торгует продуктами питания. Занимается данным видом бизнеса уже два года. Бизнес приносит прибыль , которую хватает лишь на то , чтобы прокормить семью. Азам  имеет большую семью . Он женат и имеет шестерых детей. 
 Для развития бизнеса необходимо дополнительное влияние финансовых средств. Поэтому он планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Это поможет ему получить дополнительную прибыль.
texts.en:
Azam U. is a citizen of the city of Yavan. He owns a store in the center of the city, where he trades groceries. He has been involved with this type of business for two years already. The business brings in profits, which are barely enough to feed his large family. Azam is married and has 6 children. To increase his business it is imperative that a financial intervention occurs. Therefore he plans to receive a loan which he plans to repay within 12 months. This will help him increase his profits.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of commodity circulation

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.ru:
Абдучалил парень 1985 года рождения , не женат работает электриком на фабрике.В свободное время в выходные дни занимается уходом и откормом крупнорогатого скота. По мимо его ему в доме помогают его отец- пенсионер.
В момент мониторинга Абдучалил отсутствовал и мне пришлось сфотографировать его отца который занимался уходом за скотом. Абдучалил решил обратится в Микроинвест для расширения своего бизнеса животноводства.
texts.en:
Abdujalil is a guy who was born in 1985. Unmarried, he works as a factory electrician. In his free time on his days off, he cares for and feeds large-horned cattle. His retired father lives with him and helps out. Abdujalil was away at this time of the visit, so the author had to photograph his father, who (also) cares for the cattle. Abdujalil decided to apply to MicroInvest (for a loan) to expand his livestock business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening of cattle

loans.name: Sokchan

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokchan R. (show in the picture with two of her sons), 41, and her husband, Mr. Rum Saram, 45, live in a small village across Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have seven children: three sons and four daughters. One of their daughters is married and lives outside the family home. One son has full time employment in Phnom Penh. Three of their children study in the local school and the other two are too young to attend school. 

Mrs. Sokchan has been selling vegetables for five years. She buys them from market across her village for resale at her home. In addition, she has been growing rice since she was married. Her husband is a fisherman and a rice farmer.

Sokchan is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase fertilizer and pesticide and to pay the fee for plowing their rice field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Sokum

texts.en:
Sokhum U., 35, and her husband, Kimheng Nhong, 38, live in a small village across the Mekong River, which is about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have two children, a son and a daughter. The children study in local school.
Sokhum has been a silk weaver since 1990. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes the products to sell in Phnom Penh.  Kimheng is both a rice farmer and a silk weaver.

Sokhum is requesting a loan of $ 300 to purchase wood materials to help repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase wood materials to repair house.

loans.name: Simorn

texts.en:
Simorn C., 30, and her husband, Soeun Seng, 29, live on an Island of Mekong River, which is about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.They have three sons and one of them studies in a local school.

Simorn has been a silk weaver for 15 years. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes the products to sell in Phnom Penh. Soeun is a construction worker. 

Simorn is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase more silk materials for weaving and to help increase her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Vivot

texts.en:
Vivot C., 33, and his wife, Sovanny Chea, 26, live in a small village off of National Road Number Two, which is about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They have three children, two sons and one daughter.

Vivot has been working in a hotel in Phnom Penh for ten years. Sovanny stays at home to take care of their small children. She used to work in a Hotel as well. Vivort traves to work by  taxi and the cost is very high. Vivot wants to buy a motorcycle to drive to work. He is requesting a loan of US$300 to help purchase one motorcycle so he can drive to work.

loans.use: To add in his own money to purchase one motorcycle for driving to work.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Саломова Саида проживает в городе Нурек. Занимается торговлей. Снимает в аренду магазин , где торгует продуктами питания. Занимается данным видом деятельности уже 4 года. Хочет получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет так же увеличить ассортимент товара и получить дополнительную прибыль. Саида еще не замужем , но она полностью содержит родителей и себя. Поэтому ей просто необходимо развивать бизнес. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Saida S. lives in a town of Nurek. She is engaged in retail sales and leases a store where she sells groceries. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Saida wants to obtain a loan and increase her turnover. This will also help her broaden the goods assortment and bring additional profits. Saida is still single; however, she is the sole provider for herself and her family. This is why it is necessary for her business to grow. She plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Sabohat.

texts.ru: Шарофова Сабохат жительница города Нурек. Не замужем . Живет с родителями . Зарабатывает деньги путем ведения бизнеса. Имеет торговую точку на рынке , куда ввозит промышленные товары из города Душанбе. Занимается этим бизнесом уже  четыре года. Ее дело помогает ей обеспечивать родителей и себя. Но для того , чтобы увеличить доход , она планирует получить кредит и увеличить ассортимент товара. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sabohat S. lives in Nurek. She is single, lives with her parents and earns her living in a private enterprise. Sabohat has a retail outlet at a market and brings her products from Dushanbe. She has been in this business for 4 years. It is this business that helps support her and her parents. In order to increase profits, Sabohat plans to obtain a loan and broaden the goods assortment. She will be able to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Khov

texts.en:
Khov B., 68, and her husband, Dem Krut, 69, live in a small village across from the Mekong River, which is about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1964 and have five children. Four of their children are married and live outside the family home. The youngest daughter weaves silk at home. Khov and Dem also live with their two grandchildren and niece, and they are all silk weavers.
Khov is a silk weaver and a rice farmer. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then sells the items in Phnom Penh. Even though both are in their late 60's, they are both still strong enough to work. 

Khov is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more silk materials for five looms for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Shukur

texts.ru:
Шукур Чалилов мужчина в возросте 47 лет работает токарем,сам любитель занятием откорма скота, уже 10 лет как он занимается откормом и продажей быков и коров. Сейчас у него дома 6 больших крупнорогатых скота. Около них он сам на фото. Для увеличения скота он хочет кредитоваться в Микроинвесте.
Т.к. зима это сезонный период он обратился к нам.
texts.en:
Shukur J. is a 47-year-old man who works as a lathe operator and enjoys raising cattle. For the past ten years he has engaged in the feeding and sale of bulls and cows. In the photo, Shukur is at his place next to his six grown, large-horned cattle. Since winter is approaching, Shukur would like to take out a loan with MicroInvest and has applied for one in order to increase his herd.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding of cattle

loans.name: Todjidin

texts.ru: Раджабов Тоджидин проживает в городе Яван. Работает учителем в средней школе. Кроме того уже 8 лет зарабатывает на жизнь ведением бизнеса. Торгует на рынке промышленными товарами . Бизнес приносит неплохой доход , который позволяет ему использовать доход только на то , чтобы прокормить семью. Теперь он планирует расширить дело и увеличить товарооборот. Поэтому он решил получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Тоджидин имеет очень большую семью. Он женат и имеет шестерых детей. Все они живут дружно и весело.
texts.en:
Todjidin R. lives in Yavan and works as a teacher at a secondary school. Besides this, he has been earning a living in a private enterprise for the past 8 years. He sells industrial products at a market. The business brings in a decent profit that allows Todjidin to support his family. He is now planning to expand his business and increase turnover. This is why he decided to obtain a 12-month loan. Todjidin has a very big and happy family. He is married and has six children.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Yeat

texts.en:
Yeat V., 36, and her husband, Mao Kun, 37, live in a small village across from the Mekong River, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1993 and have six children. All of their children study in a local school. Their oldest daughter assists her mother weave silk when she is not in school.

Yeat has been a silk weaver for four years, and has been a rice farmer since she was young. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes the items to sell in Phnom Penh. Mao is a wooden house builder and a rice farmer as well. 

Yeat is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase more silk materials and materials to grow more rice.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and for growing rice.

loans.name: Khan's Group

texts.en:
Khan P. (the first from the left with her group members) was selected to be a group leader by members for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are four families including hers. The members are living along National Road Number Twom about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Khan P., 42, and her husband, Heng H., were married in 1979 and have five children. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home, two daughters are garment factory workers and the other two children study in a local school. Khan and her husband have been fishermen for ten years. She is requesting a loan for $200 to purchase fishing nets for her fishing business.

2- Sopheap M., 34, is a widow with four children. Sopheap has been working at Ngo in Phnom Penh City for seven years. She travels to work by taxi and costs are very high. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 to help her  purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

3-Thorn H., 39, and her husband, Lois Ly, 45, were married in 1983 and have two sons and four daughters. Two of their children study in a local school. Thorn and her husband have been fishermen for ten years. Beside fishing, her husband is also a construction worker. Thorn is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 to purchase additional fishing nets.

4-Sophoin C., 25, and his wife, Sory Noun, 25, were married in 2003 and have one daughter. Sophoin and his wife have been fishing for five years. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 to purchase more fishing nets.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle and fishing nets.

loans.name: Sarvinisso

texts.ru: Мусоева Сарвиниссо жительница города Яван. Жительница одного из отдаленных мест Явана. Единственные источники дохода жителей тех мест это сельское хозяйство: земледелие и животноводство. Сарвиниссо домохозяйка помогает мужу заниматься откормкой бычков. В данный момент подготавливается к холодам , а это значит в первую очередь закупить комбикорм. Поэтому она решила получить кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.У них очень большая семья. Они живут с родителями и имеют пятерых детей.
texts.en:
Savrinisso M. resides in a remote suburb of the city of Yavan. The only sources of income for the residents of her neighborhood are agriculture and animal husbandry. Savrinisso is a housewife. She helps her husband raise bull calves. Preparing for the cold season, the family needs to purchase forage. Therefore they are applying for a loan that they plan to repay in the next 10 months. Savrinisso’s family is very big. She and her husband share their house with their elderly parents and five children.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase forage

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty F. is married and has four children. She has received schooling through the Junior High level. Beauty sells fish, which she buys from the fishermen, processes and preserves them at home, and then sends them to the market at Enyaaye near Elmina. She has done this since 1988. Her husband is a policeman. Beauty uses her income to help pay for the children's school fees and other utility bills. Beauty will use the loan to purchase more fish for processing. With the profits from her expanded business, Beauty plans to help her husband to start building a house for the family.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort S. sells plastics and rubber products at Kwabinajyan near Elmina. Comfort has received a Junior High education. She is a single parent and has 3 children. Comfort has been selling plastic products since 1998. She is responsible for paying pay her children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy an ice chest, plastic bowls, cooking utensils and other items for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to started buying building blocks for the family house she wants to put up for her children.

loans.use: To buy an ice chest, plastic bowls, cooking utensils and other items for resale

loans.name: Aniko

texts.en:
Aniko is an entrepreneur who sells clothing and footwear. She lives and runs her business in Beregovo, a town in Western Ukraine. Aniko has been in this business for about seven years. Her vending kiosk has a reputation for having a wide assortment of quality merchandise and a favorable location in the local marketplace called "Progress.” Currently, she has over $3000 in inventory. Her net profit amounts to $600 a month.

Aniko is requesting a loan for 1500 Grivnas ($300 USD) to increase her turnover capital and sale rates. She is hoping to keep her business self-sustainable and running smoothly in the future. Moreover, she is aiming at further expansion of her small venture, too. We believe current financial assistance will add to success of Aniko's business and will help her fulfill her endeavors.   

Note: This is a short-term express loan that will be repaid in a month.

loans.use: increase turnover capital

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty M. is married and has 2 children. Her husband works at the post office. Gifty has achieved a senior high level of education.

Gifty sells groceries like sugar, rice, biscuits, and soap at Santoadze near Elmina. She has been selling groceries since 2002. She is responsible for feeding her family and paying the utility bills.

Gifty will use her loan to buy more groceries to sell to her ever-increasing customer base. She plans to reinvest the new profits back into her grocery business so that she can increase sales and eventually increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Qurban

texts.en:
Qurban S., 44, is a self-sacrificing, loving father of three children, all of whom are students at the university. He continues to work hard to support his beloved family and to improve their economic situation. Ever since he was very young, Qurban has been around people who have raised animals; and, thanks to this experience, he has learned to raise and sell cattle--work that he learned from his humble parents. With this employment, he has been able to bring stability to his family. 

The desire that Qurban harbors in his heart is to increase his capital in order to  acquire more animals. In turn, by selling these animals, he can generate more income for his family. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his beloved children, who always support him unconditionally in his daily work. Accordingly, he requests a $1000 USD loan with which he will purchase three calves and some fodder. Please get behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing much-needed stability and security to the members of his family.

loans.use: To purchase 3 calves and fodder

loans.name: Israyil

texts.en: Israyil M. is 28 years old. He is married and has two children. Israyil raises and sells cattle. He purchases calves in the central market, feeds and cares for them, and then resells them at higher prices in the local market. Israyil has been in this business for nine years, thanks to his father who was a farmer and taught him a lot. He is an expert in choosing and caring for the animals. He gets up at five o'clock every morning to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful, but his family is still quite poor because of the high prices that they have to pay for everything. He applied for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase four calves. You could become an important part of his family's life. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Akhsen

texts.en:
Akhsen A. is 26 years old. He is married and he has one son. His wife is a housekeeper. Thus, Akhsen's business is the main source of income for his family. Akhsen works hard in order to make his child and old parents, who are living in one house with Akhsen, happy. In his business, he sells dairy products such as milk and yogurt. In fact, he has worked in this business since 2001 and over that time span he has gained a great deal of experience. 

Akhsen is planning to purchase more calves and one more cow to increase the sale of dairy products. Winter is the high season for meat selling and during this period, people use meat and dairy a lot. Therefore, he is seeking a loan in the amount of $1200. Akhsen is counting on your help, and he expresses his deepest gratitude to everyone for their support.

loans.use: To buy one cow and two calves for his dairy products business

loans.name: David

texts.en: David A. sells food items like beans, maize and other things at Kissi near Elmina. David has received a Junior High eduaction. He is married and has 6 children, and his wife is a trader. David has been selling food items like beans, maize and others since 2004. He is responsible for paying his children's school fees and other utility bills. His loan will be used to add to her capital to buy more bags of beans and maize to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest into the business to increase sales, which will eventually increase his income.

loans.use: To buy more bags of beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Ayaz

texts.en:
Ayaz H. is 34 years old. He and his wife, a housekeeper, are raising four children. Ayaz's children are small now, but he is already working hard to ensure the best possible future for them. He makes a living by selling foodstuff like pastries, cookies, candies, condensed milk, tea, caned meat, mayonnaise and other items in a store that he rents. Ayaz has been in this business for ten years. He is very polite and his store is very popular with local residents, whose patronage allows him to earn a good income for his family. 

Ayaz has applied for a loan of $1000 USD and will use the loan to buy more items to sell. This will allow him to earn more and meet the needs of his family. Ayaz thanks you for your support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Umarboy

texts.ru: Умарбой 36летний мужчина отец троих детей,хороший специалист по откорму и уходу за скотом.Также у него есть участок земли где он выращивает рис, и вовремя маниторинга он был на даче.Ему помогает по откорму скота его жена которая на фотографии.Займ Умарой хочет взять для расширения бизнеса животноводства.
texts.en:
Umarboy is a 36-year-old man and the father of three children. He specializes in the care and feeding of cattle. In addition, he has a plot of land where he grows rice, and stays at his summer home to watch over it. His wife, pictured here, assists him in feeding the cattle. Umar wants to take out this loan in order to expand his livestock business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening of cattle

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 51-year-old Mariam M. from Dar es Salaam. She is widow with four children between the ages of 21 and 38 years old. Mariam established a nursery school in 2000 where she takes care of young boys and girls and prepares them for primary school. Her business is doing well. She works at the business for hours per day, five days per week; she is assisted by two employees. Mariam currently earns about 300 USD from her business and is requesting a loan of 525 USD in order to buy teaching supplies such as books, desks and chalk. In the future, she plans to establish a poultry business to help supplement her income from the nursery. Mariam thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her nursery school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Gulovsha

texts.en:
Gulovsha Q. is a very hardworking woman who knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. She is married and has two children. She raises animals with the goal of later selling them. This activity has given her great satisfaction because it allows her to provide for a considerable amount of the household income. The care that she takes to feed the animals and supply them with occasional medical visits from the veterinarian has increased their population. 

She makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother, because she's also very dedicated to lovingly raising her two children, who also help to care for the animals during their free time. She wants to expand her business and purchase 15 sheep at an estimated cost of $60 USD each. She's requesting a loan of $1000 USD to buy the sheep and some fodder. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life with dedication and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua M. sells clothing at Kissi near Elmina. Ekua has received no formal education. She is divorced and has 7 children. Ekua started selling clothing in 2008. She is responsible for paying for thedependand's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy add to her capital to buy more clothing for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband to start putting up a house for the family.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah A. Hannah is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a trader. She has achieved a junior-high level of education.

Hannah has been selling groceries and fabrics since 2004; she is also a seamstress by profession at Kissi near Elmina. She is responsible for helping her husband pay the children's school fees and their utility bills.

Hannah will use her loan to buy more groceries and fabrics to sell, along with sewing materials and tools for sewing. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy an additional machine for her assistant.

loans.use: To buy more groceries and fabrics to sell, as well as sewing materials and tools for sewing.

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 46-year-old Isabella M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children. Isabella has been running a café business since 1990. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all-local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces. Her business is doing well. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by two employees. Isabella currently earns about 50 USD from her business and is requesting a loan of 275 USD in order to buy additional utensils, cooking oil, rice and maize flour. In the future, she plans to establish another café. Isabella thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy utensils and cooking supplies for her cafe

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce M. is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a teacher. Joyce has received a junior-high level of education. She is responsible for feeding her family and paying the utility bills.

Joyce has been making spring rolls and chips and selling them near Liverpool Street in Elmina since 2004. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients for preparing spring rolls and cookies. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to complete the building she started constructing.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make spring rolls and cookies to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi Y. is married and has five children. She has received no formal education. Esi sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then send them to the market for sale at Elmina.  She has been in this business since 2004. Her husband is a salt producer. Esi uses her income to pay for her children's school fees and other utility bills. Esi will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more fish. With the profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to help her husband build a house for their family.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a fisherman. Margaret has received no formal education. She is responsible for feeding her family and paying the utility bills.

Margaret buys fish from fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and sells them at the market at Mpoben near Elmina. She also sells soft drinks as an additional job to earn more income. She has been selling fish and soft drinks since 2005.

Margaret will use this loan to buy more fish and soft drinks to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband start putting up a house for the family.

loans.use: To buy more fish and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort Q. sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, then brings them home for processing and preserving, and then sends them to the market for sale at Elmina. Comfort has received no formal education. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a salt producer. Comfort has been selling fish since 1996. She is responsible for utility bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband start putting up a house for the family.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah M. is married and has 2 children. She has received no formal education. Her husband is a monument officer.

Since 2006, Hannah has operated a local restaurant, popularly known as chop bar hear, where she serves a variety of local dishes like fufu, which is made out of cassava and plantain pounded together. The restaurant is at kwabina Gyan square in Elmina. Hannah uses her income to feed her family and pay her utility bills.

Hannah will use this loan to purchase more ingredients, including spices and other food items, so she can prepare more food at her restaurant. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to help her husband start putting up a house for their family.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for food preparation at her restaurant.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 46-year-old Hawa from Dar es Salaam. She is a widow with five children between the ages of 18 and 27 years. Hawa has been running a kuku or poultry business since 2006. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. First, they require little start-up capital: you can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! They also require little space; sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. While they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. Hawa's business is doing well. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by one employee. Hawa currently earns about 500 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 675 USD in order to purchase more chicks. In the future, she plans to renovate the kuku house and establish a clothes business where she can sell women clothes. Hawa thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina C. R., a member of FINCA Perú in the community bank, Lila, resides with her live-in partner and their son, Yasér, who is 18 years old and studying archaeology. Paulina works Monday through Saturday as a clinical analyst in an institution in Ayacucho. She provides pregnancy tests as well as analyses of blood, urine and fecal samples. Additionally, Paulina sells cosmetics independently through Avon and Jessica cosmetics. She takes orders from friends, family and colleagues.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her cosmetics business by purchasing more Avon and Jessica products to be used as samples for her clients and potential clients. She dreams of having a continually growing cosmetics business and ensuring that her son remains in school to become a professional.
