Having proven herself one of the best coffee producers in the area, Iris is sought after by the large wholesalers who come to move products from the jungle to markets in the capital and nearby towns. For this reason she wants to continue working apace, putting more arable land into production to increase her output. This will give her economic opportunities and the resources to support her home and educate her three school-aged children. What the children need for their development will increase as they grow up. This motivates Iris to request a loan to acquire seedling coffee plants to increase her yield. We hope you can help with Iris’ request.

Translated from Spanish by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plants to increase her coffee production

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musa M. was born in Mongoy, Koinadugu district, Northern Sierra Leone. She now lives with her husband and their 5 children in Kabala. Two of her children are in secondary school, two are in primary school, and the last is still young.

Musu has been a soap producer and dealer for the past 10 years. She makes the soap in Kabala and takes it to surrounding villages to sell. Her husband helps her make and sell the soap. She is seeking a loan of Le 3,500,000.00 to invest in her business. She will buy bags of caustic soda, oil, plastic bags, hand gloves, and other working materials. It is particularly on the caustic soda that she will invest this money on. This is because the price for a bag of caustic soda keeps fluctuating. Now that the price is low, she intends to buy as much as 25 bags, which she will keep so that when the price increases, she will not be affected.

Her previous loans with SMT greatly improved her life. She is now able to feed, clothe and educate her children, and she has even been able to buy plots of land in Makeni and Kabala.

Currently, sales are difficult for Musu because of the rains. Farmers--her main customers--do not work at this time, so their clothes stay clean, which makes the demand for soap very low. But with the dry season approaching and this loan in place, she is expecting great sales and more profit. Her immediate goal is to start building a house on the land she bought in Kabala. She has already started buying timbers for that purpose.

loans.use: Buy caustic soda and other working materials for making soap

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen además de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de ropa ofrece entre sus clientes productos de belleza para tener así un ingreso mas para poder costear la educación de sus hijos, comenzó hace 4 años su negocio cuando una de sus amigas le invito a vender estos productos y al ver que tenia buenas ganancias acepto dedicarse a a esto.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $200 que pagara en 3 meses para incrementar sus productos y ofrecer variedad de ellos a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda ella seguirá progresando.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen besides dressmaking and selling of clothes, she offers among her clients beauty products for sale. She wants to be able to finance the education of her children. She started her business 4 years ago when one of her friends invited her to sell these products and after seeing she could get good profits, she decide to sell them.

She needs a loan of $200, which will be repaid over a period of 3 months, to offer a bigger variety to her clients and increase her inventory. With your help she will be able to succed.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia es  una mujer muy empeñosa y laboriosa, con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logró instalar una tienda en su casa, en la cual se ocupa el mayor tiempo del día y al mismo tiempo dedicarse al cuidado de sus 2 hijos.  Gracias también al trabajo de su esposo como cerrajero lograron implementar esta pequeña bodega, donde muy alegremente  atiende a sus clientes y sobre todo, trata de brindar los productos de primera necesidad.  Pero Silvia ha tenido diversos problemas económicos, que han hecho que  su negocio decaiga, por ello solicita un préstamo, para comprar mercadería al por mayor en la ciudad, y así seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes productos de calidad. Su contribución logrará hacer de esta bodega, un negocio sostenible para Silvia.
texts.en:
Silvia is a very hard-working, laborious woman who, with a great deal of effort and sacrifice, was able to put up a small store in her home. She tends to the store for most of her day so that she can also take care of her two children. Thanks to her husband's work as a locksmith, they were able to start this small shop where they happily attend to the customers, and more than anything try to offer the most basic products for their clientele. Silvia has had various economic difficulties which have made the business struggle which is why she needs a loan in order to purchase wholesale merchandise in the city to continue offering quality products to her customers. Your contribution will help Silvia make her store a sustainable business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire merchandise at wholesale prices to supply her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: EL SEÑOR ROGELIO ES CHOFER DE TRAILER Y SU ESPOSA LA SEÑORA GEORGINA ES VENDEDORA POR CATALOGO TIENEN 1 HIJO EN EDAD DE ESCUELA Y OTRO PEQUEÑO, JUNTOS COMO FAMILIA ESTAN SOLICITANDO ESTE PRESTAMO PARA COLOCAR PROTECCIONES EN PUERTAS Y VENTANAS A SU CASA Y ASI DARLE A SU FAMILIA UNA MAYOR SEGURIDAD.
texts.en:
Mr. Rogelio is a trailer driver and his wife, Georgina, is a catalogue saleswoman. They have one son who is an elementary school student and another small baby son. As a family, they are seeking a loan in order to add protective bars on the doors and windows of their home to provide greater security for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Door and window guards (bars) for their home

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort has been trading in the local market of Koforidua in the Eastern Region of Ghana, where she stays with her family. She is 42 years old, married with four children who are currently in school. She is a busy petty trader who sells maize, plantain, cassava and other foodstuff on top of a table in the market. She does not have sufficient working capital to run the business which retards her business progress. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to purchase increased stock to revive the business. She believes the loan will enable her to increase her savings to care for her kids in school. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase increased stock of palm oil, tinned tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish, etc.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad es una mujer como pocas, ella se entrega a sus deberes como agricultora y como madre al 100%, tiene 2 pequeños, quienes son su adoración y motor para seguir trabajando con esmero y dedicación.  Su principal actividad es el cultivo de café, después de la cosecha está esperanzada en poder vender sus productos a buenos precios que  cubran la inversión que realizó y sobre todo que solventen las necesidades de su hogar.  A raíz de todo, está pensando tener nuevas plantaciones de café, pero la falta de dinero la milita a seguir proyectándose, por ello solicita un préstamo que invertirá en sus  plantaciones de café, las cuales dentro de dos años le darán grandes ingresos para su hogar.  Si usted tiene la voluntad de apoyar a esta madre, hágalo, para la prosperidad de sus plantaciones de café y por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Soledad is a woman like few others. She devotes herself 100 percent to her duties as a farmer and a mother. She has two small children whom she adores and are the inspiration to keep working with such care and dedication. Her main job is cultivating coffee, and after the harvest she is hoping to be able to sell her products at good prices to cover the costs of the flood the occurred and above all provide for the necessities of her household. As a result of everything, she is planning on starting new coffee plantations, but she lacks the money to keep paying the army for protection, so she is requesting a loan to invest in her coffee fields, which within two years will start providing her much more money for her home. If you have the wish to help this mother, do it, for the prosperity of her coffee fields and the well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve coffee plantations

loans.name: Ayenor

texts.en:
Ayenor T., 38 years old and the mother of four children, is a local manufacturer of soaps, combining such materials as palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to make her products. She is not able to produce in large quantities for lack of funds, so she is requesting a loan to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She hopes to raise her income in order to support her children’s education.

Ayenor belongs to the community group called Good Shepherd Trust Group, whose members support one another and guarantee repayment of their loans.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials including palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to produce soap.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer T. is 26 years old and single. She dropped out of school for lack of financial support. She decided to learn a trade to earn a living. She is now married with a kid. She has sold lingerie, underwear, slippers and dressing bags for the past five years. She does her business through door-to-door sales. She has insufficient working capital to run the business. With the loan she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality and large quantity to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase lingerie, underwear, dressing bags and slippers.

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
NOE C. M. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit.  Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.

EL SEÑOR NOE ES UNA PERSONA DE MEDIANA EDAD PERO MUY RESPONSABLE CON GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE, SU ESPOSA LA SEÑORA MAYRA ES PENSIONADA, POR MEDIO DE ESTE PRESTAMO QUE SOLICITAN QUIEREN REALIZAR EL PROYECTO DE COLOCARLE VITROPISO A SU CASA; DE ESTE MODO LOGRARAN UNA MAYOR COMODIDAD PARA ELLOS Y SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Noe is a person of middle age but very responsible who looks forward to success. His wife, Ms Mayra, receives a pension. With this loan Noe and his wife want to install tile in their home. This will allow them to realize a greater comfort for themselves and their family.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install tile

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer T. is 26 year old single lady. She dropped out of school for lack of financial support. She decided to learn a trade to earn a living. She now married with a kid. She sells lingerie, underwear, slippers and dressing bags for the past five years. She does her business through door to door sales. She has insufficient working capital to run the business. With the loan she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality and large quantity to upgrade her inventory. She belongs to the community group called Good Shepherd Trust Group.  Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay the loan. Jennifer does not sell on group meeting days and her photo was taken during her group meeting. Jennifer is wearing nice batik tie and dye clothe with long necklace and earring, looking into the camera with other group members behind.

loans.use: To purchase lingerie, underwear, dressing bags and slippers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria A., known as Vic, is 31 years old and a divorced wife with a kid who is currently in school. She says selling lingerie, jewelry and slippers, especially for women, is very profitable and therefore has been selling ladies' lingerie, slippers, jewelry and clothes through door-to-door sales for five years to support herself and her kid. With the loan, Vic wants to buy bales of lingerie, slippers, clothes and jewelry to increase her inventory and sales for a good income. She believes this loan would help her save more money to rent a shop to house her goods

She is a member of the group called Together. Members of the group agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan. Victoria does not sell on group meeting days and her photo was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy bales of lingerie, jewelry, slippers etc.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El Sr. Alejandro tiene poco tiempo que adquirió su casa pero le está haciendo falta las protecciones de las puertas principal el con sus ahorros pudo poner las protecciones de las ventanas pero no le alcanzó para las puertas.

El Sr. Alejandro y su esposa Jessica trabajan en una tienda de papelería ellos son los encargados del negocio; este es el ingreso familiar.

Alejandro nos comento que por falta de la seguridad de su casa ya le han robado algunas cosas de su casa. Y es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo de $300.00 dlls para la colocación de las protecciones en las puertas.
texts.en:
Alejandro bought a house recently and he needs security gates for the doors to the house. He used his savings to buy security grilles for the house's windows but he didn't have enough for the doors.

Alejandro and his wife, Jessica, manage an office supply store. The family income comes from their jobs there.

Alejandro told us that because of the lack of security, his house has already been robbed of various things. He's asking for a US$300 loan so that he can install security gates on the doors of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install security gates.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: EL SEÑOR A. C. ES UNA PERSONA MUY TRABAJADORA Y CON MUCHAS GANAS DE TENER UN HOGAR MAS COMODO, ES CHOFER DE TRANSPORTE ESCOLAR Y MEDIANTE ESTO EL OBTIENE SUS INGRESOS; SOLICITA ESTE PRESTAMO PARA COLOCAR SU TECHO DE LAMINA PARA SU "CASITA", EL Y SU ESPOSA SON PERSONAS GRANDES DE EDAD PERO CON MUCHAS GANAS DE VIVIR Y DE SALIR ADELANTE.
texts.en:
Sr. A. C. is a hard-working man with a strong desire to own a more comfortable home. He makes a living as a school bus driver. He's applying for this loan to install a laminate sheet roof on his "casita". He and his wife have many years between them but they haven't stopped wanting to improve their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install laminate sheet roof.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es:
ANA LUISA S. R. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit.  Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.

LA SEÑORA ANA LUISA SE DEDICA DE ASISTENTE EDUCATIVA, ES UNA PERSONA MUY DEDICADA Y RESPONSABLE LUCHANDO POR SACAR A SU FAMILIA ADELANTE YA QUE ES MADRE SOLTERA Y POR ELLO HA HA DEMOSTRADO LA FORTALEZA Y MADUREZ QUE POSEE, POR MEDIO DE ESTE PRESTAMO QUE SOLICITA DESEA CONSTRUIR UN CUARTO PARA AMPLIARSE Y BRINDARLE A SUS HIJOS UN MEJOR ESTILO DE VIDA.
texts.en:
ANA LUISA S. R. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families' incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.

Ana Luisa works as a teacher's assistant. She's a hard-working and responsible woman, a single mother struggling to lift her family up. Her hard work demonstrates that she's both strong and mature. With the loan that she's applying for she wants to build an extra room and provide her children with a better way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build extra room.

loans.name: Abla Mawussi

texts.fr: Abla Mawussi A. est propriétaire et gérante d’un bar-restaurant à Lomé la capitale Togolaise. Agée de 33 ans, Abla est très réputée pour être spécialisée en cuisine. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants et a acquis une expérience très riche en art de services. Avec cette chance de Kiva et ce troisième crédit de FECECAV, elle désire faire davantage de stock de tubercules d’ignames, de mais, pour les plats de fufu et de la pâte, des plats très appréciés par la clientèle. Elle apprécie cette opportunité qui lui permettra de participer plus à la prise en charges des besoins de la famille par les profits qu’elle va dégager
texts.en:
Abla Mawussi A. is the owner and manager of a restaurant and bar in Lomé, the capital of Togo. The 33-year-old Abla is especially known for her cooking. She is married and the mother of three children, and has a wide range of experience in providing services. With this Kiva opportunity and her third loan from FECECAV, Abla wishes to stock up on yams and corn for making her customers’ favorite dishes, “fufu” (a mashed yam dish) and “pâté” (a kind of porridge). She appreciates this chance to generate profits, which will allow her to better meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of yams, sacks of corn, and crates of drinks

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel Alcala tiene ya más de 3 años que le entregaron su casa pero le está haciendo falta algunos cosas pero el quiere mejor poner las protecciones de las ventanas y puertas para la seguridad de su familia.

Miguel Alcalá trabaja en un negocio donde se dedican a lavar autos el trabajo todo el día y su familia esta sola es por eso que le está dando preferencia a las protecciones; y así su familia ve estar más segura cundo el esté trabajando.

El Sr. Miguel Alcalá nos está solicitando un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls.
texts.en:
It has been more than 3 years since Mr Miguel Alcalá acquired his home. However, there are still some things missing. He would like to install anti-theft frames on his windows and doors for the security of his family.

Miguel works all day washing cars while his family is alone at home. For this reason, he is concerned with protecting his family, especially so that they can feel secure while he is at work.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install anti-theft window and door frames

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal La Kantuta.

Elsa es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Elsa viaja a 3 ferias diferentes de la región en donde vende ropa variada, los días domingos vende en la feria de las Américas ubicada cerca de la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Ayacucho de los mayoristas y cada 2 meses viaja a la ciudad de Lima. En algunas oportunidades Elsa viaja a otros pueblos donde hay ferias donde también vende ropa.

Elsa necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medias, polos, pantalones. Elsa sueña con construir su casa, tener un carro para trasladar sus productos y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Communal Bank La Kantuta.

Elsa lives with her partner, is 27 years old, and has 2 children. Elsa travels to 3 different fairs in the region in which she sells a variety of clothing. On Sundays she sells in the fair of the Americas, located close to the city of Ayacucho. She acquires her products in the city of Ayacucho from the wholesalers, and every 2 months she travels to the city of Lima. On some occasions, Elsa travels to other towns in which there are fairs where she also sells clothes.

Elsa needs a loan for 1600 soles, money which will be invested in buying stockings, polo shirts, trousers. She dreams with building her house, having a car to transport her products, and educating her children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying stockings, polo shirts, trousers

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria inicio el negocio a raíz de que se vimos en una situación económica difícil y para apoyar a su esposo con el sustento de la casa y la educación de sus hijos, por lo cual el negocio lo inició hace un año ya que tenia experiencia porque había trabajado en una tortillería y se le ocurrió poner su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de comida.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar la materia prima necesaria para incrementar sus ventas y así poder obtener más ingresos
texts.en:
Candelaria started her business because she faced a difficult economic situation. She wanted to help her husband with household expenses and school fees for their children. She had experience working in a "tortilleria" (a shop that sells tortillas) and she struck out on her own when she realized that she could create a business making and selling food.

She needs a US$300 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy the necessary ingredients to increase her sales and generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for food business.

loans.name: Mawuto

texts.fr: Mawuto A. est une revendeuse très connue dans son quartier qui prend son affaire au sérieux et jouissait d’une bonne réputation par sa cuisine à Lomé la capitale Togolaise. Agée de 38 ans, Mawuto est mariée et mère de quatre enfants et a acquis une expérience très riche en cuisine et de service de qualité ce qu’elle pratique depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle ne fait pas de doute que son travail lui procurait de la joie mais il lui faut encore une cuisinière et autres choses pour assurer un service prompt et efficace et des relations aimables avec les clients. Elle espère par cette opportunité, tirer des profits etn charges des besoins de la famille. Elle est la personne située à l'extrème gauche
texts.en:
Mawuto A. (far-left on the picture) is a very well-known reseller in her neighborhood. She takes her business very seriously, and her cooking is very well regarded in Lomé, the capital of Togo. Mawuto, age 38, is married and the mother of four children. Over five years, she's acquired a very rich experience in cooking and quality service. There's no doubt she's enjoying her job, but she needs a new stove and other things to ensure a fast and efficient service and good relationship with her clients. With this opportunity, she hopes to make a profit to support her family needs.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new stove and other items for her restaurant

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es socia del Banco Comunal La Kantuta.

Alejandra es casada, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Alejandra viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende ropa, abarrotes, frutas, pollo y todo cuanto le pidan sus clientes, sus ventas en algunas oportunidades son al crédito, Alejandra de las ferias compra cereales, queso, animales menores, que luego lo transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho y lo vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho al por mayor a los comerciantes.

Alejandra necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, maíz, arveja, haba. Alejandra sueña con comprar un carro para trasladar sus productos, que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a member of the communal bank “La Kantuta”.

Alejandra is married, 39 years old and has three children. Alejandra travels to the different markets in the region where she sells clothes, groceries, fruit, chicken and any items requested by her customers. She sometimes sells her products on credit. From the markets, Alejandra purchases cereals, cheese, and small animals which she then transports to the city of Ayacucho where she sells them to wholesalers at the market.

Alejandra needs a loan of 2,000.00 soles, funds that she will invest into buying wheat, corn, peas, and beans.

Alejandra’s dreams include acquiring a car to use in transporting her products, seeing her children complete their educations and expanding her business.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Alejandra needs a loan of 2000 soles to invest in the purchase of wheat, corn, peas and beans.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela inicio su negocio para ayudar al ingreso económico de su marido ya que ellos tenían pensado iniciar su propio negocio, por lo que hace aproximadamente 4 años comenzó ayudándole a su suegra haciendo comida para vender y esto la motivo a poner su propio negocio ya que la comida es lo que mayor demanda tiene en la ciudad.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses el cual le va a ayudar para la compra de una estufa.
texts.en:
Gabriela began her business to help with her husband’s income as they had been thinking of starting their own business. Approximately 4 years ago she began helping her mother-in-law making food to sell and this inspired her to open her own business as food is what is in greatest demand in her city. She needs a loan for US $300, which will be repaid in 6 months, to help her buy a stove.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a stove.

loans.name: Georgina Aurea

texts.es:
Georgina es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen D. Cocharcas. Georgina es casada, tiene 57 años y 6 hijos, Georgina venD. golosinas, bebidas, pequeños juguetes, actividad que realiza en la puerta D. un colegio privado desD. las 6 D. la mañana hasta las 7 D. la noche, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda D. su hija.

Georgina junto a su esposo hacen cancha D. arrocillo (bocaditos D. arroz), que embolsan en pequeñas bolsas e incluyen en ellos pequeños juguetes, aretes, ganchos, sus ventas lo realizan en diferentes pueblos D. la región. Georgina viaja a la ciudad D. Lima para comprar los juguetes.

Georgina necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. juguetes pequeños. Los sueños D. Georgina son construir su casa D. material noble, tener un restaurante en su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Georgina is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen D. Cocharcas.” Georgina is married, 57 years old and has 6 children. Georgina sells snacks, beverages, small games; she sells in the entrance of a private school from 6 in the morning until 7 at night, and she does so with the help of her daughter. Georgina, along with her husband, makes “cancha D. arrocillo” (a snack maD. from rice), that they wrap in small bags and incluD. small toys, earrings, and charms. She makes sales in different towns of the region. Georgina travels to Lima to buy the toys. Georgina needs a loan for 1200 soles, which will be invested in buy small toys. Georgina dreams of constructing her home with sturdy materials, having a restaurant in her home and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy small toys

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana Maria comenzó su negocio hace mas de 13 años al ver la crisis economica por la cual pasaba su familia, decidio iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidad ya que conociendo muy bien el negocio y la demanda de las comidas, sabia que tendria éxito si ofrecia un buen servicio y asi fue al lo largo del tiempo ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar articulos de cocina, con tu ayuda ella saldra adelante.
texts.en:
Juana Maria started her business more than 13 years ago because of the economic crisis her family was going through. She decided to start her own business of selling food since she knows this business and the demand for food very well. She knew that she would be successful if she offered a good service, and through time, she has managed to get ahead with her business.

She needs a loan of $300, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase items for her kitchen. With your help, she will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase items for her kitchen

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es:
MARIA LETICIA G. C. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit.  Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.

LA SEÑORA MARIA LETICIA ES UNA PERSONA DE EDAD MAYOR Y VIUDA, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE HAMBURGUESAS Y ES PROPIETARIA DE UNA PULGUITA DEL CUAL OBTIENE SUS INGRESOS, LA SEÑORA CUENTA CON EL APOYO Y EL RESPALDO  DE SUS HIJOS; ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA COLOCAR UNA LOSA DE CONCRETO PARA SU CASA YA QUE SU TECHO ESTA MUY DAÑADO Y POR MEDIO DE ESTE PRESTAMO TENDRA UN MEJOR ESTILO DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Ms Maria Leticia is a widow who dedicates herself to the selling of hamburgers. She is also the owner of a small stand from which she earns her income. She depends on the support of her children. This loan will help her set down concrete in her house since her roof is is on the verge of collapse. The loan will also help her improve her way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lay down concrete for a new roof

loans.name: Brenda

texts.es:
Brenda es soltera y no tiene hijos vive con sus papas, pero ella quedo desempleada y necesitaba tener alguna actividad para mantenerse, desde hace dos años empezó vendiendo ropa con sus familiares, poco a poco su negocio ha ido creciendo. y ahora tambien vende bisutería como complemento ara su actividad.

Ella necsita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia. Con tu apoyo ella saldra adelante.
texts.en:
Brenda is single with no children and lives with her parents. When she was unemployed a couple of years ago and needed to find work, she began selling clothing with relatives. Little by little, she's built a growing business. She now sells costume jewelry to complement her clothing business.

Brenda needs a US$300 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise. With your help, she can lift herself up.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla A. est une jeune femme de 28 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est couturière dynamique qui excelle dans son métier manuel installée dans une banlieue célèbre de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Quand ses concurrents se recourent aux nouvelles machines modernes de couture pour bien servir les clients, tout en faisant un bénéfice raisonnable, elle ne veut pas rester indifférente. Elle souhaite par ce nouveau crédit contribuer à la prospérité de son affaire par de nouveaux équipements permettant de prendre rapidement en  compte les attentes de sa clientèle et gagner plus leur confiance. Après encore un peu de travail, elle espère que tout va changer  et qu’elle tirera rapidement profit de cet investissement
texts.en:
Abla A. is a young woman of 28, married and the mother of two children. She is an energetic seamstress, who works in a famous suburb of Lomé, the capital of Togo, and excels in her handicraft. She cannot remain indifferent to the fact that her competitors have resorted to using new, modern sewing machines to better serve their customers, while still making a handsome profit. With this new loan, Alba hopes to give her business an edge by purchasing new equipment that would allow her to quickly meet her customers’ expectations and further gain their confidence. After a bit of work, she hopes that everything will change and she will take in a quick profit from this investment.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine and fabric to sell

loans.name: Amewossina

texts.fr: Amewossina A. est âgé de 52 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Il est depuis  des années à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite par ce  crédit augmenter son fond de roulement pouvant lui permettre de renouveler dans la mesure du possible son stock de marchandises étant un particulier commerçant d’alimentation générale. Les gains issus de son activité permettront à monsieur Amewossina de  réaliser plus de bénéfice et  de faire face aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amewossina A. is 52 years old, married and the father of three school-aged children. He has lived in Lomé, the Togolese capital, for a number of years. Being in the grocery business, with this loan he hopes to increase his working capital, enabling him to restock his merchandise to the extent possible. The resulting from the business would enable Amewossina to make even more profit, meeting the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to increase his trade

loans.name: Maria Aide

texts.es:
Aide esta casada, tiene 3 hijos : uno de 17, otro de 12 y otro 9 años. Ella inicio el negocio hace 4 años, a raíz de que invito a unos vecinos a comer y les gusto su sazón, y posteriormente la fueron recomendando, y la misma demanda le fue pidiendo servicio para fiestas infantiles, elaborando hamburguesas y demas paltillos, actualmente su hijo mayor le ayuda en la preparación de alimentos y como mesero en algunos eventos.

Ella necsita un prestamo por US $225 que pagara en 6 meses para ampliar su negocio y dar mejor servicio al cliente.
texts.en:
Aide is married, and has 3 children. One is 17, other is 12 and the youngest is 9 year old. She started her business 4 years ago, immediately after she invited a few of her neighbors to eat and they liked her seasoning. Later, they recommended her and soon after she was being asked to cater children parties, to prepare hamburgers and other dishes. At present her elder son helps her in the preparation of food and as waiter in some events.

She need a loan of $225, which will be repaid over period of 6 months, to expand her business and provide a better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila Es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela. Teofila es casada, tiene 51 años y 6 hijos, Teofila es artesana, elabora tejidos en telar como pasadizos, frazadas, tapices, individuales, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su hija, sus tejidos los comercializa a los comerciantes del mercado central D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Teofila tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, también venD. verduras, carnes, frutas.

Teofila necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. hilos, tintes, arroz y azúcar. Los sueños D. Teofila son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, mejorar la construcción D. su casa y ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the Banco Comunal Marcela. She is a 51-year-old married mother of 6 children. She is an artisan who produces various textiles using a loom. Her daughter assists her with this work. They sell these fabrics to merchants at the central market of the city of Ayacucho. Teofila also has a grocery stand at her house where she sells vegetables, meat and fruits.

Teofila asks for a loan to purchase thread, dye, rice and sugar. Teofila's dream is to offer her children a good education, to improve her home, and to increase her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase thread, dye, rice and sugar

loans.name: Juanita Eva

texts.es:
Juanita inicio el negocio hace mas de diez años, empezó vendiendo por catalogo, cosméticos y perfumes, pero ella tenia el deseo de superarse por lo que ingreso a una academia a estudiar para ser estilista, y así monto su estética desde hace 8 años, ya que su familia siempre tuvo peluquerías, ya tenia nociones de eso. Gracias a el buen servicio que presta ha logrado salir adelante.

Ella necsita un prestamo por US $225 que pagara en 6 meses para para comprar una vitrina, pintar y decorar la estética.Con tu ayuda ella seguira progresando.
texts.en:
Juanita started in business more than 10 years ago. She started selling cosmetics and perfumes by catalog, but she had the desire to improve herself, so she enrolled in a school to study to be a stylist. She started her salon 8 years ago, and since her family has always had salons, she wanted to do this. Thanks to the good service that she offers, she has managed to get ahead.

She needs a loan of $225, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase a display case and to paint and decorate the salon. With your help, she will keep progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a display case and to decorate her salon

loans.name: Judith Milly

texts.es:
Judith es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay. Judith es soltera y tiene 21 años, estudia secretariado ejecutivo y vive con sus padres, Judith vende cosméticos, aretes, ropa que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas son al crédito y sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, además Judith de acuerdo a pedidos vende ropa antieléctrico en el trabajo de su papá, empresa en el rubro eléctrico, sus ventas son al crédito.

Judith necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de figuras, ganchos, collares, esmaltes. Los sueños de Judith son tener local propio para vender sus productos, culminar sus estudios profesionales y ejercer su carrera.
texts.en:
Judith is a member of the Banco Comunal Ollantay. She is a 21-year-old single woman studying executive administration. She lives with her parents and works as a vendor selling cosmetics, earrings and clothing. Her sales are based on credit and she acquires her products in the city of Lima. Judith also sells antistatic clothing at her father's work, a company specializing in electrics. Judith asks for a loan to purchase hairpins, necklaces, and nail polish. Judith's dreams are to obtain a space to sell her products, to finish her professional studies, and to pursue her career.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase necklaces, hairpins and nail polish

loans.name: Samousse

texts.fr:
Samousse D. achète et revend depuis 3 ans en détail des bijoux à Lomé, la capitale togolaise dans un quartier commercial. C’est un commerce très florissant ;
Il souhaite par ce second crédit acheter de nouveaux bijoux pouvant répondre à l’attente de sa clientèle qui devient de plus en plus exigeante. Les profits tirés de son activité lui permettront de faire face à ses soucis financiers.
texts.en:
Samousse D. has been buying and selling jewelry at the retail level for three years in Lomé, the Togolese capital, in a commercial district. It's a booming business. He would like to use this second loan to buy new jewelry that can meet the expectations of his customers, who are becoming more and more demanding. The profits derived from his work will enable him to address his financial concerns.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry for resale

loans.name: Nancy Socorro

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=37844&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Nancy Socorro E. Parano and her three children, live in Ayacucho, Perú and is a member of the community bank, Virgen de Cocharcas. Nancy is an independent distributor of natural products including Gano Coffee and VioLite. She plans to open her own store in December 2008. Nancy, with the help of her daughter, also sells clothes and honey. Additionally, Nancy is a founding member and has been actively working for six years at an NGO focusing on social work, the NGO is called Jatón Sacha.

With her loan of 2,550 soles she will invest in her businesses by purchasing more products including pants, shirts, socks, coffee and VioLite. Nancy dreams that one day with the income she has been saving that her children will continue their education and become professionals and that she will build her own house.
texts.en:
Nancy Socorro E. Parano and her three children live in Ayacucho, Peru. Nancy is a member of the community bank, Virgen de Cocharcas. Nancy is an independent distributor of natural products including Gano Coffee and VioLite. She plans to open her own store in December 2008. Nancy, with the help of her daughter, also sells clothes and honey. Additionally, Nancy is a founding member and has been actively working for six years at an NGO focusing on social work, the NGO is called Jatón Sacha.

Nancy asks for a loan to invest in her businesses and purchase more products, including pants, shirts, socks, coffee and VioLite. Nancy dreams that one day with the income she has been saving that her children will continue their education and become professionals and that she will build her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products including pants, shirts, socks, coffee and VioLite.

loans.name: Edna Fabiola

texts.es:
Edna esta casada, su esposo es maquinista en el ferrocarril y no la ayuda al negocio Tienen dos hijos de 12 y 5 años, ella inicio el negocio hace un año por comisión vendiendo perfumes y cosméticos y después decidió surtirle a la tienda su propia mercancía, y poder ayudar al gasto de la casa para darles a sus hijos mejor calidad de vida.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $225 que pagara en 6 meses, para surtir mercancía. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Edna is married. Her husband is a railroad engineer and does not help her with her business. They have two children, 12 and 5 years of age. She started her business a year ago, selling perfumes and cosmetics on commission, and later decided to stock the store with her own merchandise to be able to help with the household expenses and offer her children a better quality of life.

She needs a loan for US $225, which she will pay in 6 months, to stock her merchandise. With your help she will be able to make it.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more products including pants, shirts, socks, coffee and VioLite.

loans.name: Yawo Mawusi

texts.fr: Yawo Mawusi D. est  un mécanicien réputé âgé de 42 ans qui assure un service de qualité dans un quartier de Lomé la capitale. Pour faire vidange pour ses clients,  il est obligé de faire va et vient pour chercher de l’huile à moteur ce qui est un fardeau supplémentaire pour lui. Il  souhaite par ce premier crédit de FECECAV associer à son service mécanique le commerce d’huile à moteur pour bien servir ses clients, tout en faisant un bénéfice raisonnable. Ce faisant il contribuera à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yawo Mawusi D., age 42, is a reputable mechanic who provides quality service in a district in the capital city of Lomé. To do oil changes for his customers, he must go back and forth looking for motor oil, and that is an added burden. He would like to use this first FECECAV loan to include, along with his mechanic's offerings, commerce in motor oil in order to serve his customers well, all the while making a reasonable profit. He will then help improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toolboxes and also motor oil for resale

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=36098&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Jesusa es socia del Banco Comunal La Kantuta. Jesusa es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos de 9 y 5 años, Jesusa viaja a dos ferias de la región, los días martes a la feria de Acocro que se ubica a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, los días sábados a Ccejelambras, en donde compra cereales diversos, luego de acopiarlo lo vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, los demás días Jesusa se dedica a la atención de sus hijos y en algunas oportunidades procesa los cereales en harinas que reparte a las tiendas.

Jesusa necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, haba, cebada, maíz. Jesusa sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su casa, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=36098&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Jesusa is a member of La Kantuta Community Bank.

Jesusa lives with her partner, is 31 years old and has two children who are 9 and 5 years old. Jesusa travels to two regional fairs: on Tuesdays to the Acocro fair that is located two hours from the city of Ayacucho and on Saturdays to Ccejelambras, where she buys different grains. After collecting them, she sells them in the supply market in the city of Ayacucho. On other days, Jesusa dedicates her attention to her children and, on some occasions, processes the grains into flour which she distributes to stores.

Jesusa needs a loan of 1,600 soles which will be invested in the purchase of wheat, beans, barley and corn. Jesusa dreams of purchasing land to build a house on, providing a good education to her children and growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Jesusa needs a loan of 1,600 soles which will be invested in the purchase of wheat, beans, barley and corn.

loans.name: Félix

texts.fr: Félix E. est âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de deux enfants. Il exerce depuis plus de 3 ans la mécanique à 2 roues à Lomé la capitale togolaise.  Avec ce crédit, son deuxième de FECECAV, il souhaite contribuer à la prospérité de son affaire. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour changer les conditions de sa vie.
texts.en:
Felix E. is 39 years old, married and the father of two (2) children. For over (3) years he has been a motorcycle mechanic in Lomé, the Togolese capital. He plans to use the loan, his second from FECECAV, to contribute to the value of his business. He expects this opportunity will change his living conditions.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tool boxes and reorganize his workshop.

loans.name: The Suns Group

texts.es:
Maria Isabel es la coodinadora del Grupo Los Soles, que esta integrado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras con ganas de salir adelante.

Ana inicio el negocio para sacar a su hija adelante, ya que estaba pequña y no tenia quien se la cuidara, por lo que empezó vendiendo zapatos con vecinas y después fue a las empresas para venderle a los empleados y fue asi como logro salir adelante.

Isabel inicio el negocio para salir adelante y darle a sus hijos mejor calidad de vida, comenzo vendiendo ropa en un pequeño puesto instalado afuera de su casa hasta que con la ganancia compro una estructura y empezó a vender en los mercados.

Martha inicio el negocio para apoyar a su esposo ya que recibia un sueldo muy bajo, empezó vendiendo joyeria entre sus vecinos y mas adelante su esposo se la llevo a su trabajo para vender a sus compañeros.

Ellas requieren un prestamo por US $900 que pagaran en 5 meses para comprar mercancia y poder continuar con sus negocios. Con tu ayuda ellas saldran adelante.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is the coordinator of The Suns group, which is composed of three women entrepreneurs eager to get ahead. Ana started her business in order to take her daughter with her to work when she was little, as she had no one with whom to leave the girl. For this reason, Ana began selling shoes to neighbors, and later went to places of business to sell to the employees. Doing so, she was able to come out ahead. Isabel went into business with success in mind and to give her children a better quality of life. She began by selling clothes from a small stall outside her home. With her earnings, she purchased an enclosure and began selling in marketplaces. Martha began her business in order to assist her husband whose salary was quite low. She started by selling jewelry to neighbors, and later accompanied her husband to work to sell to his colleagues. In order to purchase merchandise to continue doing business, the ladies are requesting a loan of $900, which they will repay within five months. With your assistance, they will find success.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mawussé

texts.fr:
Mawussé E. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle tient une boutique d’alimentation générale  à Lomé, la capitale togolaise.
Avec ce second crédit, elle souhaite faire davantage d’approvisionnement de ses stocks de marchandises et autres comme les boissons, les sandalettes, les boites de conserves et autres produits en vue d’augmenter la capacité de son commerce. Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Mawussé E., age 39, is married and the mother of 3 children. She runs a grocery store in Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this second loan, she wishes to bolster her stock of various products, such as drinks, sandals, canned food and other products to strengthen her business. Her profits will enable her to better provide for her family needs.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to bolster her stock

loans.name: Mayra Yolanda

texts.es: Mayra Yolanda P. Pérez Es originaria del municipio de San Francisco el Alto Totonicapan ella desde ñina fue aprendiendo el arte de sus padres el la confeccion  principalmente  la  elaboracion de playeras  hace cinco años decide inciar su propio negocio con un pequeño capital que le regalo su querida madre,  fue creciendo poco a paco su negocio y su capital, teniendo una maquina pequeña de coser, ella contraye matrimonio y deside abandonar su actividad que ha aprendio, de nuevamente ella y su esposo  hace  un año deciden aperturar  su propio negocio  en la plaza del municipio de San Francisco el Alto  por ser un municipio del altiplano en villa de desarrollo economico  principalmente en la sastreria uno de los mercado mas grande de Centro America en confecciones, y donde doña Mayra quiere formar parte de este crecimiento se deciden hacer un prestamos  para ampliar mas su capital y principalmete en la compra de telas, conos, moldes para poder surtir su mercaderia ya que se aproximan las fiesta de fin de año  y surtir sus productos.
texts.en:
Mayra Yolanda P. P. is from the town of San Francisco, and from a young age she has learned the art of hand making shirts. Five years ago she started her own business with very little capital that her mother gave her. Having only small sewing machine little by little her business and capital grew. She eventually got married and stopped working, but now she and her husband want to reopen this business in the town plaza in San Francisco in order to be part of the biggest developing textile market in Central America. Mayra wants to be part of this growth and has decided to take out loans to increase her capital, especially different fabrics, cones, and molds. All this will be needed to help her increase her business now that parties for the new year are approaching.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Achminou

texts.fr: Achminou O. est âgé de 28 ans célibataire sans. Il tient depuis 2 ans une boutique d’alimentation générale à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite augmenter les capacités de son commerce en alimentant sa boutique en achetant des sacs de riz, des boîtes de conserve et autres produits. Ce faisant, il pourrait contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille maternelle.
texts.en:
Achminou O. is 28 years old and single. For two years he has had a grocery store in Lomé, the capital of Togo. He would like to increase trade by purchasing sacks of rice, canned goods and other products for his shop. Doing so means he would be able to contribute to improving the standard of living for his mother’s family.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of rice, canned goods, and other products

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi G. est revendeuse de poissons, depuis 3 ans, à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Elle souhaite par ce crédit acheter des poissons, les faire fumer pour la revente. Ce faisant, elle pourrait contribuer à la prise en charge des dépenses de la famille
texts.en:
For the past three years, Afi G. has been a fish retailer in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is 35 years old, married and the mother of three school-aged children. With this loan, Afi hopes to buy fish to smoke for sale. Doing so means she would be able to assume responsibility for some family expenses.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase various goods to replenish her small grocery store.

loans.name: Akoele

texts.fr: Akoele L. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de céréale à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Akoele espère par ce crédit, faire des stocks de maïs, de mil, arachide et de haricot. Cette chance lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants
texts.en:
Akoele L. is 39 years old, married and the mother of five children. She is a retail vendor of cereal grains in Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, Akoele hopes to restock her inventory of corn, millet, peanuts and beans. This opportunity will allow her to provide for the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock inventory of corn, millet, peanuts and beans to meet customer demand

loans.name: Lyiomal

texts.fr: Lyiomal P. tient depuis 2 ans un magasin de dépôt fanmilk, à Lomé la capitale togolaise. Agé de 32 ans, Lyiomal est marié et père de 2 enfants dont le premier est sur les bancs de l’école. Ce commerce étant sa seule source de revenu, il espère avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son magasin pour accroître ses ventes et par là, ses gains, pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
For two years, Lyiomal P. has been running a Fan Milk (dairy retailer) shop in Lomé, the capital of Togo. He's 32 years old, married, and the father of 2 children, out of which the first one goes to school. This business being is only source of revenues, he hopes to use this loan to bolster his stock and to increase his sales, in order to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster his stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a variety of ingredients to produce her pastelitos.

loans.name: Soulemane

texts.fr: Soulemane W. est âgé de 31 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. Il est conducteur de taxi moto à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il détient jusque là la moto d’une autre personne et souhaite par ce crédit, le premier à FECECAV, acheter sa propre moto. Avec cette nouvelle moto, Soulemane espère faire plus de profits pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Soulemane W., age 31, is married and the father of one child. He drives a motorcycle taxi in Lomé, the capital of Togo. Until now, he's been using another person's motorcycle, and he wishes to use this first loan with FECECAV to buy his own motorcycle. With this new motorcycle, Soulemane hopes to increase its profit to provide for its family needs.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa T.  est âgée de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est boulangère depuis 3 ans à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle espère par ce crédit de FECECAV, se faire construire un nouveau four et aussi acheter des sacs de farine de blé ainsi que autres condiments nécessaires à l’exécution de son travail. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus de profits pour répondre aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kossiwa T., age 43, is married and the mother of 5 children. She's been a baker for 3 years in Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this FECECAV loan,she hopes to have a new oven built for her, and to buy sacks of wheat flour and other products necessary to her work. This will enable her to make more profits to provide for her children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a new oven and to buy sacks of wheat flour

loans.name: Alonefa

texts.fr: Alonefa W. est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale depuis plus de 3 ans, à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite avec ce crédit, augmenter la capacité de sa boutique en achetant des sacs de riz, des cartons de laits, de savons et autres produits pour répondre aux exigences sans cesse croissante de la clientèle. Il compte sur cette chance pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
For the past three years, Alonefa W. has been the proprietor of a grocery store in Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan he hopes to increase the amount of goods he has for sale by purchasing sacks of rice, cartons of milk, soap and other products to meet the growing customer demand. He is counting on this opportunity to improve his family’s way of life.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of rice, cartons of milk, soap and other products for retail sale

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr: Amah A. est revendeuse de friperies depuis plus de 2 ans à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 39 ans, A. est mariée et mère de 3 enfants enfant. Elle souhaite par ce crédit accroître la capacité de son commerce en achetant des habits à la mode afin de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus exigeante. Ses ventes lui permettront de se faire plus de profits pour satisfaire aux besoins de ses enfants
texts.en:
For more than two years, Amah A. has been a retail vendor of secondhand clothing in Lomé, the capital of Togo. The 39-year-old Amah is married and the mother of three children. With this loan she hopes to increase her trade by purchasing fashionable clothing to meet the needs of her growing clientele. Its sale would bring in more profit, enabling her to meet the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of secondhand clothing for retail sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more goods to produce fried food.

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
La señora Lola tiene 29 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Empeñosas de Patay”, ella desea tener un negocio en la venta de golosinas ya que cree que se gana mejor que con su actual negocio; junto a su esposo que trabaja en una planta minera mantienen a su tres hijos y con la venta de anticuchos, que vende en la ciudad de Huaraz en el puente Huascarán, atenúa algunas carencias económicas en casa; lo mas difícil para ella es no tener una casa propia y vivir en alquiler. 
Con este préstamo de s/.300 soles, que pagará en cuatro meses, comprará, aceite, platos, y una cocina a gas para poder atender mejor a sus hijos menores.
texts.en:
Señora Lola is 29 years old and a member of the community bank "Mujeres Empeñosas de Patay" (Persevering Women of Patay). She wants to have a business of of selling sweets because she believes she can earn more this way than with her present business. Together with her husband, who works in a mineral plant, they take care of three children. With the sales of anticuchos (skewered meats popular in the Andes) that she markets in the city of Huaraz in the port of Huascarán, she minimizes the economic scarcities in their home. The most difficult thing for her is not having her own home and having to rent. With this loan of 300 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy oil, plates, and a gas cooker, so ultimately she can better look after her young children.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy oil and disposable plates. Buy a gas cooker.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 49 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal “ Mujeres Rumbo al Éxito II”, ella tiene como meta arreglar la fachada de su casa, convertirlo en una tienda y vivir de su alquiler.  Tiene 4 hijos y es madre soltera, después de la separación con su esposo que era alcohólico, ella se ha dedicado a sacar adelante a sus hijos, a pesar de haber concluido una carrera en docencia de educación primaria ella manifiesta que no encuentra trabajo por lo que se le hace difícil dedicarse a su profesión.

Ella nos dice que gracias  a la zona donde vive; que es una zona comercial en la ciudad de Huaraz, puede alquilar su inmueble y así ayudarse con las rentas que le proporciona.  Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa a pedido, la misma que trae desde la ciudad (Lima) y lo reparte a domicilio.

Con este préstamo de s/. 300 soles, que pagará en cuatro cuotas, iniciará la reconstrucción de la fachada principal de su local para alquiler.
texts.en:
Señora María is 49 years old and member of the community bank "Mujeres Rumbo al Éxito II" (Women on course for success II). She has as a goal to fix the front of her home, convert it into a shop, and live from her rental. She has four children and is a single mother. After the separation with her husband who was an alcoholic, she has been dedicated to making a better life for her children. Despite having the education to become a teacher of primary school, she has not been able to encounter a job and it is difficult to make a living with her profession. She tells us that thanks to the area where she lives (she lives in a commercial zone of the city of Huaraz), she can rent her property and receive help from the income that it provides. She is dedicated to selling clothes by orders, which she picks up in the city (Lima) and delivers to her customers at her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: maintenance of her commercial property

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria tiene 58 años, pertenece al Banco comunal “Señor D. Mayo D. Cátac”, ella espera que sus dos últimos hijos sean profesionales, desea salir adelante trabajando en su negocio que es una bodega, donD. también venD. lanas para tejer frente a la placita Dos D. Mayo D. Cátac.

Su esposo es técnico en frotación D.  minerales, juntos se ayudan para poder educar a sus hijos, ella tiene seis hijos vivos D. los 9 que dio vida.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2000 soles que lo pagará en seis cuotas, comprará lanas, cervezas gaseosas, y quesos al por mayor y también aportará para que su hija pueda sacar su título profesional.
texts.en:
Victoria is 58 years old and belongs to the Communal Bank “Senor D. Mayo D. Catac”. She hopes that her children can study to be professionals, and she hopes to get ahead working in her convenient store. She also weaves wools there in her down time conversing with the people of Dos D. Mayo D. Catac. Her husband is a mineral technician, and both help in the education of their children. She has given birth to 9 children, and now takes care of 6. With this loan of $2,000 soles, which she will repay in six installments, she will buy wool, beer and refreshments, and bulk cheese. She will also contribute to her daughter’s professional education.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchas of wool, beer and refreshments, and bulk cheese.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela de 40 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Juan Pablo II”, ella piensa instalar un locutorio y un Internet, para poder tener mas ingresos ya que sus dos hijos están adolescentes y pronto ingresaran a estudiar una carrera superior.
Durante 15 años, ella se ha mantenido en su negocio, venta de abarrotes, que lo tiene en su propia casa o como ella dice en la casa de sus padres, a pesar que su esposo es mecánico de profesión, no se abastece lo suficiente para mantener a sus hijos, todos los productos que ofrece los  compra en Huaraz  de los mayoristas que le  ofertan en su propia casa.

Ella ha sabido crecer en este difícil negocio, a pesar, de las constantes competencias que se han presentado en su barrio  de pedregal que se encuentra  en la ciudad de Huaraz. Lo mas difícil para ella es cuando sus clientes  a veces se fían y después no le pagan.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200 soles, que lo pagará en 6 cuotas, ella comprará  productos al por mayor, como arroz, azúcar, bebidas gasificadas y alcohólicas,  para  surtir  su tienda.
texts.en:
Adela, 40, is a member of the Juan Pablo II ("John Paul II") community bank. She's planning to set up a "locutorio" (a shop that sells on-site phone and Internet services) in order to increase her income. Her children are teenagers now and she needs more money to pay for their future schooling. For 15 years, she's operated a grocery business in her house or, as she says, in her parent's house. Although her husband is a mechanic, there's not enough money to pay for all that their children need. She buys products for her shops from wholesalers in Huarez.

She has figured out how to grow in this difficult business even though she faces enormous competition from similar businesses in her neighborhood of Pedregal, a part of the city of Huarez. The hardest thing is when her customers buy on credit and then don't pay.

With this loan of S/.1,200 (1,200 Peruvian soles), to be repaid in 6 installments, she will buy wholesale supplies of products such as rice, sugar, sodas and liquor to supply her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for grocery business.

loans.name: Silvana Ericka

texts.es:
Silvana de 28 años pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres empeñosas de Patay” ella desea abrir una tienda de abarrotes y verduras para poder mantener a sus dos menores hijos ya que en estos momentos se ha separado de su conviviente.
Una de sus peores dificultades ah sido superar la infidelidad de su conviviente y la enfermedad de su hijo de un año que sufre con problemas en el hígado; ella se dedica a dar pensión a estudiantes universitarios, desde hace 11 meses en su casa alquilada que se encuentra en el jirón Sebastián de aliste del distrito de independencia, de la ciudad de Huaraz.

Con este préstamo de s/. 500.00 soles que pagará en 4 cuotas, ella se abastecerá de víveres para su pequeño negocio donde comprará un saco de arroz, azúcar y una caja de aceite.
texts.en:
Silvana is 28 years old and belongs to the Communal Bank “Hard Working Women of Patay” She hopes to open a grocery store in order to support her youngest children now that she has separated from her husband. One of the most difficult things that she has had to overcome was the infidelity of her husband, and the illness of her one year old son who suffers from liver problems. She has been dedicated to renting rooms to university students for 11 months. She does this from the home she rents in the city of Huaraz. With this loan of 500 soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will supply the tenants with a bag of rice, sugar, and a box of oil.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of consumables and living necesities at whole sale

loans.name: Eudosia

texts.es:
La señora Eudosia tiene 40 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Mayo de Cátac, ella espera comprarse un auto para que su hijo trabaje en una línea que cubre la ruta Huaraz – cátac; ella tiene cinco hijos; dos ya son casados. Junto a su esposo quien trabaja en una planta de minerales espera sacar adelante a sus tres hijos que se encuentran a su cargo, desde hace 15 años vende abarrotes en su propia casa que queda en l ciudad de Cátac y ahora ah logrado tener el servicio de sistema de Internet en su casa que lo brinda a los clientes de la zona por medio de cabinas de Internet, que es atendido por sus hijos.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000 soles, que pagará en 6 cuotas, ella comprará gaseosas, cervezas al por mayor para su bodega.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eudosia is 40 years old and belongs to the Communal Bank "Señor de Mayo de Cátac.” She hopes to buy herself a car so that her son can work in a route that covers the route between Huraz and Cátac. She has 5 children, two are now married. Along with her husband, who works in a mineral plant, she hopes to help her three reaming children succeed. She has been selling groceries from her home for 15 years, and it is located Cátac city and now she has been able to obtain Internet service in her home which she then subsequently provides for her customers in the neighborhood via Internet cabins, which is attended to by her children. With this loan for S/1,000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will buy soda pop and beer at wholesale to sell in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soda pop and beer at wholesale to sell in her store.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La señora Felicitas tiene 85 años de edad pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Rumbo Al éxito II”, después de la muerte de su esposo ella ha buscado que sus hijos se unan y los cinco que aún viven puedan vivir con la herencia que su esposo les dejó afirma que su vida siempre ha estado llena de alegrías, aun cuando se hizo cargo de su casa, siempre; en la actualidad vive con sus dos hijas y cinco nietos que le ayudan a seguir viviendo.
Sin embargo lucha infranqueablemente para ayudar en casa, ella al igual que su hija trae ropas por mayor de la ciudad de lima y los vende entre clientes ya conocidos.

Con este préstamo de 300 soles, que pagará en cuatro cuotas, ella ayudará a su hija para que arregle la fachada de su casa que se encuentra en una zona comercial en la ciudad de Huaraz y así la puedan alquilar y generarse otros ingresos.
texts.en:
Felicitas is 85 years old and belongs to the Communal Bank "Mujeres Rumbo Al éxito II." After the death of her husband she looked for her chidren to stay together and the five of them still can live on the inheritance that her husband left them. She says that her life has always been full of joy, even when she had to manage her home herself; today she lives with her 2 daughters and 5 grandchildren that help her continue living. Nevertheless she insurmountably fights to help around the house. She, like her daughter, brings clothing at wholesale from Lima and sells it to customers. With this loan for 300 soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will help her daughter fix the front wall of her home which is located in a commercial zone of Huaraz city and in this way she will be able to rent it and generate additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain the front wall of her home

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El Sr. Fernando está solicitando un préstamo para poner un portón que le está haciendo falta a su casa y que esté más segura.

El Sr. Fernando nos comento que hace ya barios años tuvo un accidenté donD. lo atropellaron y quedo mal D. L. cintura y el trabajo lo pensiono ese es su ingreso D. el y D. un hijo D. 13 años que vive con el.

Fernando por los gastos del accidenté no le a podido hacer mejoras a su casa, y el está solicitando un préstamo $ 425.00 dlls para poner el portón a su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Fernando is asking for a loan to install a front door on his house to make it more secure. Fernanco tells us that a few years ago he had an accident where he was knocked down and now has a bad back and his work’s pension is his income to support his 13 year old son who lives with him. Fernando, because of the expenses of the accident, has not been able to make improvements on his home and he is asking for a loan of $425.00 to put a secure door on his home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a secure front door

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Roberto B. no está solicitando un préstamo para poner el piso de concretó al frente de su casa ya que cuando llueve se le inunda el lugar y el agua se va para dentro de su casa y los muebles ya están algo dañados por la humedad.

Sr. Roberto trabaja en una compañía que se dedican a la construcción de casas el está en el aria de electricista esté es su ingreso familiar.

Roberto nos contó que el por el momento se esta haciendo cargo de sus 2 hijos porque se separa de su esposa.

El Sr. Roberto está solicitando un préstamo por $575.00 dlls para poner le piso al frente de su casa.
texts.en:
Roberto Baez is soliciting this loan in order to lay a cement patio in front of his home. This needs to be done in order to stop the flooding of his house when it rains, which ruins the furniture and the home itself. Roberto is an electrician and works for a home construction company for his primary source of income. He is currently the only care taker of his two children because he has separated from his wife. Roberto is soliciting this loan of $575 dollars to lay a cement patio in front of his home.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put a cement patio in front of his home.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene tienda donde además vende  juguetes y útiles escolares,  lleva en el negocio un tiempo aproximado de 6 años, tiempo en el cual ha visto qué:  la demanda de las demás personas que le compran le ha ayudado a poder atreverse a invertir mas.
Miguel es  maestro de educación primaria, es soltero, esta estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas  en la universidad, donde los recursos los obtiene de las ganancias del negocio.
Los sueños que él tiene, es llegar a tener y administrar una empresa mas grande.
Su crédito lo necesita para invertir en juguetes durante esta temporada, donde la navidad es una buena época para la venta de juguetes, así mismo invertira en mas cosas para poder vender en su pequeña tienda, donde por ejemplo vende, cremas, perfumes, rasudoras, pasta dental, cepillos, jabón, cintas para zapatos, aceite para bebé; dulces, chicles, etc......
texts.en:
Miguel has a store where sells toys and school supplies. He has been doing this for 6 years and has seen the demand of the people has helped him reinvest in his business. Miguel is a primary school teacher, single, and is studying business administration in the university, which he funds with the earnings from his business. His dream is to become an administrator of a large firm. He needs this credit in order to invest in more supplies that he could sell in his small store. Since the Christmas season is approaching it is a good time to stock up on toys, and also products such as creams, perfumes, razors, tooth pastes, brushes, soaps, shoe laces, baby oil, candies, gum, etc…

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for his store

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
El Sr. Cirilo tiene un negocio de venta de tacos desde hace ya más de 6 años  su ubicación donde el vende es  cerca de su casa a fueras de una escuela. 
 El Sr. Cirilo esta solicitando un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls para comprar mas inventario a su negocio y así preparar diferentes guisados para las tacos y también tener mas variedad de comidas para vender; Así su negocio va a crecerá más en ventas ya que es la fuente de ingreso de se familia. 
Cirilo ya a tenido crédito con Fvp y con Kiva este seria su segundo crédito
texts.en:
Mr. Cirilo has had a business selling tacos for over 6 years now. The location of his business is close to his house, outside of a school.

Mr. Cirilo is requesting a loan for $1,000.00 to buy more inventory for his business and in that way prepare different stews for his tacos and also have more variety of meals to sell. This will allow his business to grow more in sales, since it is the source of income to his family.

Cirilo has had loans with Fvp and with Kiva this would be his second loan.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying inventory

loans.name: Jesus Angel

texts.es:
La foto se tomo con la esposa del señor ya que el se encontraba trabando tiempo extra para poder tener mas dinero.

Jesus Angel V. M. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

Jesús Ángel V. M. desea reparar su baño como pueden observar en la foto esta en muy malas condiciones y se ve una mancha negra la cual se fue haciendo por la humedad, teme que vaya a ver problemas de infección con alguno de sus 2 hijos o en el mismo y al prestarlo le da vergüenza. Quiere poner azulejo en el baño y cambiar accesorios como regadera y taza de baño. La cantidad que el solicita es de $700 dólares.

Jesús Ángel V. M. trabaja en maquiladora y lo que le gana es poco para poderlo hacer necesita de nuestra ayuda.
texts.en:
Jesús Ángel V. M. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances. The photo is taken with his wife and he has been working overtime in order to earn more money.

Jesús Ángel V. M. wants to repair his bathroom. As you can see in the photo, it is in very poor condition and there is a black stain that has formed due to the humidity. He is afraid that he or his two children will have problems with infection and he is ashamed to let anyone use it. He wants to put tile in the bathroom and change fixtures like the shower head and toilet. The loan he is requesting is for $700. Jesús Ángel V. M. works in a maquiladora (factory) and he does not earn much but in order to improve his bathroom he needs our help.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair/remodel bathroom

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita V. Ramírez tiene hijos grandes los cuales ya necesitan su propia recamara para la privacidad de cada uno. La Señora primero con el préstamo va hacer la construcción de un cuarto en la parte de atrás y en caso de completar hará su proyecto en la parte alta. Su casa es de INFONAVIT una dependencia de Gobierno las cuales son iguales todas y muy pequeñas pero ella recurre a nosotros para ampliarla a su gusto. Solicita la cantidad de $600 dólares.
